title: Global Relations Manager
description:
Experience implementing repeatable processes and driving automation or standardization
5+ years of experience in program or project management
A Bachelor’s degree or higher
Experience owning program strategy and end to end delivery
Experience defining and executing against program requirements
Bachelor’s degree
5+ years of experience in Brand protection role.
Demonstrated ability to direct and manage investigations.
Exceptional people skills, with ability to calmly navigate rough waters and negotiate win-win solutions.
Proven experience developing and presenting Poweroint (or similar) presentations. Comfortable presenting to large groups of external stakeholders.
Amazon's Brand Protection team is looking for a Manager to be part of the Global Brand Relations team. The manager will contribute to Amazon’s global brand protection efforts and ensuring that customers can buy with confidence on Amazon. This manager will own relationships with key thought leader brands, associations, and government agencies and will be responsible for evangelizing how Amazon is tackling issues such as product authenticity, product integrity, copyright and trademark, and other product quality issues. You will also have the opportunity to contribute to the development of policies, processes and tools to address product integrity challenges in collaboration with teams across Amazon.

The ideal candidate possesses strong business judgment, analytical thinking, is comfortable managing multiple responsibilities within a fast-paced environment and has demonstrated experience in developing and implementing brand protection strategies. Exceptional communication, solution-oriented and relationship-building are essential attributes to succeed in this role.

In this position you will:
Develop and maintain key relationships with external stakeholders including global brands, government agencies and associations on product integrity issues.
Work with global external stakeholders to develop strategies for tackling their unique problems.
Assist in developing international and region-specific policies and policy recommendations to improve both reactive and proactive enforcement, maximize automation and efficiency in resolving brand owner issues and identify and achieve measurable goals.
Work closely across Amazon teams on policies, processes and tools to identify threats to brands and to Amazon’s customers and sellers.
Partner with Legal and Investigations to quickly handle and resolve critical and time-sensitive escalations.
Liaise with internal business teams to address vendor concerns.
Participate in conferences and external meetings focused on product integrity issues. This will include frequent domestic and international travel (~20%).
Develop and deliver educational and training materials for both internal and external consumption.
Experience in e-commerce environment.
Recognized contributor within the brand protection industry.
Strong critical thinker.
Able to work independently to develop and execute strategies with minimal supervision.
Outstanding written and oral communication skills.
A passion for IP protection, and a strong bias for action in addressing and resolving critical threats to both brand reputation and Amazon’s customers.
Willingness and ability to travel, including overseas.
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

title: Sustainability Innovation Consultant
description:
7+ years of experience in consulting, solutions development, product management, and/or transformation roles
Industry experience in Sustainability; Example: energy/water management, renewable energy, supply-chain (GHG emission tracking and analysis, packaging, transportation)
Bachelors Degree
Do you have a passion for how industries can utilize cloud technologies to accelerate their sustainability efforts? Are you an expert in how companies and their partners are using cloud technology to revolutionize the strategy, planning, execution of sustainability initiatives? Do you thrive in a cross-functional environment, working closely with some of the best and brightest in the world?

As the Senior Sustainability Innovation Consultant, you will have an exciting opportunity to shape and deliver on a global strategy to help customers accelerate their sustainability transformations by leveraging the AWS cloud computing platform to position and drive the right technology solutions to address customer needs. As a Principal Sustainability Innovation consultant you think strategically and analytically about our customer's business and technical challenges and form innovative ideas to solve them. You have a keen sense of ownership and entrepreneurship, and, most importantly, you know how to earn trust, think big, and work cross-organizationally to deliver results. You influence others to follow with data and customer advocacy.

The right candidate will be a passionate technologist, have broad and deep experience with sustainability initiatives in multiple industries, and demonstrated go-to-market success. Sustainability is a broad domain, but general level knowledge plus expert knowledge in at least one specific sustainability domain is required. They will have a proven track record of leading complex solutions programs. They will also have working knowledge of cloud computing and the related sustainability application platforms and initiatives.

Role & Responsibilities
Working backwards from customers, identify solutions themes, prioritize a portfolio of solution(s) for each solution theme, and AWS value proposition(s) for sustainability initiatives.
Together with the broader team, develop the technical side of the strategic plan for AWS, to engage enterprise customers and partners in this industry.
Represent AWS best-practices around innovation, product management, software engineering, data and analytics, and other platform capabilities to work
Develop C-suite and line-of-business relationships within customer organization
Develop, propose, and deliver innovation offerings and engagements working with sales enablement, regional business development teams, and account teams.
Demonstrate commercial acumen to assist customers in building value propositions / business cases / supporting financial models
An understanding of the 17 United Nations sustainable development goals and IPCC studies, and how they apply to customers in different industries.
Strong technical acumen and understanding of emerging disruptive technologies, like cloud computing, IoT, Data Analytics, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, AR/VR etc.
Passion for the targeted industry sectors – good understanding of how sustainability initiatives operate and the unique characteristics of the industry ecosystems.
Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills. Experience communicating with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across multiple teams.
Passion for cloud technologies – deep understanding of public and hybrid cloud platforms.
Technical knowledge of applications, platforms, and data ecosystem, with ability to go deep on technical aspects to understand current and future customer needs and present AWS technical benefits.
Excellent business and financial acumen and negotiations skills.

title: Mobile Software Development Engineer
description:
2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Be part of the team that is building something that empowers people to be their own boss.

We are seeking an experienced Mobile Software Development Engineer that will work out of Austin, TX, Seattle/Bellevue WA, Santa Cruz CA or Toronto Canada.

Amazon's delivery app is the system that collaborates with crowd-sourced and third-party delivery partners to complete deliveries for many of Amazon's programs. Our mobile application works in concert with our advanced logistics systems and predictive analytics. These technologies allow delivery partners to onboard, schedule delivery times in advance or on demand, and be guided through their deliveries with in-app mapping, navigation, and much more.

As a mobile engineer you will work on cutting edge technology to build software that will allow package delivery to occur on a global scale. You will build a variety of software ranging from ones that interact with devices and sensors on vehicles to ones that support critical, time-sensitive workflows for our drivers.

You will work with our product management team to develop the strategy, followed by architecture and implementation of critical safety features into our mobile and back end platform. You will also own software in all phases of the software life-cycle from architecture and design through deployment and release. You will learn about Amazon’s logistics network, interact with other teams to build optimized systems, and have autonomy to deliver software which impacts multiple delivery provider programs.

We are looking to hire both iOS and Android engineers. You do not need experience on both platforms. We are open to candidates working from any of our 3 locations: Austin, TX, Seattle, WA, Santa Cruz CA or Toronto Canada.

Completed Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
Experience working on a mobile platform. For Android, experience in designing and developing Android Applications using Java, Kotlin, and Android Developers Kit, or for iOS, experience designing and developing Objective-C and/or Swift multi-threaded mobile applications.
Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project
Excellent communication, sharp analytical abilities, and proven design skills.
Ability to drive consensus within a team and influence outcomes in significant technical decision-making
Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software features, and technical designs.
Demonstrated ability to mentor other software developers to develop all aspects of their engineering skill sets

title: Amazon Connect Specialty Consultant
description:
Bachelor’s degree required
10+ years of experience as a contact center technology architect, enterprise IT Architect or senior contact center developer working with leading contact center technology platforms and applications, such as Avaya, Cisco, Genesys, Verint, NICE, Salesforce, etc.
Hands-on technical practitioner and individual contributor
Hands-on experience working on the design, development and deployment of contact center solutions at scale
Would you like a career that gives you opportunities to help customers and partners use cloud computing web services to do big new things faster and at lower cost? Do you have a background in enterprise call centers, and a passion for driving innovation into existing IT organizations? Are you comfortable working on-site in a variety of business environments, leading teams through high-impact projects blending the newest technology with existing operational methodologies and tooling? Are you passionate about helping customers solve the people, organizational and process issues preventing them realizing the benefits of cloud?

At AWS, we’re hiring experienced consultants with a background in enterprise call centers to help our enterprise customers understand, plan and implement best practices around migrating, building, managing and operating Amazon Connect within their AWS cloud environments. Our consultants will deliver proof-of-concept projects, re-usable artifacts, reference architectures, and lead implementation projects to assist some of the world’s leading enterprises transform their call centers to Amazon Connect and the AWS platform.

We’re looking for someone who is passionate about:
Working on the cutting edge of innovative AWS products and services
Maintaining domain knowledge and expertise in enterprise call centers, workforce management, Artificial Intelligence and CRM platforms
Implementing and extending frameworks and methodologies commonly used by enterprises to assess, migrate, and transform the call center experience
Architecting and building large-scale solutions, which integrate smoothly in cloud and hybrid operating models for supporting Amazon Connect
Providing guidance on the people, organizational, security and compliance aspects of transforming the contact center to the Cloud
Setting-up and configuring AWS services in-line with best practices
Coaching customers and partner teams to be self-sufficient
Responsibilities include:
Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn how to build and move to production grade AWS environments that support Amazon Connect
Solutions - Define and deliver on-site Professional Services engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in pre-sales on-site visits, understanding customer requirements, proposing and delivering packaged offerings, and delivering custom solution engagements, specifically focused on call center organization, processes, tooling and integration. Software development experience with building contact center integrations is a plus.
Delivery - Engagements include short on-site projects proving the use of AWS services to support new distributed computing solutions that often span private cloud and public cloud services. Engagements will include integration and adaption of existing enterprise call centers into Amazon Connect.
Insights - Work with AWS product, engineering and support teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps. Share real world implementation challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater value from use of AWS cloud services. Contribute to best practice in the form of whitepapers and playbooks.
Partnering – Work with new vendors to help them become MSPs and enable and upskill existing partners.This is a customer facing role.
This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations will be required to deliver professional services when needed.

Computer Science, Information Systems, or Engineering background preferred; Master’s degree desired
10+ years of experience building call center / collaboration / telephony platforms in a Cloud or On-Premises environment, particularly building application integration capabilities for CRM/ WFM platforms
Professional Services or Consulting experience in highly-visible customer-facing roles
Familiarity with Amazon Connect capabilities, benefits, and required deployment skills
Visible IT Industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT call centers and infrastructure.
Enterprise call center / telecomm implementation and operations experience
Serverless development experience including complex integrations with Amazon Lex, Lambda, Redshift, Aurora, Kinesis and Dynamo DB
Software Development / DevOps experience with integrating contact center platforms, CRMs, WFMs and AI
Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Microsoft, IBM, Citrix, VMware, Oracle, HP, etc.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Responsibility for designing, implementing and operating contact centers or telecommunication infrastructures within an enterprise environment

title: Global Claims Management Senior Program Manager
description:
12+ years of finance experience or a related analytical field.
BA/BS degree.
10+ years of experience in claims or Risk Program Management.
Play a leading role in operational risk improvement at Amazon.com, where we have a history and tradition of leading the world in innovative technologies and services. Amazon is seeking an experienced Global Claims Management Senior Program Manager to support an industry leading claims management team. They will partner with internal and external business partners to develop, improve, and streamline global processes and procedures for the handling, administration and compliance of insured claims that will continue to scale with Amazon’s growth. They will also perform risk assessments to deep dive backup plans and strategies for alternative critical systems.

The position will report to senior management; within the Global Claims Management and team. The role will begin as an individual contributor but is expected to manage a small team over time. Roles and responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following:

Roles and Responsibilities
Develop and foster strategic relationships, working collaboratively and in partnership with internal and external stakeholders, including legal, accounting, operations, third-party administrators (TPAs) actuaries and other service providers.
Lead the evaluation and collection of business needs requirements to further automate and/or simplify processes for Workers' Compensation, Auto, Property and Liability support for Amazon.com claims management.
Partner with subsidiaries, lead initiatives to develop IT strategies and integration support for claims multiple management programs.
Lead initiatives which will maintain controllership and robust global operating procedures within Amazon, Whole Foods Market and our support vendors.
Develop a risk assessments process and implement backup plans and strategies for critical systems as needed, and provide guidance for short and long term solutions.
Manage claim related data collection to develop and monitor Amazon’s Total Cost of Risk (TCOR).
Provide guidance to internal teams in support of TPA management claims audits to ensure compliance and accuracy.
Lead and partner with internal teams to conduct RFPs for claims management vendor support.
Maintain a working knowledge of Risk Management Information Systems (RMIS) and reporting.
Collaborate on business reviews and whitepapers for internal stakeholders.
ARM, CPCU, or similar designation.
Well organized, detail oriented, and able to adjust to changing priorities.
Computer skills, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Available for domestic and/or international travel.

Experience with developing training documentation (lesson plans, procedures, reports, etc.

ARU Maintenance Certifications such as Essentials, Advanced

title: Optimization Engineer
description:
5+ years in a hands on software development role in C++
2+ years of memory, frame rate, or load time optimization experience
1+ launched software products
Bachelor’s degree in a Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
JOIN AMAZON GAME STUDIOS AND HELP SHAPE THE FUTURE OF GAMES!

Amazon Game Studios is seeking an exceptionally skilled and enthusiastic Optimization Engineer to join our team either in Seattle, WA or remotely. In addition to implementing game systems, you will help optimize memory, frame rate, and load times on an exciting new mobile game and future mobile games.

The ideal candidate has a proven track record of delivering robust and scalable engineering solutions and optimizing existing systems to run faster and in less memory. You have deep technical knowledge of game engines especially around their usual performance bottlenecks. You are skilled with profile guided optimization and are comfortable owning optimization efforts from start to finish. You possess strong critical thinking and communication skills. You are driven to make the best games in the industry on a highly collaborative, multidisciplinary team of designers, artists, and engineers.

Responsibilities:
Dive deep to understand and optimize memory, frame rate, and load time issues in a mobile game client
Design and implement robust systems and tools to deliver quality gameplay experiences
Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team to create engaging games that will delight our players
Amazon Games applies the principles of Amazonian culture to the world of game design. We have a diverse team of talented, creative people pairing their love of making games with the unique strengths that come with being part of Amazon. Across all of our teams and locations, we are united by a common purpose: to share great gaming experiences with customers around the world. We believe in a future where everyone is a gamer and everyone can create, compete, collaborate and connect through games, and we are looking for the right people to help us build that future. With the power of Twitch and AWS at your fingertips, you will have the chance to innovate in gameplay, creativity, marketing, and technology, while working alongside some of the smartest and most creative minds in the industry.

About Us

Inclusive Culture, Work/Life Balance, & Career Growth
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We offer ten employee-led affinity groups with 190 global chapters, innovative benefits, and annual and ongoing learning experiences (including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences). Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance and offers flexible working hours. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, our team is dedicated to supporting you with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice.

7+ years of game development experience with multiple shipped titles
Shipped one or more titles on Unreal 4 and/or in the mobile games space
Experience wearing multiple hats on a small team
Passionate mobile gamer with in-depth domain knowledge

title: Solutions Architect - Migration Services
description:
Experience in software implementation and delivery
Practical knowledge of computer software, hardware and networks
Experience interacting with and presenting to customers or internal teams
Ability to clearly articulate technical concepts to a business audience
2+ years of experience in Solutions Architect or technical advisory role with similar type experience
The AWS Migration Services team is recruiting a Solutions Architect to assist with helping customers plan large scale migrations to the cloud by developing financial assessments that address customer objectives using AWS Migration Evaluator. Migration Evaluator, formerly TSO Logic, delivers accurate data-driven recommendations to right-size and right-cost compute - with more features being developed.

In this role, you will work closely with customers and internal teams to schedule and deliver successful software implementations and ensure top quality results are being presented to AWS customers by articulating assessment results and analyses to customers and internal stakeholders. You will support enabled AWS field teams and AWS Partners as they develop their own assessments using Migration Evaluator. You will work with the customer, AWS account teams, delivery team, AWS Partners, and senior leadership to develop and operate our enablement programs to train AWS field teams and AWS Partner teams to leverage Migration Evaluator. Our service is used by customers, partners, and internal Amazon Web Services teams on a global basis.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a focus on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy. Our team is mainly focused on supporting customers and this can mean aligning your daily schedule with your meetings, or your personal needs (appointments, etc). Our team is based in Vancouver, Canada with a global presence across multiple countries and time zones so we're flexible with people working from home and we record meetings and minutes/agendas to allow for inclusivity of all time zones and availability.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re committed to the growth and development of every member of the Migration Evaluator team. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction of the Client Delivery team which will improve the life of all of our teams.

The Migration Evaluator team is a growth environment - we’re hiring and scaling to meet the needs of our customers. You’ll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will get to help develop others along the way as well.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Come join a smart, innovative team that’s obsessed with serving its customers and is having fun doing so in a start-up-like environment!

Familiarity with AWS architecture (S3, EC2, etc.) or AWS Certified SA Professional
Familiarity with data center and/or cloud infrastructure management
Familiarity with licensing models and strategies for Windows and SQL, Oracle, Linux

description:

Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.
Amazon’s Operations Technology teams are the technical engines that support Amazon’s mission of being Earth’s most customer-centric company. We build the software and services that touch every Amazon customer globally and innovate solutions for logistics, supply chain optimization, and transportation.

We are looking for engineers with a strong sense of ownership, customer obsession and a passion for delivering creative solutions and driving best experience on an unprecedented scale by dealing with large scale of data in a complicated distributed system. As part of the team, you will be given the chance to have a significant impact on our systems, our business and most importantly, our customers as we take on significant challenges that can reshape the ecommerce industry.

Locations include: Seattle, Tempe, Nashville, NYC, Boston, Vancouver, Toronto, Austin.

Technically sound in software development activities

Help us push the availability and reliability of cloud infrastructure to new heights!
AWS Infrastructure is looking for an experienced Software Development Engineer to build next generation data acquisition and monitoring software for our data centers. If you are an experienced software developer interested in defining and delivering new services to help fuel the explosive growth of AWS then this is the job for you.

title: System Development Engineer - Amazon Chime POOLING REQ
description:
BS or Masters in Computer Science & 3+ years of experience
Are you excited by the prospect of solving some of the hardest and most valued technical challenges of cloud computing? Do you want to apply your deep analytical and engineering skills to the space of enterprise collaboration and productivity apps? Come join us at AWS!

The Amazon Web Services’ Productivity Applications team is looking for an engineer to help us build and operate Amazon Chime (https://chime.aws/) - a service that addresses our enterprise customers’ needs. We are specifically looking for leaders who want to build the best customer experiences.

The things we are working on are in response to loud and clear feedback from customers about the daily pain points their workers deal with in collaborating, communicating and sharing documents and information. Leveraging AWS’ scale, reliability, flexibility, and ease of use, we will offer customers an easy to manage and cost effective solution that solves many of these these pain points. We are working hard to define and build an early version of this exciting service and launch it for customers as quickly as possible to get feedback and iterate.

We are looking for a highly effective engineer that can make an immediate difference and help design and deliver systems while maintaining a constant customer focus. You will work with your peers and product management team to tackle hard problems with a growing AWS service.

Preferred locations are Seattle, WA or the Washington, DC area, but we are open to exceptional remote candidates as well.

Experience with SIP, RTP, and other VoIP Concepts
Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and/or distributed systems
Full stack engineer with experience in developing Java, Python, or JavaScript (node.js) applications
Experience with telecom industry problem sets, including Local Number Portability (LNP), SMS, and IMS/Intelligent Network design
Familiar with open source SIP/PSTN stacks
Experience influencing software engineering best practices within your team
Experience writing unit and system level tests using dependency injection frameworks and object mocking.
Ability to take raw product requirements and create architectures and designs to bring them to life
Strong attention to detail
Ability to think creatively and solve problems
Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role
About Us
Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. title: Physical Security Industry Specialist
description:
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years of working in security, hazardous, or emergency situations.
2+ years in a leadership role.
2+ years of experience in security industry standards, policies, and best practices.
2+ years of experience with Crime Prevention through Environmental Design (CPTED)
5+ years of Technical Program Management experience in a related industry, including hands-on management of large, cross-functional software efforts
The Special Programs, Evaluations, and Response (SPEAR) Special Testing Team (STT) responsibilities are to engage in information gathering exercises and use this information to drive change to the security posture of Amazon Web Services (AWS) sites. STT core functions include selecting, assessing and reporting security concerns to leadership and internal customers. By utilizing company-wide resources we constantly enhance AWS security posture through an independent verification process. SPEAR/STT applies appropriate assessment methodologies to evaluate security measures as well as operational risks to our employees, data, and physical assets.

You will be managing tight deadlines, being extremely flexible, driving results, detail orientated, identifying, assessing, planning and coordinating operational activities related to the physical security of AWS and its internal customers. This includes maintaining a high degree of situational awareness in a wide variety of global environments. You can be open to new challenges, extremely good at multi-tasking, innovative, creative, self-directed and a great team player. You will drive continuous process improvement and collaborate effectively with aggressive cross-functional business teams to solve problems and implement new solutions.

You will be required to follow the policies, procedures, and team rules of engagement (ROE) without deviation. You will deal effectively with ambiguity, as well as independent planning, making decisions, and managing operational activities that are extremely fluid. The SPEAR team operates globally 24/7. Must be able to travel 50-75% sometimes with little notice.

You will have the opportunity to be an effective leader, innovate and creative when working to solve problems and demonstrate excellent judgment while under pressure. You will also be able to operate autonomously, use discretion when dealing with sensitive information, and apply sound business principles and data analysis to identify problems and apply appropriate actions.

You must be able to perform strenuous physical activities, must be willing to work in austere environments, and must be able to handle stressful situations.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Preferred Qualifications:
Proficiency with MS Office Suite and programs to include Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook, etc.
Experience managing efforts in Tableau
First-hand working knowledge of current web technologies
Experience with business applications such as Word, Excel and Project
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to concisely and effectively address questions while providing subject matter expertise to management across diverse global sites.
Proven ability to accurately take decisive action based on available information in a timely manner.
Willingness to be active in the training, coaching, and development of the team and external organizations.
Possession of any or all of the following certifications: Certified Protection Professional (CPP), Physical Security Professional (PSP), Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP), or Certified Emergency Manager (CEM), etc.
Previous law enforcement, military, investigative, technical, security, Special Operations, Red / Blue / Purple Teaming, penetration testing, or social engineering background highly desired
Strong bias for action and "get it done" attitude
The ability to comfortably and confidently present to all levels within the enterprise and to work with both technical and non-technical individuals.
The ability to deal with ambiguity and a changing environment, as well as a rapid work pace.
A proven track record of being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow through on projects.
Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others, and strong analytical thinking skills are critical to success in this position
Fluency and comfort with business applications such as Word, Excel and Project.
Project management, Process Improvement or Quality certifications desired.
Strong oral and written communication skills are crucial, as well as ability to scope technical requirements and prioritize
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role

title: Global Claims Management Senior Program Manager
description:
12+ years of finance experience or a related analytical field.
BA/BS degree.
10+ years of experience in claims or Risk Program Management.
Play a leading role in operational risk improvement at Amazon.com, where we have a history and tradition of leading the world in innovative technologies and services. Amazon is seeking an experienced Global Claims Management Senior Program Manager to support an industry leading claims management team. They will partner with internal and external business partners to develop, improve, and streamline global processes and procedures for the handling, administration and compliance of insured claims that will continue to scale with Amazon’s growth. They will also perform risk assessments to deep dive backup plans and strategies for alternative critical systems.

The position will report to senior management; within the Global Claims Management and team. The role will begin as an individual contributor but is expected to manage a small team over time. Roles and responsibilities may include, but are not limited to, the following:

Roles and Responsibilities
Develop and foster strategic relationships, working collaboratively and in partnership with internal and external stakeholders, including legal, accounting, operations, third-party administrators (TPAs) actuaries and other service providers.
Lead the evaluation and collection of business needs requirements to further automate and/or simplify processes for Workers' Compensation, Auto, Property and Liability support for Amazon.com claims management.
Partner with subsidiaries, lead initiatives to develop IT strategies and integration support for claims multiple management programs.
Lead initiatives which will maintain controllership and robust global operating procedures within Amazon, Whole Foods Market and our support vendors.
Develop a risk assessments process and implement backup plans and strategies for critical systems as needed, and provide guidance for short and long term solutions.
Manage claim related data collection to develop and monitor Amazon’s Total Cost of Risk (TCOR).
Provide guidance to internal teams in support of TPA management claims audits to ensure compliance and accuracy.
Lead and partner with internal teams to conduct RFPs for claims management vendor support.
Maintain a working knowledge of Risk Management Information Systems (RMIS) and reporting.
Collaborate on business reviews and whitepapers for internal stakeholders.
ARM, CPCU, or similar designation.
Well organized, detail oriented, and able to adjust to changing priorities.
Computer skills, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Available for domestic and/or international travel.

title: Senior Product and Customer Insights Manager
description:
· Japanese language skills (reading, writing, speaking) at the Japanese-Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) Level N2 equivalent or above
Are you Customer obsessed and eager to propose opportunities and influence business decisions to improve the Consumer and Seller experience across our different Amazon businesses? Amazon is looking for an experienced, talented and highly motivated individual to joinour Customer Experience Strategy team to support the Japan and worldwide businesses.

As a Senior Product and Customer Insights Manager, you will own and contribute to studies that measure Amazon's end-to-end experience. You will drive studies across multiple product lines (e.g., media, consumer electronics, apparel), geographies and departments (Retail, Marketplace, Digital), partnering with senior business leaders in developing studies and following-up on actionable findings. The role will allow you to make a real impact for our customers from Day 1 and provide a dynamic, innovative and fast-paced environment to constantly build your skill set and address new challenges.

You will help Amazon continually raise the bar and help achieve our vision: to be Earth's Most Customer-Centric Company. If this role is right for you, you will be excited about the opportunity to be our Customers' advocate and influence their experience on Amazon!

Your responsibilities will include:
Manage ambiguity: understand complex business problems across business units, geographies and product lines to create hypotheses and translate this into analysis requirements and identify meaningful insights that help Amazon improve our customer experience
Study Management: lead large and complex studies, including scoping with business leaders, study design, data collection, data analysis, recommendations, and presenting results to senior management
Stakeholder management: Build strong relations with stakeholders to understand priorities, define the roadmap, and to collaborate on studies and actions to improve our customers' experience
Team: support hiring and on-boarding of new team members and contribute to our high-performing culture

The right candidate will:
Have a passion for continuously improving customer experience
Have experience influencing and earning the trust of senior stakeholders and moving business teams to take action
Have significant creativity and excellent business judgment
Have a strong sense of urgency and commitment
Be a self-starter and an independent thinker who follow-ups on responsibilities in a timely manner while also being a strong team player
Be a problem solver who always thinks about what to do next
Have excellent analytical capability

Possess flexibility and have a track record of delivering results in a fast-paced, highly ambiguous work environment

Working Location
The employee can work from anywhere in the US with the opportunity to relocate to Tokyo, Japan.

Robust quantitative and qualitative analytical skills, excellent attention to detail, and good business acumen
Strong communicator with experience in facilitation across all levels; skilled at addressing both large and small audiences across multiple leadership levels and functions
Strong oral English and Japanese language communication skills, including experience discussing and reviewing results with senior management
Excellent English writing skills, able to produce and finalize complex documents
Experience in an international work environment in areas such as management consulting, internet, technology, retail, consumer goods or research firms
Advanced degree (e.g., MBA) preferred

description:

High school or equivalent diploma
This position requires up to 80% Travel. When not traveling, the location is virtual and can be located in any state in the United States.

Reliability, Maintenance, and Engineering (RME) is hiring for Robotics Technical Trainer to join the RME Technical Learning Team! At Amazon we believe that Every Day is still Day One! We’re working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people.

We continue to develop technical courses, skills-based training, practical exercises and assessments for our Maintenance teams who maintain equipment within our Fulfillment, Transportation, and Global Specialty Operations (GSO) centers. We have adopted a blended approach by mixing both instructor-led, web-based and skills-based (practical hands-on) methods of delivery.

Travel to sites to deliver technical training on Robotics equipment and assets

Administer Learning management system (LMS) tasks such as schedule sessions, register participants and instructor resources
Provide content and class feedback to learning strategy team to drive improvements
Mentor technicians by motivating, providing guidance and directions to help them achieve their goals

o Amazon Robotics Equipment maintenance experience
o Automated conveyors systems and controls
o Preventative maintenance procedures
o Industrial Electrical
o Industrial Controls
1+ year of experience in a training role, preferably technical training
Experience with developing training documentation (lesson plans, procedures, reports, etc.
2+ years demonstrated Adult Learning and Curriculum Design/Improvement experience
3+ years of experience with Amazon Robotics
1+ year as an Amazon Robotics trainer
ARU Maintenance Certifications such as Essentials, Advanced

Experience communicating effectively (written and verbally) with peers, management, contractors and vendors
Experience managing external and internal relationships to develop and present training plans for other service technicians
Ability to dive deep into the technical aspects of a topic and understand it themselves, and then translate that understanding into high quality training content and programs for other technical audiences

title: Training Manager- Automation Engineering and Controls
description:
Bachelor’s degree
3+ years of experience in Program Management
3+ years of management experience in Maintenance, Manufacturing, Transportation, or Supply Chain
Reliability and Maintenance Engineering (RME) is hiring a Training Manager (TM) to further develop and execute the RME Technical Training program by contributing to the design of the curriculum and effectively managing the Learning Ambassadors' (LAs) workload and responsibilities as well as coordinating scheduling of classes and venues.

This role is virtual, and can be located anywhere in the United States. This is a key role in the Leadership and Development (L&D) team for RME in North America- you will lead the LAs to assess the skills of technicians and deliver instructor-led training, provide support to the sites leveraging the Subject Matter Expert (SME) network, and identify training needs in the network based on Launch Schedules and reliability metrics. You will directly work with a team of Amazonians based across launch and existing sites in the U.S and with cross-functional teams and vendors on complex problems, deal with ambiguity and advocate on behalf of RME stakeholders.

Key Job Responsibilities:
Manage a team of 10, highly-skilled technical trainers that operate in Launch and Existing sites across the US.
Engage with RME stakeholders for all Business Units and Central teams to ensure required training content is in place to support the advancement of RME technical skills.
Define annual, quarterly, monthly and weekly training schedules and required attendees and resources in coordination with Launch Teams.
Oversee execution of classroom, virtual, and hands-on training activities.
Assess the skills of technicians trained and effectiveness of training methodologies.
Assess and develop the skills of LAs
Communicate effectively and partner with multiple stakeholders to drive results.
Travel domestically up to 60%.
Master's Degree
5+ years of experience in Program Management
5+ years of management experience in Maintenance, Manufacturing, Transportation, or Supply Chain
Experience with robotics and training

title: Public Sector Sales, Amazon Connect
description:
7+ years of technology related sales experience.
BA/BS degree preferred or equivalent work experience required.
Direct sales or specialized sales experience working with Public Sector customers.
This position can be remote, but candidates must be based near an AWS office location (Arlington, Boston, Herndon, New York City, Washington D.C.)

Do you like helping customers implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve technical problems? Would you like to do this using the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have the consultative and leadership skills to help customers succeed with their cloud efforts? Do you have a background in Public Sector Contact Centers, and a passion for driving innovation into existing IT organizations?

Amazon Web Services is looking for Specialized Sellers to help establish Amazon Connect as the market leader for Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS). Amazon Connect was designed from the ground up to be omnichannel, it provides a seamless experience across voice, chat and other channels for your customers and agents leveraging AWS. Amazon Connect is an industry leading scalable, flexible, reliable omni-channel Contact Center as a Service platform leveraging the latest AWS Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) tools to deliver world-class customer experiences.

You will have enterprise sales experience in areas such as Contact Center, CCaaS, telecommunications, CRM/ERP applications, and/or the integration of these complex solutions. As an Amazon Connect Sales Specialist in this fast growing, exciting space you will have the opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of a service category that will have a significant impact on a customers’ business.

Your responsibilities will include building and managing a healthy sales pipeline focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration. You will possess a proven track record and background that enables them to lead a sales effort that will include teaming with AWS Senior Public Sector Account Managers, Solutions Architects, Partners and engagements at the CxO level within AWS Public Sector accounts. The successful candidate will also possess a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CxO/VP level, as well as a technical understanding that enables them to easily interact with developers and technical architects. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus.

Enjoy working with Public Sector customers. The role of a Specialized Seller requires someone who simultaneously acts as a market maker, operator, and general manager for their own customer accounts. With a focus on customer outcomes, they must work to win new customers, grow existing customers, secure lighthouse customers, drive revenue for new services, and develop strategic partnerships.

Industry experience selling Contact Center, CCaaS, telecommunications, CRM/ERP applications, and/or the integration of these complex solutions
Proven track record in creating net new demand which builds a sustainable business.
Experience managing large Public Sector customer accounts across a geographical territory.
Communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with customer executives, IT management, and internal stakeholders.
This position can be remote, but candidates must be based near an AWS office location (Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, New York City, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Sunnyvale, Santa Monica, Seattle, Tempe).

title: Inbound Flow Lead, Central Ops Flow
description:
Basic Qualifications:
High school or equivalent diploma or equivalent professional or military experience
1+ year working in data analysis and formula creation in Microsoft Excel
1+ year working with Microsoft Outlook management and rule creation
Key performance indicator (KPI) reporting experience in operations
Demonstrated experience using data to drive root cause elimination and process improvement
Ability to relocate, if necessary, and work out of AZA3 in Tempe, Arizona.
10+ hours of UPT
Are you interested in working on a fast-paced team that pioneers ways to delight customers? Do you have a passion for deep diving data and crunching numbers? Are you motivated to work in challenging situations that will provide you amazing growth opportunities? Do you have the grit required to deliver results no matter what? This is what the Central Flow team is all about! It’s always DAY ONE on this team and as such we look for ways to keep setting the bar higher. If you answered yes to the above questions, please keep reading!

The Central Flow Lead is responsible for managing volume and workflow of multiple Fulfillment Centers (FCs) from a centralized location based out of Tempe, Arizona. This role is not virtual and does require you to be local to Tempe, Arizona.

Candidates should be flexible with shift schedule and may have to work nights or long hours

Responsibilities
Manage the workflow of order across multiple processes.
Manage customer experience while minimizing fulfillment cost across multiple FCs.
Be responsible for communication of workflow status with Operations Managers and Area Managers and escalation of any Customer Experience risk, SLA failure risk, or deviation from Standard Work to the Senior Manager or General Manager.
Act as an advisor to the FC operations and senior operations team based on their holistic view of work flow throughout the FC.
Facilitate communication between multiple areas of the operation.
Provide operational insights to the Amazon Fulfillment Technology (AFT) team and work with them to develop advanced and intuitive automated flow control for FC operations.
Manage flow settings for multiple process paths in inbound and/or outbound operations for multiple Fulfilment Centers based on shift plan.
Understand the boundary of responsibilities between Operations on the floor and Central Flow as dictated by Standard Work developed by Central Flow Management.
Execute inbound and/or outbound flow operations and communicate the Customer Experience risks and performance opportunities to FC operations in a standardized manner.
Execute and develop shift plans based on FC operational requirements and adjust as variables change.
Preferred Qualifications:
College degree in Engineering, Operations, Logistics or related field
Experience in SQL and VBA, Excel Macro creation and modification
Ability to handle multiple projects, deadlines, and stressful situations with minimal management oversight
Ability to work well in a team environment remotely and as an advisor
Desire to thrive in a dynamic, growing environment
Ability to understand details of inbound and/or outbound shift plans for multiple Fulfillment Centers
Ability to grasp complex system settings for single
Ability to effectively identify and communicate detailed technical issues

title: IoT & Data Analytics Enablement Specialist
description:
8+ years working in technical sales, business development, or consulting
5+ years’ experience working with/selling IoT and Data Analytics solutions
Hands on experience with AWS IoT and Data Analytics services.
Experience with Infrastructure as code on AWS.
Ability to architect and end to end solution Architect end-to-end solutions for our Partners using AWS IoT, Data Analytics, Edge Services and Mobile Services.
AWS Certified Associate SA.
Location: Role is open to any location in the US
With the proliferation of devices and sensors in cars, ships, aircrafts, oil wells, factories, hospitals and buildings, customers and partners increasingly need solutions to connect them, collect, store, and analyze device data. AWS has broad and deep IoT services, from the edge to the cloud. AWS IoT is the only cloud vendor to bring together data management and rich analytics in easy-to-use services designed for IoT data.

Do you have the expertise and passion to enable partners in large scale data migrations to the cloud and help them gain insights and value using Data Analytics and/or machine learning?

Do you have the experience in defining and delivering a solution that would encompass multiple technologies, such as IoT, Data Analytics and AI?

Are you excited about the potential of technologies like IoT and Data Analytics in providing situational awareness in battlefield, predictive maintenance, transforming government services, building smart cities and providing emergency response?

Are you excited about building and executing on the sales pipeline of AWS IoT and related technologies working with Partner development managers and account managers?

We are looking for an IoT & Data Analytics Enablement Specialist with deep technical knowledge on the above-mentioned areas, a strong business acumen and interpersonal skills. As an IoT & Data Analytics enablement specialist, you will work closely with the AWS product and business development teams, as well as sales, solution architect, partner and marketing teams to promote and provide guidance on the value proposition of the AWS IoT offering to technology and consulting companies that provide solutions to Government, Education and non-profit institutions. You will be responsible for building programs and mechanisms for identifying and engaging with target technology companies, system Integrators and startups, and operate as an IoT and Data Analytics expert in pursuit of helping partners gain value and insights out of the data that they had migrated into AWS. The ideal candidate will possess a business and IoT and data analytics background, and a passion to present, demo and deliver hands on labs. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of IoT and Data Analytic services, to IT architects, engineering teams and C-level executives.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Engage with AWS WWPS partner community – both consulting and technology partners to support their adoption and use of AWS IoT and Data Analytics and enable them to gain valuable insights.
Continuously assess and analyze the market landscape and opportunity for AWS IoT and Data Analytics services.
Demonstrate the value proposition of the AWS platform to technology and consulting partners in the space of capturing data, migrating data and gaining insights from the data.
Conduct one/two-day training sessions on IoT and Data Analytics services as part of Partner enablement.
Author and contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as blogs, white-papers.
Measure and produce tangible business results, by working closely with AWS PDMs and extended sales teams.
Build the pipeline of IoT and Data Analytics opportunities periodically and provide feedback to improve the efficiency of the program.
Inclusive Team Culture

We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Industry-recognized expert in IoT, Data Analytics with industry publications and presentations.
Strong analytical, verbal/written communications skills, and demonstrated ability to turn detailed data and market analysis into useful strategic insight in order to drive customer adoption and make appropriate strategic recommendations to the business.
Strong understanding of multiple IoT solutions and ability to compare and contrast the AWS platform capabilities vs other vendor solutions.
Certified in AWS AI/ML specialty and/or AWS Data Analytics specialty.

title: Food Safety Manager – Program Compliance
description:
Master’s degree in Food Science or related field
5 years of experience managing Food Safety and Quality in a large scale retail or manufacturing environment (multi-store/multi-plant);
Knowledgeable in local, state, and federal food regulations (including USDA and FDA);
Experience interacting with the state and local regulators including Department of Health;
Experience leveraging technology to drive process improvements;
Program management experience;
Exceptional organizational skills;
Strong verbal and written communication skills;
Ability to work independently and autonomously;
Demonstrated collaborative skills and ability to work well within a team, including adherence to core values and dynamic corporate culture;
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting;
Must be willing to travel frequently..
At Amazon.com, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for a Food Safety Program Manager to join our team. Our vision for Food Safety is to support Amazon’s mission of offering the widest selection of products available, while protecting customers from potentially hazardous products. We are looking for a dynamic and organized self-starter to join our Food Safety team, focusing on Retail/Grocery Food Safety.

This role will support food safety programs in Distribution Centers and Retail food operations within Amazon to ensure food safety compliance is met. The position may be filled in Seattle or remotely. This is an exciting opportunity to work in a highly visible space and be part of a vibrant and fast-growing company!

Needed Skills and Abilities:
Influencer: Ability to identify opportunities, influence business teams and operations to gain support for food safety and overcome resistance by creating strong, persuasive, balanced positions through the use of data.
Doer: No job is too trivial. Food Safety team members dive deep and have exceptional attention to detail. Must have the ability to successfully visualize and drive end-to-end process requirements, program implementation, and continuous improvement, working through the many obstacles along the way.
Communicator: Ability to communicate food safety and quality expectations and requirements with business leaders and cross-functional support teams.
Problem Solver: Crisis events require quick, high-judgment decisions, and the ability to direct teams to work through difficult challenges.
As a high-level summary the deliverables are:
Provide governance and continuous improvement in complex food safety programs related to temperature controls and pest control across all Amazon businesses.
Implement, train and validate Retail Food Safety Operations programs and processes to drive food safety execution at the retail level.
Write policies, standards, and SOPs for food business processes and procedures.
Leverage technology to automate and manage compliance processes.
Drive food safety compliance across a large business by analyzing data to identify compliance trends. Update policies/procedures to close operational food safety gaps.
Create and monitor business metrics to track compliance and process effectiveness.
Participation in Food Industry Councils and Working Groups
Frequent interaction with local, state, and federal food regulations
Experience as a food manufacturing QA manager, auditor, or similar
Experience using and suggesting improvements to product management technology, including Customer Feedback Trending software, Facility Auditing or Response Management software, Supplier Database, or Product Life Cycle Management software
HACCP / CP-FS or REHS Certified
Online/retail experience
Six Sigma/FMEA experience

title: Certification Exam Development Program Manager
description:
4+ years of experience in exam development
3+ years of experience facilitating and leading exam development workshops for certification
Knowledge of certification standards and best practices
Bachelor’s degree or 10+ years of equivalent work experience
As cloud technologies continue to transform businesses, skilled individuals are in high demand. At AWS Training and Certification (T&C), we are passionate about revolutionizing the way people advance their cloud skills and careers. We equip diverse builders of today and tomorrow with the knowledge they need to leverage the power of the AWS Cloud. Join our dynamic, fast-growing team and help us empower our customers to build cloud skills.

The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Training & Certification team is seeking an innovative, driven, and experienced program manager to create, develop, manage and maintain AWS technical certification exams in a rapidly evolving and expanding landscape for global delivery. Successful candidates will have a strong exam development background, be detail driven, and have excellent training and problem solving skills. You will have an understanding of certification exam development lifecycle and be able to effectively train subject matter experts on certification best practices. You will creatively seek out and embrace forward-looking, innovative approaches to exam development that hone efficiency and maintain or enhance quality while maintaining valid, reliable, fair, and relevant certifications that support the AWS platform.

Roles and Responsibilities
Facilitate exam development workshops: Job task analysis, item writing/review, and standard setting
Recruit and collaborate with subject matter experts
Train subject matter experts on Amazon’s style guidelines and exam development best practices
Conduct quality reviews of exam files
Implement proper tracking mechanisms for item workflow
Manage and implement item development processes (in person and remote)
Manage the editorial review of items (e.g. grammar, spelling, standardizing on technical terms throughout the exam, etc.)
Create and implement exam maintenance schedules
Report on subject matter expert, item, and exam development metrics
Ability to travel up to 25% (domestic and international)
This role can be performed near any US AWS office in the following cities: Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Ballston, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, Denver, Detroit, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, New York City, Pittsburgh, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Washington D.C., Tempe, Sunnyvale, or Santa Monica.

A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site.

Experience developing IT certifications
Experience with SAP on AWS
Experience with development of performance-based items
Experience creating models for automatic item generation
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Comfortable presenting in large groups, including to senior management
A proven track record of being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow through on projects
Experience working with multiple item banking systems and assessment delivery platforms
Experience with linear-on-the-fly test delivery
Adept problem solver with strong judgment and decision-making skills

title: GTM Product & Solutions Strategist, Global
description:
5+ years leading complex business development, sales or operations initiatives.
Experience working in IT, optimally with the use of cloud based solutions
3+ years experience with scheduling, coordinating resources and operational management.
Our team needs a highly skilled, detail-oriented, incredibly organized, and enthusiastic global leader to direct VMC on AWS sales GTM for new products and expanded customer solutions.

The VMC on AWS team is responsible for sales, alliances and evangelism for the partnership between AWS and VMW.
Product and Solutions Manager Focuses on advancing the AWS’ vision by optimizing strategies and operating models to maximize value and accelerate profitable growth. It is important that our team represents sales when it comes emerging products, new offerings, pricing, as well as competition. It is also important to create repositories of use cases to find repeatable solutions that can marketed both internally and externally. We will work cross functionally with Marketing, Service Teams, alliances, VMware, etc to develop the appropriate messaging for our sellers, partners, and customers.

Work cross functionally to drive change initiatives within our flywheel teams; Sales, Marketing and Customer Success, along with other parts of the business; Finance, Products, and more
Run monthly, quarterly and annual business reviews that tackle the largest opportunities for the Sales and flywheel organizations.
Train and advance Strategy team: Advise and coach all levels of sales operations and sales enablement personnel to provide thorough and manageable project plans for each solution
Analyze historical and forward-looking performance to make strategic business recommendations to drive recurring revenue growth, expansion opportunities, and strategic planning & initiatives
Influence long-term strategic planning for sales while assisting with cross-team planning efforts, acting as a knowledgeable authority looking for ways to support project oversight.

description:
10 + years’ experience in in a sales environment working with teams on structuring of strategic, complex, opportunities, and/or customer facing in a solution oriented capacity
BA or BS or equivalent experience
As a member of the Deal Team for Strategic Customer Engagements (SCE), you will engage with our customers on strategic, large, complex opportunities to increase the growth of the AWS Americas business and establish AWS as their key cloud technology provider. You will be involved in the critical phases of the Deal Cycle (Strategy, Structuring, Negotiations, and Closure) and work with C-level executives, IT, and various lines of business to meet their business outcomes, increase the adoption of AWS services, and enable private pricing, go-to-market, pan-Amazon, and other strategic relationships.
On a daily basis, you will partner with AWS customers, AWS field sales and other internal stakeholders to empower our customers to rapidly grow, address their challenges, and create innovative solutions. You will work with AWS Service teams on developing commercial business models that align with their goals. You will earn trust with customers by creating an actionable strategy and structure for the opportunity that meets the customer’s goals.

title: Engagement Manager
description:
10+ years of relevant experience
Customer facing experience
Proficient in SCRUM framework
Proven record of developing project management processes and reporting mechanisms
Proven record of Sales engagements greater than $1m
BA/BS degree required or equivalent experience
At Amazon we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally bright, talented and driven people. Would you like to be part of a team focused on growing Amazon Web Services by managing programs to enable our largest customers? Do you have the business savvy, strong organizational skills and ability to collaborate across multiple business units to establish Amazon Web Services as the premier cloud provider by rolling out multi-faceted enablement programs? If so, this is the role for you.

As a Skills Guild Engagement Manager, you will have the exciting opportunity to be part of a growing team developing and delivering large scale enablement programs across North America. Your responsibilities will focus on supporting customers to roll out large scale skills development programs, collaborating with field sales and training and certification teams to oversee skills transformation programs, developing project management processes and reporting mechanisms for the program, report on the progress of these programs, and drive customer satisfaction by providing creative solutions to complex questions.
You must be a self-starter that is comfortable working directly with customers, possess exceptional organizational, SCRUM and program management skills and thrives in a fast paced and dynamic team environment.

Roles & Responsibilities:
Partner with customer and sales team to develop skills transformation programs
Run regular stand up meetings with customer and AWS stakeholders to manage training program
Work as a team with AWS account managers to directly support key customers with their program management needs, where needed, develop program management tools and documents for customer and AWS
Not afraid to roll up your sleeves and leverage all available resources and find creative solutions to uncommon customer issues
Become a subject matter expert and educate account managers and customers on best practices for running large scale enablement projects
Craft monthly business reviews to AWS leadership to surface key business insights from the field and advocate for our customers
Opportunity to lead change and spearhead projects that will transform the AWS customer experience
About Us
As cloud technologies continue to transform businesses, skilled individuals are in high demand. At AWS Training and Certification (T&C), we are passionate about revolutionizing the way people advance their cloud skills and careers. We equip diverse builders of today and tomorrow with the knowledge they need to leverage the power of the AWS Cloud. Join our dynamic, fast-growing team and help us empower our customers to build cloud skills.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded employee and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

This position can be based near any AWS office in the Central US (Austin, Chicago, Dallas, Houston, or Minneapolis).

A technical background a plus
Training business experience
Strong verbal and written communications skills
Proven ability to work in an ambiguous environment

title: Business Line Strategist
description:
Bachelor’s degree in an applicable discipline such as Business, Marketing or Communications
3-5 years of relevant work experience in marketing strategy and execution
Amazon’s Associate Attraction Marketing team is looking for a talented marketer to own marketing strategy and cross-team execution to support the hiring needs of the Amazon Logistics (AMZL) Business Line. The Business Line Strategist will support the development of the AMZL business line strategic approach which will be executed via localized marketing plans to drive application volume and deliver short-term marketing results. The Associate Attraction team generates demand for the Amazon hourly brand, and converts that interest into new hires to meet the growing need for hundreds of thousands of hourly Operations team members.

The ideal candidate will be a passionate marketer with a track record of achieving impressive results. You thrive in ambiguous situations and love to build from scratch. You love test and learn innovation. You use data to rigorously assess marketing effectiveness and develop the right marketing mix. You think big, but also execute rapidly.
Lead implementation of business line marketing programs across regions and teams
Own written communication to internal and cross-functional stakeholders to share business line challenges, marketing programs, progress, and outcomes
Develop target candidate profiles and actionable product categories (location, shift type, value proposition, etc.)
Be the evangelist for the business line specific candidate experience, working to continuously improve the candidate journey
Experience building and optimizing multi-channel marketing campaigns, and equally comfortable building strategic marketing plans and executing at a tactically
Analytic abilities, specifically with respect to using data to develop channel and target Candidate insights and recommendations
Excellent oral and written communication skills to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively
Demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams to achieve outcomes
Able to consistently nail details, driving process and managing to goals
Test and learn, marketing optimization, and experimentation experience
Localized/geo-targeted marketing experience
Employer Brand marketing experience
High volume recruitment marketing experience
MBA
