title: Amazon Connect Migration Consultant
description:
7-10 years of implementation/consulting within the contact center industry
Customer facing experience, including discussions with senior customer stakeholders regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
Experience in managing and delivering large-scale IT projects including definition and execution of successful project controls on a large scale
Hands-on experience leading the design, development and migration of contact centers at scale
Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (e.g. security, privacy, SOX, HIPPA etc.)
Experience working within software development or contact-center-related industries
BS level technical degree required or equivalent experience; Computer Science or Math background preferred; MS degree desired
Do you like helping customers implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve technical problems? Would you like to do this using the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have a knack for helping groups understand application architectures and integration approaches? Do you have the consultative and leadership skills to help customers succeed with their cloud efforts?

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for experienced and motivated technologists who possess a unique balance of technical depth, strong interpersonal, and business acumen to drive enterprise transformation and lead a portfolio of large scale contact center migration projects. You will partner with customers, AWS Sales, AWS ProServe, and relevant AWS Service Teams to develop and execute repeatable processes and solutions that address customer migration use cases and accelerate the adoption of AWS. As a trusted customer advocate, the Sr. Amazon Connect, Migrations Consultant helps organizations understand best practices around advanced cloud-based solutions, and how to migrate existing workloads to the cloud. You will help shape and execute a strategy to deliver a cloud-based contact center for a broad range of customer use cases primarily from large enterprise customers. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, products, and technical challenges.

In this role, you would be part of leading a complex and ambitious program to build our solutions and capabilities around migrating existing customer contact centers to AWS, as well as elevating the technical execution and delivery within ProServe. Achieving success will require coordination across many internal AWS teams and external AWS Partners, with impact and visibility at the highest levels of the company. You’ll need to make prioritization calls across the enterprise that require both keen business and technical judgment, and will also drive processes and execution goals.
You will also create, establish, and educate on migration acceleration and agile development best practices for enterprise customers as well as internal AWS enablement. You will create repeatable processes and collateral to assist customers in transforming their culture into a cloud centric, agile, workforce.

The successful candidate must have exceptional problem-solving skills, strong business judgment, and demonstrated technical experience leading cross-functional teams. We are looking for a proven leader with the ability to execute both strategically and tactically, and someone who is excited to take on new, ambiguous projects. The Sr. Amazon Connect, Migrations Consultant will support the development and growth of the market, driving customer consulting delivery, and will be responsible for execution of the methodology by which we deliver contact center Migrations Projects for customers. This person will work across our Americas and US Delivery Teams, AWS Regional Teams and AWS Partners to identify and leverage tools and technology that will be leveraged to build a blueprint of tools and processes that can then be used to plan and execute contact center migration projects.

Responsibilities include:
Expertise - Collaborate with AWS field sales, pre-sales, training and support teams to help partners and customers learn and use AWS platform services such as Amazon Connect, Polly, Lex, Transcribe, Comprehend to name just a few, provide expertise in designing and building contact center migration assets, and provide extensive experience leading and controlling large scale contact center migration projects across multiple stakeholders.
Solutions - Define and deliver on-site technical engagements with partners and customers. This includes participating in on-site visits, mapping customer business and technical requirements, and guiding the delivery of technical solutions, both AWS and AWS Partner led, designed to dig deep into the details of customer systems to be migrated to AWS.
Delivery - Driving high team utilization on customer engagements including working with customers and AWS Partners to discover and map hardware and software solutions on customer’s on premise or alternate cloud solutions in order to build migration plans to move customer workloads to AWS.
Feedback and Insights - Work with Americas, US Delivery team, AWS Professional Services, AWS engineering and service teams to convey partner and customer needs and feedback as input to technology roadmaps and improving migration program success. Share real world migration challenges and recommend new capabilities that would simplify adoption and drive greater success of AWS cloud migrations.
Cross Functional – working with peer leaders across AWS Professional Services to develop cross-functional ability to augment each other’s roles when necessary or so as to provide perspective for improvement.
Measure Success and Create Action Plans – Establish success criteria, KPIs, for migration acceleration program. Capture, measure, and analyze the data. Report back to team with results and action plans based on data analysis. Determine rate of success/velocity of migration acceleration program and Proserv engagements to help determine where future growth and improvement is needed as it relates to the Sr. Amazon Connect, Migrations Consultant role and Proserv resources.
Develop Collateral – Create proven, repeatable content/templates for customers and internal enablement, such as; RACIs, migration plans, working agreements, playbooks, etc. Author internal and customer facing published content in the form of blog articles and whitepapers related to, but not limited to, migration acceleration, DevOps, and program/product management best practices with AWS.
This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Visible IT Industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT infrastructure within the contact center industry
Vertical industry sales and delivery experience of contemporary services and solutions
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Experience with design of modern, scalable delivery models for technology consulting services
Strong track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing environments
AWS Professional or Associate-level Certification
Working knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies required. Scrum Master experience a plus

title: Program Manager, VCS Expansion
description:
Bachelor’s degree required
5+ years of Program Management experience
5+ years Call Center / Contact Center Operations experience in a senior role
3+ years managing global stakeholders
Experience managing stakeholders in cross-functional projects
Are you passionate about improving the experience of our work-from-home employees? Is it important to you that your work is fundamental to the business meeting its most important strategic goals? Are you excited about collaborating with partners around the world? Do you have an ability to see opportunities across multiple projects that others might miss? If so, the Associate Technology and Innovation (ATI) team is looking for a Program Manager, Virtual Customer Service Expansion (VCS) to support the expansion of our worldwide Virtual Customer Service (VCS) workforce.

This role will deliver strategies and ensuing programs that enable Virtual Customer Service expansion in countries around the world. They will collaborate with multiple cross functional internal and external stakeholders to explore new potential locations, understand country specific requirements for virtual operations, and launch new virtual operations. The position involves regular communication with numerous stakeholders, as well as senior management on status, risks, and change control. Cross-team coordination, writing, project management and executive presentation skills are essential.

Responsibilities
Use data driven information to recommend the best locations to launch VCS Operations.
Create Business Requirement Documents for country virtual launches and expansion.
Contribute to standards to start a VCS site that can be replicated globally.
Partner with Finance, Legal, Accounting, Tax, and VCS Operations to determine the best and fastest way to launch VCS in a new country.
Own VCS Country launches from initial concept formation and pass off to regional operations with first in-country hire.
Influence stakeholders outside your direct area of responsibility.
Present to senior leaders and get their approval for country progress.
Drive team strategies, and overall roadmaps in collaboration with business partners
Deliver improved launch initiatives by working cross-functionally with Legal, Tax, Finance, Capacity Planning, Operations, Senior Management, and fellow leaders through upfront planning and iterative development.
Ideating and developing strategies to optimize cross-functional work streams such as recruiting capacity planning and management, training and onboarding, resource management,
Manage overall cross-functional risks and issues to enable teams to be successful at delivering project milestones and deliveries.
MBA
Program Management certification, e.g. CPM, CSM, MPM, Prince 2, Six Sigma / Lean, PMP etc.
A self-starter, able to prioritize and deliver on deadlines with minimal supervision
Travel up to 25% of the time may be required
Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity in a fast-paced environment where not all processes and procedures are clearly defined. Agility to change directions quickly as needed
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously

A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. title: Learning Product Manager - Customer Segments
description:
5+ years of relevant work experience in Product Management
3+ years of experience in building learning products, software, or services
B.S. or 4 years' equivalent degree in an Engineering, Software Development, Computer Science, or other technical discipline
Experience with client/customer facing work; conducting formal customer research and quantitative analysis
The Team:
AWS is revolutionizing how companies build and deploy technology through powerful cloud based services. The AWS Training and Certification organization has a vision to accelerate the growth of AWS through seeding the IT market with hundreds of millions of highly-skilled AWS professionals by offering the leading cloud training and certification programs in the industry.

We are an innovative, global organization with activities that support all services across AWS to deliver differentiated customer experiences. We provide a wide range of learning opportunities from initial cloud skills at education institutions, to career re-training, to in-depth proficiency for the experienced professional.

The Role:
Join our team as a product manager to create exciting learning products and services for AWS customers by focusing on our key AWS customer segments. You will be responsible for working with our AWS field teams. Together you will enable our partners and their customers to stay at the forefront of AWS Cloud innovation by accelerating the integration of Cloud content and tools around the globe. At the same time, you will connect the dots between our training and development programs, businesses, the hiring leaders and the supply of talent to our AWS customers by understanding the economics of technical talent.

The Expectations:
You will deeply understand the AWS field teams, our partners, and their customers. With this understanding you will look broadly across the needs of these customers to define scalable training and learning products to be built by the AWS T&C organization. You will prioritize initiatives and create a roadmap to meet customer needs and partner cross-functionally to ensure the right customer experience is delivered. You will determine how to measure the customer experience and relentlessly drive improvements based on data. You will accomplish all of this in the Amazon way by writing detailed business cases and requirements to deliver to leadership, partners, and engineering. You will also a business creator who can see the bigger picture and innovate with new ideas on behalf of our customers.

This role is inherently cross-functional and your success will depend on your ability to influence others. You must work closely with peers and leaders in every facet of the organization beyond curriculum and learning development including marketing, business development, customer intelligence, customer support, and operations. You are expected to create buy-in for our products and evangelize for our team across internal and external stakeholders.

A successful candidate will thrive in a high expectation culture and embrace ambiguity with critical, analytical thinking.

Key Responsibilities:
Be the voice of the customer and a champion for your assigned AWS customer segments; engage directly with our customers and field teams to understand their needs, use cases, and priorities
Be an expert in the our existing product line in order to close the customer gap by delivering the right learning offerings, experiences, and curriculum
Leverage your understanding of the customer and business goals to innovate; define a vision and then align teams all the way to delivery of that vision
Create the roadmap, user stories, and crisp requirements that can be used to by our curriculum and learning systems development teams to create the right products to support our customers
Manage prioritization and trade-offs among customer experience, performance, and operational support load
Be an expert in the use of operating metrics and KPIs; be the steward of your product and drive best practices for using that product
Aspire to make every investment decision count
This position can be remote, but candidates must be based near an AWS office location (Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, Denver, Detroit, East Palo Alto, Herndon, New York City, Pittsburgh, Portland, San Francisco, Santa Monica, Seattle, or Tempe).

The pay range for this position in Colorado is $123,300 - $160,000/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site.

MBA or Masters Degree
Experience with workforce development
Experience working with working through partnership channels
Experience working with training, learning development, and certification
Fluent in SQL and/or at least 1 scripting/programming language
Proven experience launching a new product or service into market

title: System Development Engineer - Amazon Chime POOLING REQ
description:
BS or Masters in Computer Science & 3+ years of experience
Are you excited by the prospect of solving some of the hardest and most valued technical challenges of cloud computing? Do you want to apply your deep analytical and engineering skills to the space of enterprise collaboration and productivity apps? Come join us at AWS!

The Amazon Web Services’ Productivity Applications team is looking for an engineer to help us build and operate Amazon Chime (https://chime.aws/) - a service that addresses our enterprise customers’ needs. We are specifically looking for leaders who want to build the best customer experiences.

The things we are working on are in response to loud and clear feedback from customers about the daily pain points their workers deal with in collaborating, communicating and sharing documents and information. Leveraging AWS’ scale, reliability, flexibility, and ease of use, we will offer customers an easy to manage and cost effective solution that solves many of these these pain points. We are working hard to define and build an early version of this exciting service and launch it for customers as quickly as possible to get feedback and iterate.

We are looking for a highly effective engineer that can make an immediate difference and help design and deliver systems while maintaining a constant customer focus. You will work with your peers and product management team to tackle hard problems with a growing AWS service.

Preferred locations are Seattle, WA or the Washington, DC area, but we are open to exceptional remote candidates as well.

Experience with SIP, RTP, and other VoIP Concepts
Knowledge of data structures, algorithms, operating systems, and/or distributed systems
Full stack engineer with experience in developing Java, Python, or JavaScript (node.js) applications
Experience with telecom industry problem sets, including Local Number Portability (LNP), SMS, and IMS/Intelligent Network design
Familiar with open source SIP/PSTN stacks
Experience influencing software engineering best practices within your team
Experience writing unit and system level tests using dependency injection frameworks and object mocking.
Ability to take raw product requirements and create architectures and designs to bring them to life
Strong attention to detail
Ability to think creatively and solve problems
Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role
About Us
Inclusive Team Culture Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

description:

5+ years’ experience in real estate management leveraging a combination of internal and external resources.
5+ years’ experience negotiating leases, contracts, and similar documents
Experience developing and implementing process improvements to streamline projects
Must be willing and able to travel up to 50% of the time
The Sr. Real Estate Manager will provide support for Amazon’s physical retail locations. They will work with business leaders to execute on short- and long-term strategies; work collaboratively with internal stakeholders to ensure the business needs are being achieved in complex lease negotiations; and effectively manage external brokerage relationships.
The Sr. Real Estate Manager will report to the Regional Real Estate Lead.

Preferred location is virtual in Florida.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage complex leases of various kinds
Execute processes to ensure project execution is completed consistently and predictably at a fast pace
Conduct field tours with key stakeholders
Responsible for site negotiations
Obtain relevant local data for planning purposes
Build a robust pipeline and execute on projects aligning with the business strategy
Align and work closely with various internal stakeholders to ensure requirements and the business needs are achieved through negotiations
Create, innovate and implement a relevant system of metrics to plan, manage, measure and evaluate site performance
Effectively communicate expectations, requirements and status of projects to key business partners – both internal and external
Manage an ever-changing variety of internal initiatives and projects
Help grow the best transaction management operation of its kind
Master’s degree in business, real estate, finance, engineering, construction management
Ability to effectively communicate Amazon requirements to various audiences (e.g. senior management, peers, public officials, vendors, etc.)
A track record of delivering high-quality projects in an atmosphere where speed, flexibility, and heavy workload are the expected norm

title: Software Development Manager
description:
7+ years of experience working directly with engineering teams
Experience in partnering with product and program management teams
3+ years of people management experience, managing engineers
Ability to communicate complex issues to leadership and non-team members and partners
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent years of experience
The Alexa Kitchen team is laser-focused on solving one customer problem: reducing the amount of time required to find the best recipes and get food to table. To accomplish this mission, Alexa Kitchen leverages conversational AI (Coltrane), natural language understanding, knowledge acquisition, analytical tooling, and continuous incremental improvement to answer our customers’ questions. You will have an opportunity to lead a high performing engineering team to deliver this customer experience by contributing to goal setting, building mechanisms, and designing and building cutting edge Alexa technology.

A day in the life
Define the long-term vision, strategy, and goals for your teams

Manage a development team responsible for Alexa Kitchen technology

Prioritize, plan projects and features, manage partners, and track external commitments.

Drive continual improvements to the efficiency and flexibility of the platform while keeping an extremely high bar on customer trust, performance, and availability.

Foster the career development of your direct reports.

About the hiring group
The Alexa Kitchen's team mission is to Help customers get food to table daily
and save time while doing it. Our team is made up of people who love food and some who don't, but everyone loves helping customers make the right food choices with Alexa. We have weekly Kitchen social hours on Fridays and many times it involves cooking. Sometimes we get competitive with our annual "Chopped" competitive cooking event that involves cooking with a secret ingredient and we've managed to keep these traditions alive even during pandemic WFH!

Job responsibilities

Alexa is the Amazon cloud service that powers Echo family of devices, the groundbreaking new Amazon device designed around your voice. We believe voice is the next shift in human computer interaction. The Alexa Kitchen team is laser-focused on solving one customer problem: reducing the amount of time required to find the best recipes and get food to table. To accomplish this mission, Alexa Kitchen leverages conversational AI (Coltrane), natural language understanding, knowledge acquisition, analytical tooling, and continuous incremental improvement to answer our customers’ questions. You will have an opportunity to lead a high performing engineering team to deliver this customer experience by contributing to goal setting, building mechanisms, and designing and building cutting edge Alexa technology.

We’re investing in innovators like you who:
Define the long-term vision, strategy, and goals for your teams
Manage a development team responsible for Alexa Kitchen technology
Prioritize, plan projects and features, manage partners, and track external commitments.
Drive continual improvements to the efficiency and flexibility of the platform while keeping an extremely high bar on customer trust, performance, and availability.
Foster the career development of your direct reports.

title: Recruiting Manager - Seattle, Arlington, Bay Area or Virtual...
description:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent post-secondary degree
5+ years of Recruiting experience
3+ years direct people leadership experience
Experience building, coaching and managing a recruiting team
Experience managing large dispersed recruiting/sourcing teams
Experience working with recruiting tools and systems, including resume databases, internet sourcing tools, and spreadsheets
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the global cloud computing leader. In order to continue to scale our fast-growing business applications team, we are seeking a Recruiting Manager with strong people development skills and business partnership acumen to support the rapid growth of multiple lines of business for AWS in North America. This recruiting leader will work closely with the sourcing team, partner with a team of HR business partners, cross-functional peers, and other teams to execute against recruiting targets.

Scope
This Recruiting Manager will manage a technical recruiting team (~6-8 direct reports) and report in to a Senior Recruiting Manager. A successful RM candidate will effectively provide coaching to direct reports, contribute thought leadership, set benchmarks, analyze data/metrics, and understand how to prioritize to reach accelerated demand and incremental demand, each quarter.

Location
This position will ideally be located in Seattle, however, other US locations will be considered such as Denver, San Francisco, Portland, Bay Area, and Arlington VA. Other Amazon corporate office locations in the US will also be considered (virtual/remote).

Core Responsibilities
Drive sourcing capability and delivery across a geographically dispersed team within North America to proactively build diverse technical and non-technical candidate pools, leveraging all available talent channels.
Partner with key business, HR and TA stakeholders to determine future talent needs, set and drive enabling sourcing strategies. This requires a deep understanding through extensive market research of the channels (both domestic US and internationally).
Use strong analytical skills and ability to translate metrics, research, and trends to identify opportunities, interventions, and initiatives for improvement.
Lead and develop a high-performing team in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment.
Set team performance goals and metrics, timelines and a formal tracking process to measure and manage progress.
Develop and execute to plans to identify and drive productivity improvements that enable the team to deliver to hiring goals.
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which reminds team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Flexibility
It isn’t about which hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We offer flexibility and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We care about your career growth too. Whether your goals are to explore new technologies, take on bigger opportunities, or get to the next level, we'll help you get there. Our business is growing fast and our people will grow with it.

Experience managing senior staff
Organized and pragmatic; thrives in a results oriented environment
Skilled at partnering with stakeholders to build sourcing, assessment, and closing strategies
Excellent written and verbal communication
A proven track record of growing, developing, and performance managing employees
Experience supporting technical recruiting or managing technical recruiting teams with a focus on Software Development Engineering

title: Senior Sales Operations Lead
description:
BA/BS Degree
5+ years managing technical operations organizations supporting internal teams, partner and customers
Experience gathering business requirements and developing scorecards and dashboards to surface meaningful KPIs and actionable intelligence to senior leaders.
As cloud technologies continue to transform businesses, skilled individuals are in high demand. At AWS Training and Certification (T&C), we are passionate about revolutionizing the way people advance their cloud skills and careers. We equip diverse builders of today and tomorrow with the knowledge they need to leverage the power of the AWS Cloud. Join our dynamic, fast-growing team and help us empower our customers to build cloud skills.

AWS enables customers of all sizes to run their applications on Amazon’s industry-leading cloud computing infrastructure. AWS is growing very rapidly with hundreds of thousands of companies in over 190 countries on the platform and to meet the growing demand for AWS Training and Certification around the globe, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. Here's your chance to work as a Global Sales Operations lead on our Training and Certification team.

This hands-on role supports the global sales and delivery operations function to develop, implement, and manage the sales processes, systems, reports, and recommends strategies that optimize the Training and Certification sales functions to meet organizational goals and initiatives. This position will be responsible for managing the rhythm of the business activities such as Monthly Business Reviews, Quarterly Business Reviews, and other cadenced reporting and metrics. The position will assist in evaluating and forecasting attainment against goals, utilizing various CRM tools to derive well-vetted analysis, and other ad-hoc requests and analysis as needed.
The successful candidate must be able to roll-up their sleeves, work autonomously, and be a quick learner. You will drive towards simple, scalable solutions to day-to-day problems, be highly organized, and be able to communicate results, both written and verbally, in a clear and easy-to-understand way. You will proactively seek answers in self-service tools, and know when to ask for guidance. Must be passionate about your work, detail-oriented, analytical, and demonstrate problem-solving skills with the ability to escalate problems and roadblocks as needed. You will manage multiple assignments and requests/processes concurrently, prioritizing accordingly, and deliver timely results. You will look for commonalities across our business needs, recommend improvements to accelerate current scaling mechanisms, and leverage automation to grow our capacity in line with the growth of the business. Additionally, you will be responsible for driving improvements to reporting tools, methods, and processes utilized by the team to increase the availability and granularity of actionable data.

The individual must have the ability to communicate effectively across multiple technical and non-technical business units, as well as across geographies.

Key Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Develop and execute mechanisms used to manage the T&C Delivery business
Define and develop key sales support systems/processes required to meet the rapid growth of the business and achieve revenue attainment and market development objectives
Support annual planning activities and develop actionable insights
Develop relationships and processes with sales, finance, HR, operations, and other stakeholders to identify and address reporting requirements
Prepare ad hoc analysis & participate on projects as needed
Be an expert in analytics tools required to support Sales and Sales Operations
This role can be performed near any US AWS office in the following cities: Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Ballston, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, Denver, Detroit, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, New York City, Pittsburgh, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Seattle, Washington D.C., Tempe, Sunnyvale, or Santa Monica.

The pay range for this position in Colorado is $ $109,100 - $160,000 /yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. This information is provided per the Colorado Equal Pay Act. Base pay information is based on market location. Applicants should apply via Amazon's internal or external careers site.

title: Digital Marketing Manager, AMER Field Marketing
description:
5+ years of experience in a high-tech demand generation/digital role.
Bachelor's degree in Marketing or Business or comparable education/experience.
Experience creating and executing integrated lead generation campaigns using tactics that include live and/or virtual events, webinars, email, organic social, paid media, lead nurture programs, and /sales insights.
Experience building and formatting web pages and email templates. Basic HTML/CSS skills for both email and web.
Hands-on experience building, launching, and reporting on campaigns using Marketo and .com.
The Digital Manager drives digital campaign execution supporting the commercial segment in the Americas. This role will create and execute digital programs that scale, implement best practices, utilize new tools and platforms to foster better customer experiences, and make continuous improvements based on data and insight. This role will support a diverse team of field leaders and support their campaign digital execution, providing strategic insight on digital optimization to ensure campaigns meet their lead generation goals.

The ideal candidate for this role will take an analytical approach to problem solving and have a proven track record of building and executing strategic lead generation campaigns that drive new customer acquisition and generate pipeline. channels will include email, virtual events, paid social, organic social, site merchandising, and others. Experience building and executing digital campaigns in is a required qualification.

Position may be located in Seattle, WA or near any Amazon/AWS U.S. Corp office only. Relocation offered from within the US to these locations only.

Responsibilities
Lead the execution of digital campaigns including project management, build, QA, deployment, testing, and reporting.
Oversee intake, scoping, capacity planning, and execution workflow for digital and lead generation activities in partnership with cross-functional internal .
Lead initiatives to improve processes and productivity which enable other digital marketers to scale with high bars on quality and efficiency.
Identify and share best practices for audience targeting and database hygiene, email/digital strategy, events, tracking instrumentation and digital channel measurement.
Develop and analyze digital channel performance metrics to drive future decisions and optimize lead acquisition and activation strategy.
Oversee the creation and optimization of email, landing page, and activity program templates in , GoToWebinar, Intrado, Uberflip, Splash, Adobe CQ, and other MarTech tools.
Deliver clear, consistent, and frequent communication with Field to ensure ongoing clarity on strategy, tactics, goals, and performance for digital channels.
About Us
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Project and time management skills.
Expert or advanced experience.
Track record of developing and managing multiple programs simultaneously.
Track record of developing and executing A/B testing within email and taking action on the results.
Knowledge of testing and measurement practices to optimize ROI and evolve strategy.
Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Attention to detail - required in order to meet our high bar for customer-facing content and provide flawless execution.
Highly organized and detail-oriented with ability to prioritize multiple projects at a team level.
Experience developing content and copy, including copy editing skills.
Extensive and experience preferred.
Not afraid to try new things – driven to constantly improve results.
Thrives in a fast-paced environment with the ability to pivot quickly and problem-solve collaboratively.
Comfortable working in a matrixed organization, with the ability to build relationships with and cross-functional teams including Product Marketing, Field Marketing and Digital Marketing.
Experience working with creative and operations agencies in an outsourcing capacity.

title: Sr Regional Facilities Manager - Virtual East
description:
-Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Architecture, Construction Management, or related field and 3 years’ experience in facilities management, construction management, mechanical maintenance, engineering, or related area OR 5 years’ experience in facilities management, construction management, mechanical maintenance, engineering, or related area.
Ability to conduct financial business case analysis / translate information into useful formats and draw conclusions
Experience in negotiating commercial contracts (master agreements / work-orders)
Familiarity with business process documentation and improvement
Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads
Able to work with technical and non-technical business owners/partners to overcome obstacles and deliver results
Provide business decision support and participate/lead special projects
Strong organizational skills
Self-motivated, able to work both independently and collaboratively within a team as projects dictate
Able to travel up to or beyond 50% based on project work load
Join us as we redefine the future of physical retail! Our goal is to be Earth’s most customer-centric company and we’re just getting started. We are looking for people who want to join a newly developing business unit full of ambitious and driven professionals that continue to push the boundaries of reality and improve the daily lives of our customers.

Amazon is seeking a Sr Regional Facilities Manager who will lead the maintenance program in their region. This position will be part of an exciting, fast moving and growing business team. The right person for this job will be an entrepreneurial self-starter with dedication to seeing projects through to the end. You will have an eye for detail and determination to turn-over high-quality work. You will be an integral part of the team that works cross-functionally between Store Design, Store Operations, Store Construction, Tech, Security, Loss Prevention, and Amazon vendors. If you thrive in an ever-changing environment, then we want to talk to you.

This position will closely manage all aspects of maintenance in order to ensure stores maximize equipment uptime and reliability. Critical to success is ensuring high quality and standards within maintenance processes. Oversight of vendor performance is critical. This position involves direct contact with both internal and external parties, and this candidate must have a professional demeanor and ability to communicate effectively with business partners at every level, including upper management.

Our ideal candidate is super detail-oriented, well respected in the industry and able to work back from our customer needs. This person is a self-starter, and a creative, critical thinker with an intense curiosity. You must be able to work independently in a collaborative, creative, ever-changing and ambiguous environment. The right person for this position will take ownership of their work, display a great deal of initiation, and possess sound judgment, a great business acumen and a sense of humor.

Duties
Manage a regional team as a servant leader, with an emphasis on coaching, developing and recognizing team members to ensure safety, productivity, efficiency, and effectiveness
Ensure safety policies and procedures are followed within maintenance practices for both contractors and team members
Visit all facilities within the assigned region to ensure those facilities are operating efficiently
Coach Facility Maintenance Managers on reviewing monthly reports
Implement and verify proper use of the Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS)
Provide recommendations on future capital expenditure and required projects for the assigned region and ensure timely completion
Ensure root cause of issues and solutions are implemented in the region to reduce maintenance work orders and repeat issues
Ensure a culture of continuous improvement and value engineering to capture cost avoidance savings
Maintains project oversight
Manages complex projects
Manages department budget
Creative, critical thinker with advanced analytical skills
Ability to work within an ambiguous environment and manage change
Familiarity with business process documentation and improvement
Provide business decision support and participate/lead special projects
Self-motivated, able to work both independently and collaboratively within a team and cross-functionally as projects dictate

title: Senior Practice Manager - Advisory
description:
Build and lead a team of change agents for AWS' most strategic Customers, driving the biggest changes.
Work closely with Global and Enterprise account teams and sales leadership to drive adoption of Cloud and Service solutions into top accounts.
Routinely engage with Director, VP, C-level executives and governing boards for large enterprises, as well as their strategy consulting partners
Develop TCO, ROI and Value Models to help Customers understand the cost/benefit equation associated with Cloud computing.
Provide perspective and guidance on long-term architecture/technology strategy, investments and innovation drawing upon their depth and breadth of knowledge
Combine the competencies of strategy consulting, Architecture, Organizational Change Management and project management.
Lead multi-functional team at Enterprise level and led end-to-end successful execution
Educate AWS account teams on Advisory best practices and trends
Document and present insights and recommended solutions to meet business objectives through enterprise architecture, adoption plans, and technical feasibility plans.
Remain engaged with Customers ensuring successful transition through their journey of adoption
Identify, lead and contribute to the creation of best practices, packaged offering, white papers, workshops, etc.
Deliver compelling presentations and conduct persuasive conversations focused on Professional & Advisory Consulting Services for Cloud Transformation
Assist with Customer-Facing Cloud Pre-Sales Leadership & Sales Support
We're looking for a Sr Practice Manager for our US Advisory Practice. The ideal candidate would be a current or former CTO or CIO who has also led a change management and project management consulting team? Have you built and led a successful transformation at a Fortune 100? Can you lead an enterprise Customer through a variety of projects involving IT strategy, distributed architecture implementation, and hybrid Cloud operations? Can you lead world class teams that drive breakthrough business outcomes using new IT deliver models?

At AWS, we’re hiring members to join the AWS ProServe, Advisory practice to work with our most strategic Customers in the Western US. Team members possess a diverse IT and/or Management Consulting background and knowledge of industry IT trends, leveraging this credibility as advisors with Customers, partners and internally across AWS.

We are seeking an action-oriented visionary who is craving to be part of a great company in a fast growing industry. We need someone that will thrive in a fast-paced environment on our emerging AWS ProServe, Advisory practice.

The ideal candidate will be able to craft a forward-looking strategy while clearly outlining the investment and multi-step go-to-market plan necessary to help AWS customers lead the changes to IT strategy, policies, processes, people, governance and partnerships.

About us
Mentorship & career growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Inclusive team culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have thirteen employee-led affinity groups, reaching 85,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here. We are a customer-obsessed organization—leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. As such, our consulting roles are customer-facing, requiring up to 25%-50% travel to customer locations.

Current or former CTO/CIO who has helped transform the IT organization of multi-national enterprises
Outstanding Customer relationship management experience and collaboration skills in a consulting team leader role
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Experience with providing strategic, consultative services in a sales or professional services environment.
Must enjoy working in a highly collaborative environment fast paced environment.
Ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with various functional knowledge
Project and Program Management
Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges
Ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with various functional knowledge
Highly technical and analytical, possessing 20 or more years of IT implementation experience
Understanding of how traditional Fortune 100 companies prefer to buy consulting and advisory services and procure large-scale transformation solutions
Strong organizational and project management skills with an ability to manage numerous, competing demands from internal and external stakeholders and Customers.
Experience in a fast-paced, startup (or startup-like) environment and experience
Proven ability to interact and communicate with senior C-level executive personnel
Experience with cost engineering Cloud environments to ensure Customers operating at the lowest cost per Customer footprint with integrated continuous cost improvement
Proven experience migrating production enterprise applications to Public and Private Cloud
Experience with DevOps, Continuous Development, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Integration and Micro-Services
Have experience in Data Management and Data Science
Experience designing comprehensive enterprise solutions based on Cloud reference architectures
Ability to travel up to 50%
Masters degree preferred in Business Administration, Computer Science, Systems Engineering, Information Engineering, or math;
15+ years of experience in Architecture, System Design, and Information Technology Field
10+ years of experience in Leadership and Management roles

title: Sr. Data & ML Engineer - Nationwide Opportunities
description:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field or equivalent professional or military experience
8+ years of experience of Data platform implementation
3+ years of hands-on experience in implementation and performance tuning of Kinesis, Kafka, Spark or similar implementations
Hands on experience with building data or machine learning pipeline
Experience with one or more relevant tools (Flink, Spark, Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Amazon Kinesis)
Experience developing software code in one or more programming languages (Java, JavaScript, Python, etc)
Current experience with hands-on implementation
At Amazon Web Services (AWS), we’re hiring highly technical Data and Machine Learning engineers to collaborate with our customers and partners on key engagements. Our consultants will develop and deliver proof-of-concept projects, technical workshops, and support implementation projects. These professional services engagements will focus on customer solutions such as Machine Learning, Data and Analytics, HPC and more.
In this role, you will work with our partners, customers and focus on our AWS offerings such Amazon Kinesis, AWS Glue, Amazon Redshift, Amazon EMR, Amazon Athena, Amazon SageMaker and more. You will help our customers and partners to remove the constraints that prevent them from leveraging their data to develop business insights.

AWS Professional Services engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective experience from across the AWS customer base and are obsessed about customer success. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product and service teams, to get the right solution delivered and drive feature innovation based upon customer needs.

You will also have the opportunity to create white papers, writing blogs, build demos and other reusable collateral that can be used by our customers. Most importantly, you will work closely with our Solution Architects, Data Scientists and Service Engineering teams.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience with design, development and operations that leverages deep knowledge in the use of services like Amazon Kinesis, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Amazon Sagemaker, Amazon EMR, NoSQL technologies and other 3rd parties.

This is a customer facing role. You will be required to travel to client locations and deliver professional services when needed.

Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.
Familiar with Machine learning concepts
Hands on experience working on large-scale data science/data analytics projects
Hands-on experience with technologies such as AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Spark SQL, MLib or Storm/Samza.
Experience Implementing AWS services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments.
Experience with at least one of the modern distributed Machine Learning and Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, MxNet Caffe, and Keras.
Experience building large-scale machine-learning infrastructure that have been successfully delivered to customers.
Experience defining system architectures and exploring technical feasibility trade-offs.
3+ years experiences developing cloud software services and an understanding of design for scalability, performance and reliability.
Ability to prototype and evaluate applications and interaction methodologies.
Experience with AWS technology stack.
Written and verbal technical communication skills with an ability to present complex technical information in a clear and concise manner to a variety of audiences.

title: Principal Economist
description:
PhD in Economics or highly related field (Marketing, Finance, Statistics, Math)
7+ years of experience in industry, consulting, government, or academic research
Experience in applied economic analysis and with big data and machine learning or data science
Coding ability in a scripting language such as R, Python, Matlab, or STATA
The AWS Outcome Driven Engineering (ODE) is a new AWS engineering organization chartered to build new AWS products by applying Amazon’s innovation mechanisms along with AWS digital technologies to real world industry problems. We dive deep with industry leaders to solve problems and unblock industries, enabling them to capitalize on new digital business models. Simply put, our goal is to use the skill and scale of AWS to make the benefits of a connected world achievable for all businesses.

We are looking for a seasoned principal economist who is able to provide structure, including sourcing, defining, and leveling, around complex and varied business problems. We seek creative thinkers who can combine a strong economic toolbox with a desire to learn from others, and who know how to execute and deliver on big ideas.

As part of the Outcome Driven Engineering Supply Chain, the Principal Economist will work closely with dedicated engineering, design, and product resources to solve challenging problems of forecasting, mechanism design, and causal inference in supply chain products. The Principal Economist in this role will also work closely with senior leadership of AWS customer firms in a partnership model to develop net-new services to be offered by AWS.
Responsibilities
Work with partners and the AWS ODE team to identify customer problems and propose modeling solutions that drive value to customers and revenue to AWS.
Own the development of economic models and manage the data analysis, modeling, and experimentation necessary to validate your model.
Effectively communicate econometric models to business teams and incorporate feedback into project analysis/modeling.
Work/Life BalanceOur team puts a high value on work-life balance. Prior to Covid restrictions, our team was co-
located in the office, but we were also flexible when people occasionally needed to
work from home. We generally keep core in-office hours from 10am to 4pm. About half
of us come in earlier and the other half of us stay later. Once Covid restrictions are lifted, we expect to follow Amazon policy on working from home.

Building a High-Performing & Inclusive Team Culture
You will be attracting & developing a world-class team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results. Driving results through others is your primary responsibility, and doing so in a way that builds on our inclusive culture is key to our long term success.

Mentorship & Career Growth
You will be attracting & developing a world-class team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results. Driving results through others is your primary responsibility, and doing so in a way that builds on our inclusive culture is key to our long term success.

We will consider candidate placement in: Seattle, San Francisco Bay Area, Denver, Chicago, Atlanta, the Boston Metro area, and other East Coast locations in North America.

Strong research track record, drives results
Thinks strategically, but stays on top of tactical execution
Effective verbal and written communications skills
Exhibits business judgment
Has relentlessly high standards
Dives deep, thinks big and has convictions

title: Sr SAP Customer Delivery Architect
description:
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
9+ years with SAP systems such as SAP Business Suite, SAP HANA, SAP Suite on HANA or equivalent
9+ years of IT implementation or consulting experience
6+ years designing architecting and building SAP Systems
Experience with SAP Basis / NetWeaver and HANA Administration
Experience in selling and delivering business value to customers with SAP solutions
Experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or technical consulting in customer-facing roles
AWS and SAP have been collaborating since SAP became a customer in 2008. Together, we have certified AWS to support most SAP solutions, brought purpose built EC2 instances to market to support SAP customer needs, and helped SAP leverage AWS services to power a number of their SaaS and PaaS offerings like Concur, SuccessFactors (for government agencies), HANA Enterprise Cloud (HEC), and SCP. AWS has been supporting SAP workloads for customers longer than any other cloud provider (since 2011), has more customers (5,000+ across all segments) than any other cloud provider.

AWS Professional Services team members leverage their deep knowledge of AWS technologies in collaboration with our sales and partner teams to propose, architect, and implement transformational SAP solutions for customers. Helping make customer success a reality using AWS cloud as an enabler and seeing the impact in real-time drives our teams to explore new frontiers in leveraging AWS for our customers.

The Senior SAP Customer Delivery Architect (CDA) is a new growth role within the Professional Services organization. This self starter will be responsible for partnering with a Professional Services talent to dive deep into a customer’s business challenge, to collaboratively propose and pre-qualify a particular set of outcomes that would result from a formal SAP Professional Services engagement. The Senior SAP CDA will remain meaningfully engaged with that customer, Amazon team, and project/program to provide oversight resulting in high-value, predictable, and successful delivery.

This is not a pure consultant role, nor is it a pure selling role. This person will have unique SAP expertise, selling Professional Services, coupled with cross-industry business acumen, including a heavy dose of passion for continued knowledge acquisition and growth, obsession for customers, and their success using AWS that will align well with the desired outcomes to be produced.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As a key member of the Account and Professional Services Go-To-Market teams this talent will ensure success in designing, building, optimizing, transforming or migrating, SAP solutions to the AWS platform
Educate customers on the value proposition of AWS
Participate in deep architectural discussions and design exercises to create world-class SAP solutions built on AWS while ensuring such solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud and drive business outcomes
In partnership with the ProServe leadership and account team, formulate and execute a strategy to accelerate customer outcomes through the adoption of AWS in conjunction with Professional Services engagements
Build deep relationships with senior technical talent within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates
Provide sales content amongst the AWS Professional Services community
Collaborate with Global and Enterprise account teams and sales to drive adoption of SAP Solutions into top accounts
Identify, facilitate, and contribute to the creation of workshops
This is a customer facing role. You be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.

Masters or PhD in Computer Science or Business Administration
Experience in building Enterprise Level, scalable and highly available SAP infrastructure
Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
Ability to demonstrate strong understanding of SAP applications, infrastructure and security
Experience with cloud infrastructure
Familiarity with TCO, ROI and Value Models to help Customers understand the cost/benefit equation associated with Data Analytics Cloud solutions
Extensive pre-sales experience with turning technical concepts into business outcomes, and communicating at the executive level

title: Senior UX Researcher, Books/Kindle & Digital Reading
description:
7+ years of proven success conducting user research in a growing software development setting, or equivalent.
A portfolio of case studies that illustrates past work experience and how your research informed decision-making, ideally in the digital products and services industry.
Applied experience with a mix of qualitative and quantitative methods.
The Books/Kindle Design Studio creates the full breadth of solutions that power the world’s biggest and most loved digital reading products. This includes everything from the tools and services that authors and publishers use to make their books, the discovery and shopping experiences our customers use to find their next great read, and the apps and e-readers used for reading across the globe. We strive to meet the needs of authors and readers of every kind of book, magazine, comic, and educational material. To help us delight our customers, we are seeking a talented, creative, and customer-obsessed Senior UX Researcher to join our growing team in Seattle, WA, reporting in to our Head of Research.

What you will do
In this role, your research will inform and guide decisions impacting the next generation of digital readers. You will be responsible for helping shape and execute research strategy, working closely with partners to understand the largest challenges and opportunities we face. You are highly collaborative, with a strong record of influencing outcomes and proposing well-informed new directions. You will utilizes your unique knowledge and talent to drive actionable insights that help guide decisions as we create engaging, beautiful, and customer-focused experiences for the next generation of Kindle readers.

What you bring
You geek out over user research, psychology, ethnography and have a deep understanding of UX research methods and best practices, but you also have a nimble, creative and pragmatic approach, and you're interested in pushing the boundaries of agile research. You are a passionate, curious researcher with strong observational and analytical skills, an impressive ability to collaborate with other teams and designers, and a relentless determination to do what is right for Amazon's customers. You can work with minimal direction while delivering high-quality outputs. You will work on overlapping projects, so you are good at multi-tasking, juggling competing priorities, and organizing yourself to ensure you deliver on your commitments.
Additional Responsibilities
Understand product roadmaps and be able to translate them into long-term, as well as, short term research plans.
Provide expertise to the larger user research team and raise the user research bar with regards to mix of methods based on research questions, timeline and resourcing.
Work closely with the design and product management teams to define, measure and communicate user research metrics and guidelines around the various customer experience solutions evaluated.
End-to-end experience with all aspects of the user research lifecycle (study design, recruiting, moderation, analysis, reporting, communicating).
Hands-on experience with: user testing, remote testing, paper prototype testing, iterative prototype testing, concept evaluation, field research, and survey design.
Experience in best practices for user research and knowledge of what approaches work and which don’t.
Having worked on at least one version 1 or incubation product with successful results.
The ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
The ability to manage ambiguity, work autonomously and multi-task in an agile environment.
A clear passion for making a positive impact on customers lives through your work.
**We are open to hiring this role to sit anywhere in the U.S., though the team is largely based in Seattle. We would fully support relocation to Seattle, should that location be desired.**

Experience operating as an individual contributor in a user research role.
Experience operating as an individual contributor in a user research role.Broad knowledge of research methodologies and the proven ability to execute the right methodology to get the needed result.
Excellent written communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
Experience working in a fast-paced software development environment within a highly entrepreneurial organization.
Applied research experience with diverse customers of all ages and backgrounds.
Applied research experience in non-US markets.
Good understanding of the software, design and product development cycle
Experience with agile software development and how user research fits in.
UX Research experience in non-US markets.
MA/MS or Ph.D in Psychology, Sociology, Anthropology, Cognitive Science, Human Factors, Human Computer Interaction, or related discipline

title: Mobile Platform Engineer
description:
5+ years in a hands on software development role in C++
2+ years of relevant mobile experience on iOS and Android
1+ launched software products
Bachelor’s degree in a Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience
JOIN AMAZON GAME STUDIOS AND HELP SHAPE THE FUTURE OF GAMES!

Amazon Game Studios is seeking an exceptionally skilled and enthusiastic Mobile Platform Specialist to join our team either in Seattle, WA or remotely. In addition to implementing game systems, you will help build platform specific solutions for mobile devices on an exciting new mobile game and future mobile games.

The ideal candidate has a proven track record of delivering robust and scalable engineering solutions on mobile devices and deep technical knowledge of each platform’s requirements. You are familiar with mobile project configuration and are comfortable owning platform specific solutions end to end. You possess strong critical thinking and communication skills. You are driven to make the best games in the industry on a highly collaborative, multidisciplinary team of designers, artists, and engineers.

Responsibilities:
Own platform specific solutions for a mobile game end to end
Design and implement robust systems and tools to deliver quality gameplay experiences
Collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team to create engaging games that will delight our players
Amazon Games applies the principles of Amazonian culture to the world of game design. We have a diverse team of talented, creative people pairing their love of making games with the unique strengths that come with being part of Amazon. Across all of our teams and locations, we are united by a common purpose: to share great gaming experiences with customers around the world. We believe in a future where everyone is a gamer and everyone can create, compete, collaborate and connect through games, and we are looking for the right people to help us build that future. With the power of Twitch and AWS at your fingertips, you will have the chance to innovate in gameplay, creativity, marketing, and technology, while working alongside some of the smartest and most creative minds in the industry.

About Us

Inclusive Culture, Work/Life Balance, & Career Growth
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We offer ten employee-led affinity groups with 190 global chapters, innovative benefits, and annual and ongoing learning experiences (including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences). Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance and offers flexible working hours. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, our team is dedicated to supporting you with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice.

7+ years of game development experience with multiple shipped titles
Shipped one or more titles on Unreal 4 preferably in the mobile games space
Experience wearing multiple hats on a small team
Passionate mobile gamer with in-depth domain knowledge

title: Sr. Data & Analytics Customer Delivery Architect
description:
Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field
8+ years of progressive experience in designing, developing and deploying Data, Analytics or Machine Learning solutions
Experience in architecting and building data lake solutions using Spark, Hadoop, or equivalent on-premises or cloud technologies
Experience with transactional database and data warehousing environments such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL and/or Postgres, or Data Warehouse/MPP databases (Teradata, Netezza, Vertica and Greenplum)
Experience with other database and analytical technologies including NoSQL, data storage, data migrations, BI reporting and analytical Dashboard development
4+ years of progressive experience to support sales of large-scale multi-million-dollar professional services engagements like data and analytics strategy, full-cycle data lakes and data warehouses implementations for large organizations and deliver business value to customers
Location is flexible anywhere in the US.

AWS is known for its unwavering customer obsession. Our Professional Services teams are on the front line of helping customers succeed using AWS data and analytics services that align with the new ways of managing people and re-architecting critical processes to compliment the new cloud paradigm.

The Sr. Data & Analytics Customer Delivery Architect (CDA) is a new growth role within the Professional Services Intelligence practice. The CDAs are responsible for partnering with a Professional Services’ team to dive deep into a customer’s business outcomes, to collaboratively propose technical approaches during sales pursuits, and pre-qualify a particular set of outcomes that would result from a formal data and analytics Professional Services engagement. They have the unique ability to put together cutting-edge solutions that bring together data using a combination of deep technical knowledge, sales/business acumen, and strong interpersonal skills. Thereafter, the CDA remains meaningfully engaged on a part-time basis with that customer, Amazon team, and project/ program to provide oversight resulting in high-value, predictable, and successful delivery.

This is a hybrid role requiring exceptional sales support and delivery skills. The person in this role will come with a unique data and analytics expertise, strong interpersonal skills, experience in selling and hands-on building, coupled with cross-industry business acumen, including a heavy dose of passion for continued knowledge acquisition and growth, obsession for customers and their success using AWS to align with the desired business outcomes.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
As a key member of the Account and Professional Services Go-To-Market teams, ensure success in selling, designing, building, optimizing, transforming or migrating, data and analytics solutions (Data Lakes and Data Warehouse/MPP) to AWS platform
In partnership with the ProServe sales and account teams, educate customers on the value proposition of AWS and, participate in deep architectural discussions and design exercises to create world-class data and analytics solutions built on AWS while ensuring such solutions are designed for successful deployment in the cloud and drive business outcomes
Author or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as whitepapers and proof of concepts
Partner with others to formulate and execute a data strategy and architecture to accelerate customer outcomes through the adoption of AWS in conjunction with Professional Services engagements
Build deep relationships with senior technical resources within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates
Capture and share best-practice knowledge, sales and delivery content amongst the AWS Professional Services community
Contribute to the creation and delivery of best practices, packaged offering, white papers, workshops, etc.
This is a customer facing role. You be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.
Masters or PhD in Computer Science or Business Administration
Demonstrated experience self-starting or developing high quality, enterprise scale software products using a structured system development life cycle
Strong organizational skills with an ability to manage numerous demands from internal / external stakeholders and Customers
Ability to collaborate with Global and Enterprise account teams and sales teams to drive adoption of IoT Solutions into top accounts
Ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly, e.g. Basic knowledge of Cloud Computing, AWS services such as EC2, S3, VPC and IoT; One of the AWS Associate level certifications or AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner
Familiarity with TCO, ROI and Value Models to help Customers understand the cost/benefit equation associated with Data Analytics Cloud solutions
