title: Cloud Security Architect - AWS (Remote)
description:
GuidePoint Security provides trusted cybersecurity expertise, solutions and services that help organizations make better decisions and minimize risk. By taking a three-tiered, holistic approach for evaluating security posture and ecosystems, GuidePoint enables some of the nation’s top organizations, such as Fortune 500 companies and U.S. government agencies, to identify threats, optimize resources and integrate best-fit solutions that mitigate risk.

GuidePoint Security’s Cloud Security Team is looking to add a senior-level cloud security leader with experience in solving enterprise multi-cloud security challenges. Cloud Security Leader’s on our team help solve architectural and engineering problems for our largest clients. We’re looking for a cloud security architect that is looking for an opportunity to maintain hands-on experience across AWS, Azure, and GCP. This role will specialize in our AWS services, knowledge in Azure or GCP is preferred.

Responsibilities:
Assess existing AWS deployments and identify security improvements
Provide architectural guidance for clients migrating to AWS (primarily), Azure, or GCP
Present findings, recommendations, and project plans to senior leadership
Hands-on experience capable of creating proof-of-concepts in AWS
Ensure team knowledge and experience with AWS services remains current
When not working on client projects, assist cloud security practice in improving service offerings

Requirements:
AWS knowledge must include networking, encryption, identity and access management, and automation
AWS experience must include IAM, Lambda, GuardDuty, CloudTrail, VPC networking (DX, Transit Gateway, VPN, Peering), KMS, GuardDuty, and other security related services
Development knowledge or experience with Terraform or CloudFormation
Experience developing Lambda functions (Python preferred)
Experience working through audits and assessments in the cloud
Experience working with enterprise-level systems in order to design cloud equivalent enterprise-grade solutions
Security related certifications highly preferred

Why GuidePoint?

GuidePoint Security is a rapidly growing, profitable, privately-held value added reseller that focuses exclusively on Information Security. Since its inception in 2011, GuidePoint has grown to over 400 employees, established strategic partnerships with leading security vendors, and serves as a trusted advisor to more than 1,000 clients.
Firmly-defined core values drive all aspects of the business, which have been paramount to the company’s success and establishment of an enjoyable workplace atmosphere. At GuidePoint, your colleagues are knowledgeable, skilled, and experienced and will seek to collaborate and provide mentorship and guidance at every opportunity.
This is a unique and rare opportunity to grow your career along with one of the fastest growing companies in the nation.
Some added perks….
MacBook Air or Pro
Healthy mobile phone and home internet allowance
100% employer-paid medical and dental with generous employer family contributions
Eligibility for retirement plan after 2 months at open enrollment
Equal Opportunity Employer
GuidePoint Security, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
About Kajeet
Kajeet, Inc. is all about innovation. We are a leading wireless solutions provider enabling education, business, government and telecom service providers to customize the fast-moving world of wireless services to fit their needs. Kajeet is the leading mobile virtual network enabler, having launched the top two MSO MVNO’s, and provides the Sentinel IoT platform to a wide variety of enterprises. Kajeet is the leading wireless solution provider in K-12, helping students in over 1000 school districts. Kajeet provides innovative and optimized wireless data solutions to the SMB, Enterprise and Public Sector market across North America. For more than 15 years, we have built upon our deep expertise and agility in delivering highly configurable, unique solutions. Our management team is comprised of industry experts who seek an open environment for innovation, personal growth, and making a difference. Our fast-paced culture and focus on teamwork means you will never be bored and will have an opportunity to strengthen your professional career. The wireless world is constantly changing; we want you to be part of that journey.
Senior Solutions Architect
We are looking for a Sr. Solutions Architect! Are you ready to work closely with Clients to solve their back office challenges and to support their vision for success?
A Day in the Life Will Likely Include:
· Working with project managers and developers to translate client stories into EPICS and Stories.
· Translating EPICS, and stories into end to end billing and provisioning solution architectures. These architectures will need to include designs for basic network level considerations (firewalls, load balancers, VPN, etc).
· Translating architectures into estimates of hours required to deliver the solution and project plans which document how we will execute
· Integration of third-party solutions for payment, logistics, sales tax and insurance in order to build complete customer solutions
· Testing and Delivering BSS/OSS platforms or enhancements according to solution design/requirements, this includes working with the software quality engineers on testing and solution validation.
Sounds good? What You’ll Need to Land this Job:
· 8+ (we will fit the role to your experience!) years related experience in mobile and ideally in mobile BSS/OSS solution design.
· Agile development experience, familiarity with XML, XSD, JSON, AngularJS, SOAP, and REST to communicate with third-party solutions.
· Outstanding organizational and communication skills, familiarity with JIRA a plus.
· Knowledge of mediation and call detail record management, including the usage mediation process.
· knowledge and experience supporting Release Management.
· Ability to work with UML and other design languages to create Solution Architect artifacts.
· Review and approve test cases prepared by the QA team, triage defects and issues raised by client teams.
· Familiar with AWS Cloud services.
· Bachelors degree or equivalent.
Other skills that would really be awesome
· We value people who are self-starters, who see a problem and work to solve it.
· We need people who will take the time to first understand our customer’s objective, then design, or redesign, the solution which will meet that objective even it takes more time or effort. The customer objective is highest priority at Arterra.
The Good Stuff:
We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation, commensurate with experience, and our extensive benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.
Kajeet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other classification protected by law.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work Location:
Fully Remote

title: Mobility Solutions Lead Architect
description:
Overview:
Would you like the opportunity to work for a Fortune 200 Company with a rich tradition of success, built on a foundation of iconic brands, and state-of-the-art research and manufacturing facilities? Are you looking for an opportunity to provide direction and guidance around cellular data, equipment, and applications? If so, we want to speak with you!

We are currently seeking a highly qualified Mobility Solutions Lead Architect to join our Information Systems department in Richmond, VA. Open to remote working arrangement.

In this role you will be:
Leading aligning the vision and technology roadmap for mobile solutions.
Directing strategy and reliability among system elements as they are advanced.
Reviewing code, project output and ensuring compliance to industry best practices.
Assisting the business client, customers in explaining and applying enterprise solutions on mixed mobile platforms.
Creating the technical standards/patterns for web and hybrid enterprise mobile applications for several mobile platforms (iOS/Android/Microsoft) as well as MDM platforms (VMWare Workspace One & MS Intune).
Understanding the client necessities, creating solution requirement documents and consulting with both the product development and launching the mobility solutions.
Providing guidance and consulting around the setup and troubleshooting applications to help mobility engineers and steady state support address bugs and functional issues.
Ensuring suitable regularity of mobile solutions, structures and solutions architecture across multiple projects.

We want you to have:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, Network Technologies or related disciplines.
5+ years of experience with Apple IOS devices and Android operating systems.
Experience with Workspace ONE (AirWatch) and MS Intune.
Prior experience with Cisco Wireless infrastructure (WAP/WLC).
Strong technical writing skills.
Strong ability to build effective relationships with employees and third parties.
One of the following certifications: MS Azure – AZ-304 Azure Architecture Design, VMWare VCP-DW – VMWare Workspace ONE specialist, Microsoft MS-101 (Microsoft 365 Mobility and Security), Microsoft MD-101 (Managing Modern Desktops), AWS Certified Solution Architect (Amazon Web Services), TOGAF 9 (The Open Group Architecture Framework) is preferred.

We are committed to true innovation, process simplification, diversity and inclusion! In addition to the opportunity to apply and develop your skills toward key business objectives, we offer an excellent compensation package including a competitive base salary, comprehensive health/vision/dental insurance, and participation in our incentive compensation and deferred profit-sharing programs that you would expect from a global industry leader.
Company Overview: Altria Group is a FORTUNE 200 company that leads the premier tobacco companies in the United States. Headquartered in Richmond, Virginia, Altria Group holds diversified positions across tobacco, alcohol, and cannabis. Our tobacco companies include some of the most enduring names in American business: Philip Morris USA, U.S. Smokeless Tobacco Company, John Middleton. We have 35 percent ownership of JUUL Labs, Inc., the nation’s leading e-vapor company. And we have an 80 percent interest in Helix Innovations, which manufactures and markets on!, an oral tobacco-derived nicotine pouch product. We complement our total tobacco business with our ownership of Ste. Michelle Wine Estates and our significant equity investment in Anheuser-Busch InBev, the world's largest brewer. Altria’s significant stake in Cronos Group, a leading global cannabinoid company, represents an exciting new global growth opportunity. At Altria, we celebrate the power of diverse teams working together to shape our future. We are inspired to bring our best because our unique strengths are valued. We believe our personal success and progress should be guided by Our Cultural Aspiration, a new articulation of what we value and who we aspire to be, collectively. Our Cultural Aspiration respects and complements individual identity, embracing each other’s unique strengths, welcoming newcomers and developing the best, most inclusive and diverse teams. Over the next 10 years, we have the opportunity to make more progress on harm reduction than we have in the past 50 years. Join us as we work together to shape a better future for adult tobacco consumers, our employees, and our shareholders. Each Altria company is an equal opportunity employer.

description:

title: Principal Network Architect (US Remote)
description:
Johnson & Johnson is looking for Principal Network Architect, reporting to and working closely with Head of Global Network Architecture and Engineering to develop and lead Network strategy, roadmap and designs to help transform our future in Software Defined Networking vision, as we go through major transformation across Global Network services at J&J.
Preferred Location: NJ/NY. Secondary: US Remote
Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.
With $82.1 billion in 2020 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.
If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Reporting to Sr. Director Network Architecture, Engineering & Automation, Principal Network Architect with Cloud native/Cloud first approach, is a Lead Architect for assigned Network domain will develop strategy and collaborate in the overall development of JNJ’s Network solutions, partnering with network engineering, deployment, Ops and Security, along with other infrastructure teams including but not limited to Cloud. This position delivers on Major initiatives including Software Defined Datacenter, Multi-cloud Network Architecture and overall Network strategy execution to enable cloud networking, SDWAN and SASE(Secure Access Service Edge) architecture, etc.
The person will have deep technical hands-on experience working with Enterprise Networks, SDN/SDWAN, Multi-Cloud Network Architecture, Network Security and can provide analysis of vendor solutions and integrations with third party cloud solutions and providers.
Proficiency with Enterprise Network technologies, to develop cost efficient network designs.
Broad understanding of network virtualization, cloud computing, SDN/NFV, and overlay technologies is also desirable.
The candidate must be able to transform complex problems and abstract concepts into executable technology solutions.
The candidate will be responsible for documenting these designs and ensuring communication and delivery of these services globally.
Major Duties & Responsibilities
Establish and maintain consistent communications with peer Architects, Engineering, deployment as well as operations teams, supplier management and vendors regarding requisite network infrastructure changes and improvement opportunities.
Provide strong technical guidance and vision on Cloud native Network architecture
Lead and drive Network Automation, AWS/Azure Networking, SDN/SDWAN design, validation, Lab and PoC testing and Pilots within Global Network Services.
Own the development of network solution standards with appropriate documentation, templates, use cases and acceptance testing
Collaborate with peer organizations
Management for network standards and develop strategy to support global deployments at scale. This includes providing supporting documentation and training to the regional support teams.
Collaborate with automation and tools engineering team to drive supportable solution development with vision of Network Automation.
Conduct knowledge transfer sessions to Delivery, Operations and suppliers regarding changes in procedures, processes, documentation and frameworks.
Leads the development of a release management plan for platform connectivity solutions.
Establish and maintain regular communications with the IT and business leaders, and department heads


Qualifications
Bachelors in Computer Science OR related technical degree Or equivalent Experience
7+ years of Network Architecture, Design and/or Engineering experience with a highly available global production infrastructure.
2+ years of demonstrated experience in a large enterprise with focus on SDN/SDWAN, Cloud Networks, AWS, Azure.
5+ years of hands-on working knowledge of Network routing protocols BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, Cloud routing, Cloud infrastructure architecture, IaaS/PaaS offerings from major providers, etc
Passion of Network automation with scripting experience in at least one Terraform, Python, Perl and/or YAML is preferred.
Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Working knowledge and understanding of Route optimization, load balancing, IPAM and application protocols (HTTP/S, TCP/UDP, LDAP, SNMP, etc.) as well as means of securing communications.
knowledge of developing and deploying solutions on open source protocols and technologies.
Strong understanding of wired and wireless connectivity platforms and protocols such as DWDM, MPLS, Spanning-tree, RF optimization, 802.11x and 802.1x authentication.
Excellent written and oral communication skill with experience presenting highly conceptual designs to executives, mid-level management's, and peer engineers.
Self-motivated with keen attention to details.
Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast paced environment
Extensive experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative and multi-cultural environment
Mentor/guide the activities of network engineers and associated team members on the delivery of network services at centralized facilities and remote sites.
Provide technical and project leadership for complex data center, Campus and wide area network projects driving continuous improvement, the adaption of virtualization/automation, and a security approach.
Confidently, effectively and efficiently present complex technical topics in a manner suited to the different level of the audience.
Travel up to 10%
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Solutions Architect [Work from home]
description:
We are looking to hire an experienced IT Architect to join our team in support of one of our clients that is undergoing an exciting transformation of their business, facilitated by a complete transformation of their technology environment.

This situation offers a unique opportunity for the right person to help guide and deliver on a new technology vision for the company.
This position will be responsible for leading the design and execution of IT technical, application and integration architectures.
The primary objective of this role is to ensure that our many new solutions are designed and implemented to produce a flexible, secure and highly resilient technical environment that supports our business.
You’ll be a key technical leader on the IT team, interfacing with business and IT leaders, as well as working in the trenches with our partners to deliver solutions.
The scope of work will focus primarily on technical strategy, design and implementation of new platforms and projects.
Responsibilities will include:
Lead the technical architecture and implementation of our transformation projects.
Technical hands-on delivery and troubleshooting key integrations.
Develop architectural and technical standards to guide the development of solutions and the selection of partners and 3rd party products.
Consult with project teams and business leaders to ensure we are incorporating sound technical considerations in the scope, time and cost of new projects.
Audit our partner performance and cost effectiveness to ensure we are getting good value and that our environments are performing to business expectations.
Work with our IT Business Operations Manager to evolve our IT processes to optimize our performance within the limits of our small team and heterogeneous partner environment.
Assist the CIO and leadership team as needed
Why we think this job is great:
It’s a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you’ll work from home with tech provided by the company
You’ll have clear goals and the training resources you need to deliver. How you execute and deliver is up to you
Eligible for benefits like medical, dental, vision.
Requirements:
Minimum of 10 years as an IT professional.
Minimum of 5 years working in an architecture role. Minimum of 5 years in a business facing IT role.5+ years in IT consulting preferred.
Strong, current, and hands-on technical skills and experience including architecture, design, engineering, capacity planning, technical troubleshooting, networking, security.
Recent experience migrating applications and environments to public and private cloud solutions including: AWS, Azure, Rackspace, Google.

About Us

Bold Business is a remote-first, global outsourced-solutions company with over $7B in service solutions over the past 25 years. Our international team helps the world’s leading companies transform their ideas into bold impacts. From Fortune 500 organizations looking to reduce operational costs by 40%-60% to fast-growth startups looking to scale, we work behind the scenes and empower companies to do more for less.

If you like to move fast and have a bias for action, you’ll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We’re a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are.

Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world’s leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our 22,000 employees do the can’t be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Are you motivated to work in an environment that will challenge you, force you to continuously innovate, and work on solutions that make a difference for our customers? Do you want to be part of a transformation that leverages the AWS cloud to build and deliver new capabilities? If so, there is a future for you to support a portfolio of highly visible and strategic programs at Peraton that are developing solutions with Amazon Web Services (AWS).. Peraton’s Civil & Health sector is seeking a Staff AWS Systems Architect to support work in Washington, DC. Telework/remote support is possible for this role. Roles & Responsibilities: ·

Infrastructure automation experience
AWS Associate Level Certification

Knowledge of planning, design, and implementation tasks necessary to support a large enterprise system.

Multiple AWS Associate level Certifications or AWS Professional level Certification
Experience with Linux and Windows operating systems
DevOps, SecOps, or DevSecOps experience

STEM Degree

title: REMOTE FLEXIBILITY - Senior Systems Engineer/Solutions Archi...
description:
Description:
NOTE: Local candidates (San Diego county) will be required to follow guidelines for the rest of the San Diego team for remote/in-office work. Currently, this team is working remotely due to COVID-19; however, as an essential business and critical infrastructure services provider, our engineers are sometimes required onsite at our HQ (located at 1775 Hancock Street, Ste 110, San Diego, CA 92110) or at our clients' sites. In the future, we anticipate local employees on this team to resume the prior work-remote flexibility, which allowed employees to work remotely up to 3 days per week. Non-local candidates will be considered on a fully remote status.
Essential Duties/Responsibilities:
The Senior Systems Engineer - Azure provides senior consultative services and project work for Professional Services clients and leadership within the Professional Services team. He or she is responsible for designing, implementing, and remedying complex solutions across a broad range of technologies, with a particular focus on Azure cloud services.
He or she will be a Subject Matter Expert regarding Cloud Technology (specifically Azure and Office365) to provide architecture, consulting, project implementation, and high-level troubleshooting for public, private, and hybrid cloud infrastructure, as well as project services related to other technical strengths (2 or more of the following required):
1. Windows Servers: Provides design, project implementation, and high-level troubleshooting for infrastructure, including Windows Server (2019, 2016, 2012 R2, 2012, 2008 R2, 2003, 2000, NT) and virtualization environments on both Hyper-V and vSphere, in addition to Citrix XenApp and/or XenDesktop.
2. Active Directory: Provides design, project implementation, and high-level troubleshooting for Active Directory, including Group Policy, Access/Identity Management, Federation Services, Domain Controllers, etc. for medium to enterprise environments.
3. Networking: Provides architecture, project implementation, and high-level troubleshooting for networking infrastructure, including: Routing, switching, firewalls, WAPs, VPNs, load balancers, etc. in medium to larger LAN/WAN environments, including cloud environments (Azure, Amazon AWS).
4. Exchange/Messaging: Provides implementation, migration, and high-level troubleshooting services for Microsoft Exchange and messaging systems, including Office365.
The Senior Systems Engineer provides highly visible project work and consultation for Managed Solution clients. He or she is responsible for carrying out assigned work in the above functional areas, and any other projects as assigned by a supervisor. Additionally, he or she shall comply with all company policies and maintain strict client confidentiality.
. Requirements:
Education and Work Experience Requirements:
Bachelors’ degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field, plus a minimum of 7 years’ experience providing server/desktop support within a Microsoft environment. Equivalent combination of education, experience, and skillsets will also be considered.
Previous experience as a successful consultant for Azure/Office365 (experience planning and implementing numerous successful cloud migrations, ideally for enterprise clients)
High levels of project ownership and individual accountability in a results-oriented environment
Demonstrated commitment to continuous learning and innovation
Demonstrated commitment to strong documentation and repeatable standards
Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills, including ability to effectively communicate with internal and external customers
Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines, while maintaining a positive attitude and providing exemplary customer service
Ability to work independently and to carry out assignments to completion within parameters of instructions given, prescribed routines, and standard accepted practices
Technical Skills/Competencies:
Subject Matter Expertise related to the architecture of complex Azure/Office365 environments, including the migration to and remediation of such environments is required. Strong proficiency in at least 2 of the following areas is also required:
Windows Servers: Provides design, project implementation, and high-level troubleshooting for infrastructure, including Windows Server (2019, 2016, 2012 R2, 2012, 2008 R2, 2003, 2000, NT) and virtualization environments on both Hyper-V and vSphere, in addition to Citrix XenApp and/or XenDesktop.
Active Directory: Provides design, project implementation, and high-level troubleshooting for Active Directory, including Group Policy, Access/Identity Management, Federation Services, Domain Controllers, etc. for medium to enterprise environments.
Networking: Provides architecture, project implementation, and high-level troubleshooting for networking infrastructure, including: Routing, switching, firewalls, WAPs, VPNs, load balancers, etc. in medium to larger LAN/WAN environments, including cloud environments (Azure, Amazon AWS).
Exchange/Messaging: Provides implementation, migration, and high-level troubleshooting services for Microsoft Exchange and messaging systems, including Office365.
Other Requirements:
Ability to work a flexible schedule for occasional overnight maintenance, upgrades, etc. For California applicants, a valid CA Drivers’ License and willingness to travel to client sites within the San Diego region is required.
Remote Flexibility: Ideal candidate will be located in Southern California and/or willing to relocate, but Managed Solution may consider fully remote applicants for this position. Such employees may be required to travel onsite to the Company HQ and/or client sites on occasion.
Physical Requirements:
Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards. Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state and local standards. Must be able to lift and carry up to 10 lbs. Must be able to talk, listen, and speak clearly on telephone. The essential functions of this job require: the ability to frequently sit and stand for long periods of time; to manipulate objects with fine and gross motor skills; to communicate in written and spoken English; to hear; to utilize close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Managed Solution is an equal opportunity employer and will consider qualified applicants who can perform the essential functions of the job, with or without reasonable accommodation.
E-Verify Participation:
Federal law requires all employers to verify the identity and employment eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States. Managed Solution participates in the federal E-Verify program to validate the authenticity of work eligibility documents. As part of this program, Managed Solution will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. For more information, see https://www.uscis.gov/e-verify.

title: Security Cloud Architects
description:
CBTS is searching for multiple qualified Security Cloud Architects to implement new Security Cloud infrastructure technology across AWS, Google and Azure Cloud platforms. title: Cyber Security Architect (AWS)
description:
Experience : Architect Level

Hello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career?

We're looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Cyber Security Architect with a focus on AWS to join our consulting team. Want to help our client's build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talent on the planet? Then keep reading.

About You

You have experience in analyzing existing systems from a security and best practices perspective and proposing recommendations for improvements. Your background will include experience with networking (Windows and Linux) and web hosting and how this translates to the cloud. Your focus will be on Amazon Web Service systems. You'll have experience with multi-account AWS infrastructure and good governance mechanisms. You have expert knowledge of IAM, hybrid on-premises and cloud systems, and how AWS native security solutions (GuardDuty, SecurityHub, Macie.) factor into the mix.

You'll be broadly familiar with concepts such as GDPR, CCPA, ISO-27001, PCI compliance and MITRE ATT&CK, but don't need to be an expert in all of them. You understand DevOps processes and how infrastructure as code can be used to build out cloud systems. Your security background may have included working as one or more of: a security analyst, managing endpoint solutions, Blue Team or Red Team, Cloud Incident Response or architecting secure multi-cloud systems in the past.

You know what a SIEM is. You're familiar with secret vaulting choices, PAM and monitoring options that can be leveraged in AWS. You'll understand concepts around DevSecOps pipelines including static analysis, secret scanning and container vulnerability scanning. You augment your knowledge of cloud systems by using tools such as ScoutSuite for asset and vulnerability detection.

You'll be familiar with agent/endpoint security and have been exposed to tools like Nessus/Tenable.io, CrowdStrike, BitDefender or similar. You'll also be familiar with cloud-native security options. As well as being AWS focused you'll be a generalist when it comes to information security. You attend conferences, and even better talk/volunteer/help organize them. You enjoy CTF challenges, reading or listening to podcasts on the subject. You are happy presenting to clients including senior management and have good written skills for compiling findings and recommendations reports.

Finally, you have a passion for learning. You won't mind expanding your skill set, and getting some exposure to Azure and GCP, especially to help understand how these factor into multi-cloud solutions with AWS and Active Directory in the mix.

Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. Modus requires all team members to overlap with EST morning hours daily. In addition, reliable high speed internet is a must.
[In reference to requisitions 642, 653]

Things You Might Do

Modus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:

Give back to the community via open source and blog posts
Travel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply.
Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwide
Interact directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its values

Why Modus Create:
Our Benefits may vary according to the Country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.

If you live in the USA and you become a full time employee at our office we offer:

Competitive compensation
Health insurance coverage and 401k
Comprehensive dental, vision, and life insurance plans
Remote work
The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

If you become a contractor we offer:
Competitive compensation

100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)

Travel according to client's needs

The chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging tech

Do you have what it takes? Apply today!

About Modus

Modus Create is a digital product agency that accelerates digital transformation. We use high performing small teams, emerging technology, and "new school" product development tools and methods to accelerate business outcomes. We support our clients across four core delivery areas: business and product strategy consulting, customer experience, cloud services, and Agile software delivery.

Driven by a team of world-class talent, we have been recognized by the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies 5 years in a row, the Washington Business Journal list of Fastest Growing Companies in the Washington, DC area two years in a row, and a top company for remote work by FlexJobs. We're also an official partner to Atlassian, AWS, Cloudflare, GitHub, InVision, Ionic Framework, and Vue.js!

Based on the model of an open source team, Modites work remotely, and are located across the globe. That's allowed us to hire the best talent in the world, no matter where they live. Our highly collaborative, autonomous, and effective working environment is fueled by a team unified by a love of continuous learning. Our years of thought leadership including books, whitepapers, blog posts, conference and MeetUp talks, demonstrate our commitment to sharing what we've learned.

We encourage every Modus employee to do the same. Our company is a platform for the growth of our employees. Through working with our distributed team of experts on challenging projects, every person that joins the Modus team can expect to continue growing and learning every day. This is your chance to be part of building something great.

title: Manufacturing IT, Data Architect
description:
at Rivian Automotive
United States, Illinois, Normal
Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.
As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.
Role Summary:
The Information Technology org at Rivian is seeking a Sr. Staff Engineer, Data Architect to join the Manufacturing IT team who can provide leadership in working with both technical and business executives in the design and architect moving the data to AWS Cloud Data Platform as a critical component.
In this role you will work with Manufacturing Engineering, MES team, Product Management, and Technology Partners to leverage best practices and reference architectures highlighting advanced analytics and data science throughout the company.
This is what you’ll do:
Lead, architect, design and develop secure, scalable, high-performance and reliable (cost effective) big data and analytics platform software and services
Define, deploy and advance processes for: SDC, CI/CD, quality checks, error handling, error notifications, security, extensibility and maintainability of big data and analytics platform software and services
Define templates and process for the design and analysis of data models, data flows, and integration patterns for structural deficiencies/soundness to build a robust and complete future state model
Lead by example to review code, look for design breaches, provide meaningful and relevant feedback to engineers, stay up-to-date with system changes and latest technologies
Comfortably present and acquire consensus using multiple methods: Written diagrams and text, in-person meetings, in-person and remote presentations to both technical and business audiences
Provide technical leadership to software developers, data scientists/engineers, and product owners/managers through brainstorming sessions, design reviews, and retrospectives.
Own the data management technical roadmap and execution aligning with peer platform organizations and product delivery, Ensure alignment with over-arching enterprise platform initiatives
Lead and mentor Rivian’s Data Analytics team members in best practices, processes and technologies in Data platforms
This is what you’ll need:
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to break down complex technical problems into simple elegant solutions understandable by non-technical business partners.
10 + years of hands-on IT experience in Data Warehouse, ETL & Reporting. Extensive experience of executing multiple data warehouse projects in variety of business domain
5+ years of deep experience in design and development in Data warehouse
Hands-on experience with Tableau.
This is where you’ll work:
Department: IT Infrastructure and Enterprise Applications
Location: Normal, IL
Equal Opportunity
Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.
Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at accessibility@rivian.com.
Privacy
We take your privacy seriously. For details please see our Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Architect with MDM and Data Governance skills
description:
Strong Architect with MDM and Data Governance skills
Job Description
The MDM Solutions Architect will be responsible for the building and enabling of MDM strategy from scratch. As well as enabling Data Quality and Data Governance processes. The candidate will be leading the design and development to build out NextGen MDM solutions for Our customers. The candidate will be responsible for leading a team of SMEs, development resources and willing to be hands-on as necessary. The candidate should have exceptional communication skills, interpersonal skills, functional and technical skills in master data management and enablement of consumption across all business functions. In this role the candidate will embrace and adhere to IT standards, processes and methodologies.
Responsibilities
Architect, Design and implement NextGen MDM solutions as well as enable consumption of master data across the ecosystem.
Compare and access the MDM tools which will fit for the customer organization based on their need and eco system.
Lead solution architecture and design by demonstrating strong solutioning skills and best practices resulting in robust, future ready, scalable MDM solutions.
Establish and maintain relationship with business stakeholders.
Manage and deliver the initiatives in a fast-paced execution environment, driving all issues to resolution with a strong focus on customer satisfaction, stakeholder management, on-time delivery and efficient task execution.
Work with global development teams – India, China, US locations.
Competencies
High performing individual with hands on experience and knowledge of implementation of Master data solutions.
Strong Functional and Technical background in software application development and its lifecycle methods using Agile.
Expertise of master data migration, integration tools and methodologies.
Expertise in Informatica ,IBM MDM, Profisee or other MDM platform, Integrations, ETL/ELT and reporting/analytics tools, APIs & Web Services.
Ability to work in a global cross-functional environment to help support and enhance business systems.
Ability to plan and execute tasks in a structured manner.
Able to work, collaborate and contribute in a team environment.
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills or experience.
Logical/Perceptive, problem solving, detail oriented, solution oriented.
Flexible and adaptable to fast paced execution environment.
Excellent verbal communication skills in articulating the latest technology trend.
Experience
10 + Years of experience in implementation and management of Master Data applications for large enterprise
Hands on implementation experience in enabling Data Quality and Data Governance solutions for the ecosystem.

title: AWS Devops Engineer/ Full Time 100% Remote (NO C2C) (Code: N...
description:
We’re looking for an experienced AWS DevOps Engineer to join a development team in Salt Lake City, UT. This is a full-time position with competitive salary & excellent benefits. This is a F/T 100% Remote position.
This is a remote position.
Must have:
*5+ years of Cloud DevOps experience
*AWS experience with EC2, S3, ELB
*Database experiences.
With over 75 years in business in our industry, we deliver exceptional products and services throughout the Intermountain West. From our humble beginnings, to our current third-generation leadership, and state-of-the art distribution facilities, we have delivered the highest quality products and services to our valued customers. Our Greek heritage runs deep within our company and is a driving force with how we view and operate our business. We’re passionate about our product. We’re passionate about family. We’re passionate about our community. And we’re passionate about your success.
JOB DESCRIPTION:
Seeking an enthusiastic and professional individual to build their career with our IT Department as a DevOps engineer who leads all automation activities related to moving on-premises workloads in the cloud (preferably into AWS). The position requires a broad range of technical skills working in AWS cloud including installation and configuration of EC2 instances, setting up of VPC’s, containerizing applications, optimizing costs, and monitoring the performance of the infrastructure that was deployed. DevOps engineer ensures company’s compute infrastructure network is highly reliable, scalable and maintainable. In addition to joining a company that has been awarded “Best Companies to Work For”, we offer excellent training, development & an outstanding benefits package. This is a dynamic role where you will be a key member of our IT Team.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Architect highly reliable & scalable infrastructure solutions in AWS
Define container orchestration & deployment strategy for the enterprise
Optimize costs on infrastructure & other services that are leveraged in AWS
Set-up monitoring infrastructure that captures all attributes related to system performance, resource utilization, application performance, & other key statistics
Capacity planning – current/future needs
Set up backup & recovery strategies using AMI’s, auto-scaling & multi-region failover
Manage and maintain releases with an eye towards automation into various environments
Identify & troubleshoot highly complex server infrastructure issues
Plan & manage server infrastructure changes and upgrades
Maintain good knowledge on emerging technologies (such as multi-cloud strategies, containers, micro-services, etc.) & best practices
Manage, prioritize & complete expected deliverables on time
Deliver on organizational goals & project outcomes
Effectively communicate technical solutions to various audiences
Share DevOps knowledge to other team members for improved maturity of the organization
THE IDEAL CANDIDATE HAS:
BS/BA in related field, or relevant experience
5+ years’ technical experience in modernizing on-premises infrastructure to a cloud-based infrastructure
Experience with Dockers container strategies in production settings
Experience with Docker orchestration frameworks - ECS, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes is a plus
AWS experience across the stack - EC2, ELB, S3, IAM, Lambda are just a few of the services we use
Experience scripting AWS operations (AWS CLI, Boto SDK, etc.)
Knowledge using Hashicorp tools (particularly Packer and Terraform)
Solid Linux experience, particularly with Ubuntu and CentOS
Strong experience with at least one scripting language (Python, Bash, Ruby)
Experience with a configuration management tool (Puppet, Chef, Ansible)
Experience implementing code pipelines with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, TeamCity)
Knowledge of MySQL, Postgres, DynamoDB, MongoDB or Redis
Experience in managing and releasing code using automation a strong plus
Have a broad understanding of development, web operations, SDLC
Strong sense of ownership. Willingness to go above and beyond to chase down loose ends that lead to successful project delivery
Ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
Ability to make sound technical decisions.
Ability to develop relationships and work with a wide variety of people.
WHAT IS OFFERED?
Competitive compensation package and generous Health benefits (Medical, dental and vision)
401K profit-sharing plan
HSA with employer contributions
Wellness program with premium incentives
Tuition reimbursement up to $4,000 per calendar year
Driven work environment that recognizes, respects and appreciates results
Must be able to perform essential duties and responsibilities efficiently, accurately and safely with or without accommodation. Must comply with all company policies and procedures, as well as, state, federal and safety regulations
EOE/AA/M/F/VET/DISABILITY
Drug Free Workplace

title: Infrastructure Domain Architect (US Remote Available)
description:
Job Description
The infrastructure architect is a domain-level architect who can demonstrate mastery of multiple infrastructure subject areas. This includes, but is not limited to: network engineering, infrastructure as a service (IaaS), storage, virtualization, client platform engineering, and compute. Moreover, this role requires deep experience with service design and operations methodologies to ensure solutions are scalable, manageable, and measurable.
Directly aligned with the Senior Director, Corporate Infrastructure Solutions, the key focus of this role is to provide holistic oversight of all infrastructure design areas. You will be responsible for driving infrastructure transformation at a hyper growth company focused on highly scalable, resilient, and secured infrastructure services to meet enterprise service level standards. You will lead the effort of creating our multi-year technology strategy and roadmap with a primary focus of becoming a cloud-first infrastructure environment.
Finally, this role will work in close concert with the enterprise architecture team at Splunk to ensure all designs and solutions adhere to enterprise frameworks and standards.
What you'll do: Yeah, I want to and can do that.
You will define and drive architecture standards and patterns across all Corp Infrastructure teams. Guide engineers on the alignment of solution implementations conforming to evolving standards.
You will define and embed observability best practices, tools, and standards into the implementation of net new capabilities as well as refactoring existing solutions.
You will own the technology infrastructure roadmap and work closely with business partners, architecture and engineering leads to set priorities, deliver on-time, within budget and with high quality.
You will act as a role model and mentor for the Infrastructure organization leading and guiding solution architects to achieve architectural initiatives as well as leveraging winning strategies.
You will server as a member of the Architectural Review Board consisting of enterprise architect, application, data and security architect leads. This committee will work towards enterprise-wide architectural alignment, devising architectural solutions, and participating in architectural design.
Requirements: I’ve already done that or have that!
10+ years of combined experience as an infrastructure engineer, lead, and architect
4 years’ experience as an infrastructure architect at a rapidly scaling, global company delivering solutions running in Cloud infrastructure, preferably AWS
Expert level knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Solid familiarity with Google Compute Cloud (GCP) and Microsoft Azure
Knowledge of next-gen best of breed networking topologies (SDWan) and hardware stack
Understanding of application-level load-balancing design and security tooling
Proven experience in implementing outstanding security practices across the infrastructure ecosystem
Understanding of core NOC/SOC capabilities
An ability to lead with DevOps methodologies
Comfortable with immutable infrastructure/infrastructure as code (IaaC) paradigms
Site reliability engineering (SRE) expertise around service design and operations, incident management, and observability
Strategic thinker with a high level of situational intelligence to be able to work with a diverse workforce with differing opinions
High degree of technical competency (strong engineering foundation) with a passion around execution and delivery
Comfortable presenting to C-level leaders in ways that build confidence and support, and enables strategic decision making
Skilled in influencing and engaging 360 – own team, peers, multi-functional leaders and executives
Preferred knowledge and experience: These are a huge plus.
Current certifications in cloud infrastructure such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
Experience with Client Platform Engineering (CPE), Identity & Access Management (IAM), and Collaboration functions
Experience in scaling technologies such as JAMF, Puppet, Absolute, OKTA, Sailpoint, Slack, G Suite, etc.
TOGAF / Zachman framework familiarity
Agile certifications
Education: Got it!
BS or MS in Computer Science, Information Technology/Systems or equivalent experience required
What We Offer You: Wow, I want that.
A constant stream of new things for you to learn. We're always expanding into new areas, bringing in open source projects and contributing back, and exploring new technologies.
A set of extraordinarily hardworking, innovative, open, fun and dedicated peers, all the way from engineering and QA to product management and customer support.
Growth and mentorship. We believe in growing engineers through ownership and leadership opportunities. We also believe mentors help both sides of the equation.
A stable, collaborative and supportive work environment.
We don't expect people to work 12 hour days. We want you to have a successful time outside of work too. Want to work from home sometimes? No problem. We trust our colleagues to be responsible with their time and dedication and believe that balance helps cultivate an extraordinary environment
This isn’t a job – it’s a life changer – are you ready?
Splunk has been named one of San Francisco Bay Area’s “Best Places to Work” by the San Francisco Business Times, ten years in a row. We offer a highly competitive compensation package and a plethora of benefits.
Splunk is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Technical Staff: Cloud Architect (Remote)
description:
Dell is a collective of customer-obsessed, industry-leading visionaries. We believe that technology is essential for driving human progress, and the technology we provide transforms the way we all work and live. But we are more than a technology company — we are a people company. We recognize that over 100,000 employees across six continents have different interests and aspirations. We inspire, challenge and respect each and every employee, every day. We offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits and unparalleled growth and development opportunities — all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.
Dell Technologies Cloud Engineering (DTCE) is redefining the way businesses all over the world realize their cloud strategy. The opportunities to reshape the cloud are massive. We will do this through our uniquely differentiated approach, unparalleled commitment to customer success and focus on innovation. Cloud is not a destination, but instead an operating and consumption model. It is about paying only for what you need when you need it. It is about easily adopting and managing at the software and not infrastructure level. It is reducing time to market by streamlining the provisioning of capacity and functionality. DTCE is simplifying the hybrid cloud (private plus public) experience. If want to join the ‘ground-floor’ of a massive transformational effort and feel excited by the opportunity to lead a generational movement for ourselves and our customers – this role may be just the right opportunity for you!
As the Cloud Architect, you will be a primary driver that helps architect, design and develop Cloud Solutions and Services as well as the Dell Cloud Control Plane using micro-service based architecture that is deployed on a service-mesh using modern orchestration technologies. The Cloud Control Plane is the platform that creates unified cloud experience for Dell Technologies products, services and solutions. You will be accountable for the following:
Cloud Architecture and Design
Research, validate and architect the cloud control plane using a micro-services based architecture creating architecture designs for the product
Create and Architect solutions that are offered through the Cloud Control Plane and can be operated in cloud like fashion
Collaborating with product management and business users.
Cloud Thought Leadership
Provide thought leadership in cloud technologies for the Dell Technologies Cloud Engineering team.
Be an advocate for customer requirements across Dell Technologies for Cloud Products and Services
Mentor other members of Dell Cloud team
Participate in design collaboration and code reviews
Develop patents and publications
Skills Requirements
At least 15 years of experience architecting and developing applications and/or solutions in the cloud using cloud native technologies preferably in AWS, GCP, Azure or private cloud.
Deep understanding of Software Defined Services and how to implement ‘as a service’ offerings
Good understanding on security implications in the cloud operating model
In depth knowledge of virtualization, containers, service-mesh and enterprise service bus
Knowledge of design patterns specifically for distributed computing
Experience designing REST based APIs to expose and consume services.
Experience designing and building high performance systems with scalability, availability, fault-tolerance, monitoring and serviceability
Experience working with Infrastructure as a Code
CloudBU
"LIPriority"
Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages.

title: Developer
description:
AWS Developer
The National Coordination Center (NCC), powered by Edera L3C, is a fast-growing healthcare consultancy that connects the nation's brightest minds to solve the most pressing issues in healthcare.
NCC identifies experts focused on organizational change management, communications, innovation, patient experience, and interoperability and connects them with federal and commercial clients in need. NCC not only strives for excellence in the services we deliver and the materials we produce, but we also are mission driven.
We aim to support the communities we live and work in by serving some of the world’s largest health IT vendors, government clients, health systems, and payers.
The AWS Developer will support the ongoing development of our AWS environment to include development of Salesforce AppExchange and AWS Marketplace applications. The successful candidate will have a record of success in improving processes and adoption using the AWS platform. The Solution Architect will work closely with functional leaders, organizational units, and subject matter experts to identify, configure, deploy, and maintain business processes. The AWS Developer/Solution Architect will be responsible for the executing on the day-to-day configuration, support, maintenance and improvement of our TELEHEALTH, CHANGE MANAGEMENT, and PROJECT MANAGEMENT solutions for different clients. Minimum AWS Associate level certification
US Citizen with the ability to obtain Government Clearance

Strong oral and written communication skills

title: Technical Architect (AWS) - Open to Remote
description:
Medidata: Conquering Diseases Together
Medidata is leading the digital transformation of life sciences, creating hope for millions of patients. Medidata helps generate the evidence and insights to help pharmaceutical, biotech, medical device and diagnostics companies, and academic researchers accelerate value, minimize risk, and optimize outcomes. More than one million registered users across 1,400 customers and partners access the world's most-used platform for clinical development, commercial, and real-world data. Medidata, a Dassault Systèmes company, is headquartered in New York City and has offices around the world to meet the needs of its customers. Discover more at www.medidata.com.

Your Mission:
Your role in this endeavor will be to leverage modern, cloud-agnostic, microservice architectural design principles to build a highly scalable services & data platform to support diverse functions-as-a-service.
Deploy and maintain highly scalable cloud-native microservices architectures.
Implement automation, effective monitoring, and infrastructure-as-code.
Stand-up infrastructures locally or in the cloud to quickly compare alternative architectures and recommend approaches that best balance competing tradeoffs
Evaluate and recommend comparable alternative cloud services on a variety of technical and cost-based factors to best meet project goals.

Your Competencies:

Required Skills
Create data models in various languages and conforming to various industry standards to move data through an integration process.
Demonstrated ability to deliver effective solutions to complex problems independently.
Extensive experience building solutions combining multiple AWS services, particularly Lambda, Kinesis, EMR, S3, ElasticSearch, Kibana, CloudFormation and Serverless Application Model in the context of data-oriented projects.
Deep familiarity with REST API semantics, including common authentication models like OAUTH2.
Strong relational database skills, both in designing schemas and coding and analyzing complex SQL queries.

Preferred Skills
Strong experience with continuous integration, deployment and monitoring.
Knowledge of security best practices.
Multilingual fluency in bash, python, java, node, ruby, some variant of C and the many other languages engineers use in a large company environment.

Your Education and Experience:
8+ years related work experience in at least 3 IT disciplines (technical architecture, solution/application architecture, application development, middleware design, operations)
5+ years architecting enterprise services-based distributed systems and data intensive solutions
Experience designing for large scale, highly available, fault tolerant transactional and analytical systems in a dynamic environment
Demonstrated experience with business process and performance modeling, benchmarking, and financial analysis
Experience building enterprise architecture roadmaps
Experience designing and managing complex infrastructure and cloud solutions
Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts applicable to the design and operations of scalable distributed systems
Exposure to ETL architectures, data movement technologies, data integration solutions, and business information systems
Knowledge of Big Data, Streaming, and noSQL data systems
Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and/or data design for cloud computing/multi-tenant/distributed systems
Identity and Access Management experience is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field

Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.
Medidata Solutions have powered over 17,000+ clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner.

Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

title: Analytics Data Engineer
description:
Analytics Data Engineer

Craft analytics data pipelines and data preparation (Scala/Spark/Glue); often utilizing “big data” practices for existing and new products.
Build and enhance multiple RedShift data warehouses for various applications. Understand proper sizing of RedShift for application needs.
Work with architects and engineers to build enterprise data strategies - keeping in mind best practices for the company while achieving milestones on individual projects.
Utilize DevOps practices to perform automated application deployments in AWS.
Work closely with product management teams and platform engineering teams to change Healthcare in the US.

3+ years' experience in Data Engineering (e.g., SQL, Scala, Python) with sound coding practices (e.g., style guide, modularity, unit test, best practices)
1+ years’ experience with AWS RedShift with abilities to write DDL, stored procedures, and user access scripts.
Experience managing internal and client-facing projects, troubleshooting technical issues, working with cross-functional stakeholders.

Experience with security practices and industry standards security technologies.

Healthcare industry experience.

Infrequent travel.
