title: Cloud Architect, AWS Architecture and Engineering
description:
We are expanding our team of motivated technologists with a proven track record of delivering results in technology consulting. Specifically looking for a Cloud Architect who's passionate about helping customers build applications at scale. Being an experienced technologist with technical depth and breadth, aided with strong interpersonal skills, you will work directly with customers as part of a delivery team helping to enable innovation through continuous delivery across technology stacks and creating robust solution designs that align to business goals. Your insight and experience will help our delivery teams build architectures and provide prescriptive guidance across network, storage, operating systems, virtualization, RDBMS & NoSQL databases, security, and automation. In addition, you will work with mid-tier technologies that include application integration, in-memory caches, security, and much more!

The qualified Cloud Architect will have demonstrated the ability to think strategically about businesses, create technical definitions around customer objectives in complex situations, develop solution strategies, motivate & mobilize resources, and deliver results. The ability to connect technology with measurable business value is a critical component to be successful in this role. We seek team members who are self-motivated, driven, collaborative, passionate about AWS and want to have a direct positive impact on our customer's business. Strong communication skills and emotional intelligence are also needed to help develop a team reporting to you. #onica
What you'll be doing
As the Cloud Architect, you will be technically focused but also will understand and implement business planning
Be the technical liaison between customers and engineering resources
Provide tactical scope and work directly with the business representatives/customers to understand the requirements driving the need for a solution to be developed
Communicate effectively with both business and technical colleagues throughout the course of the project
Ensure that all the appropriate questions are asked and verify that nothing crucial to the success of the project is overlooked
Be an AWS evangelist by educating a variety of customers on the value of AWS
Help customers transition to the cloud in a high-value migration approach that leverages best of breed designs and practices delivered in an agile model.
Work with customers to enable a DevOps culture and modernize operations and release strategies
Establish credibility and build impactful relationships with our customers to enable them to be cloud advocates
Participate in deep architectural discussions to build confidence and ensure customer success when building new, or migrating existing, applications, software and services on the AWS platform.
Conduct deep-dive “hands-on” education/training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers interested in AWS and to ensure our SAs are up to date
Attend and present valuable information at Industry Events
Traveling up to 30% of the time
Requirements
5+ years design & implementation experience with distributed applications
5+ years of experience in networking, infrastructure, or database architectures
In depth understanding and professional experience with AWS services and infrastructure
"Hands on" experience with practices and services related to Automation, IaC and DevOps
Demonstrated knowledge of software development tools and methodologies
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT management, and developers
Excellent communication skills with an ability to right level conversations
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly
Nice to have
5+ years’ of experience in customer-facing software/technology or consulting
3+ years’ of experience with “on-premises to cloud” migrations or IT transformations
3+ years’ of experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS (ideally) or other Cloud platforms
Technical degree; Computer Science or related
AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional certification and/or other AWS certifications

About Rackspace Technology
We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology
Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Position is available for remote work in the following states unless otherwise specified. Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Connecticut, Delaware, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming.

title: Solutions Architect
description:
We are looking for a Solutions Architect at our Fairfax, VA operations!
The Solutions Architect will play a critical role in supporting our Public Sector Group. The ideal candidate for this position will work in a hands-on capacity with clients as a trusted advisor, lead design, and technical discussions and assist in the design of technical solutions for proposals. We are looking for a creative technologist who can communicate technology decisions to business leadership. Preventing the problem is the goal but finding the solution is your focus. You believe that it can always be made better, faster, and more reliable!
Why you'll love working here:
Generous vacation and retirement plans
Employee support program
Ongoing training and development opportunities, peer-taught lunch and
Friendly community with lots of social events
Participation in charity initiatives
Technologies you'll use:
AWS, Azure, GCP, Java, C++, Python or Ruby, Active Directory, Networking, Kubernetes, Mesos, DC/OS, Swarm
Here’s what you’ll be doing day to day:
Client facing:
Operational excellence: accountable to our Chief Technology Officer for delivering customer’s technology strategies aligned with the customer’s business objectives.
Lead: Provide leadership in large scale infrastructure migration methodologies and techniques (IaaS/PaaS) including application migrations to cloud platforms (Azure, AWS and / or GCP) within a large enterprise environment.
Partner: Assist clients in defining the business case for innovative cloud solutions, design the solution to help with prototyping and development with focus on DevOps, and take solution through to launch.
Technology Advisor: Demonstrate thought leadership in cloud computing and become a trusted advisor to decision makers. Demonstrate a well-balanced approach to addressing complex infrastructure concepts. Maintain awareness of and Evaluate emerging cloud capabilities, technologies and tools, develop technical domain roadmaps pertinent to public cloud technologies and capabilities
Design: Responsible for designing cloud solution resources, both IaaS and PaaS, that enable the business to securely run sensitive workloads within a cloud environment. Engineering and designing large scale enterprise infrastructure and integration patterns for cloud environments.
Internal:
Continuous Improvement: You will help and drive internal CI initiatives as it relates to developing the cloud/infrastructure practice. Also, our team maintains a variety of platform technology, including application performance monitoring, automated cloud provisioning templates, and automated bootstrap and configuration management code. You will provide input on industry standards and collaborate with fellow team leaders on the prioritization and execution of ongoing platform improvement initiatives.
Collaboration: Work with onsite or nearshore teams to cloud solutions, templates, and backend business logic/orchestration layer. You will also work very closely with Accounts and Program Management teams.
Problem-Solving: Provide resolution of product or platform issues in a multi-vendor client environment
Implementation: Champion creation and implementation of standards, policies, and change management best practices.
Mentorship: As a senior technical lead, guide technical staff in resolving technical architecture and design issues.
What you must have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or other related scientific or technical discipline.
5 or more years of experience with AWS, Azure, or container cloud services.
Certified AWS or GCP, Azure, or other cloud, or ready to get certified
8-10 years of experience finding and fixing critical, customer facing production issues.
5 or more years’ experience in the development of object-oriented software with languages like Java, C++, Python or Ruby ideally in SOA applications.
What we'd like you to have:
Demonstrated understanding of networking and core Internet protocols (e.g. TCP/IP, DNS, SMTP, HTTP, and distributed networks).
Demonstrated understanding of industry standards for building services in IaaS/PaaS/SaaS in Cloud environments.
Demonstrated understanding of TOGAF and SAFe.
Preferably experience with modern container orchestration systems: Kubernetes, Mesos, DC/OS, Swarm.
Experience in leading human centered design workshops.
Working at ICF
Working at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow.
ICF is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. (EOE – Minorities/Females/ Protected Veterans Status/Disability Status/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity). For more information, please read our EEO & AA policy .
Reasonable Accommodations are available for disabled veterans and applicants with disabilities in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please email icfcareercenter@icf.com and we will be happy to assist. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations. Read more about non-discrimination: EEO is the law and Pay Transparency Statement .

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Cloud Architect
Location: U.S. Remote
Duration: 6+ Months Contract
Cloud Architecture and Design, Development and Operations (50%)
Demonstrate knowledge of cloud architecture and implementation features (OS, multi-tenancy, virtualization, orchestration, elastic scalability)
Demonstrate knowledge of DevOps tool chains and processes.
Act as a Subject Matter Expert to the organization’s cloud end-to-end architecture, including AWS and Azure, networking, provisioning, and management.
Develop a library of deployable and documented cloud design patterns, based on the application portfolio, as a basis for deploying services to the cloud.

articulate several options, the pros and cons for each, and a recommendation.
Maintain overall industry knowledge on latest trends, technology, etc.
Develop solutions architecture and evaluate architectural alternatives for public and multi cloud models, including IaaS, PaaS, and other cloud services.
Contribute to DevOps development activities and complex development tasks.
Define optimal design patterns and solutions for high availability and disaster recovery for applications.
Thought Leadership (20%)
Provide thought leadership in industry and to fellow team members across business and technical project dimensions solving complex business requirements.
Demonstrate forward thinking around where the organization is going and how technology can support these efforts.
Advocate and define cloud architecture vision from a strategic perspective, including internal and external platforms, tools, and systems.
Consultation (15%)
Drive scope definition, requirements analysis, functional and technical design, product configuration, and production deployment
Ensure delivered solutions meet/perform to technical and functional/non-functional requirements.
Provide technical expertise and ownership in the diagnosis and resolution of an issue, including the determination and provision of workaround solution or escalation to service owners.
Ensure delivered solutions are realized in time frame committed; work in conjunction with project sponsors to size and manage scope and risk.
Provide support and technical governance, expertise related to cloud architectures,
deployment, and operations.
Mentoring (15%)
Act as the coach and mentor to team members and technical staff on their assigned project tasks
Lead the definition and development of cloud reference architecture and management systems.
Conduct product work reviews with team members.

8 hour shift

title: AWS Engineer (Remote)
description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. As a leader in a corporation with 83,000 employees and agency force members, you’ll have a hand in transforming not only Allstate but a dynamic industry. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them.
Where good people build rewarding careers
Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

Job Description
Allstate is looking for Big Data & Analytics Cloud Platform Engineers within the ATSV Data & Intelligent Systems Group; at D&IS we are responsible and accountable for the engineering and operation of the Allstate big data and real time analytics platforms. In this role you will work with AWS using Agile/Infrastructure as Code (IaC) methodologies to plan, test, and deploy cloud infrastructure using a variety of tools to support the enterprise analytics environment.

Responsibilities
Work with Big Data and Analytical teams to engineer and develop capabilities in the cloud that align with transformative growth business strategies and requirements.
Develop scalable, resilient and pragmatic solutions which meet technical, security, and business needs for applications and workloads.
Assist other teams across Allstate’s Data Management (D&IS) and Data Science (D3) with cloud’s fit for purpose analysis and migration of their on-premise workloads from a conceptual and technology standpoint.
Test and deploy cloud-based services to support real-time analytics workloads.
Develop and support multi-step CI/CD Infrastructure as Code pipelines for cloud environment.
Automate repeatable tasks to create efficiencies in our workflows and enable freedom for innovation.
Champion good engineering practices and help teams to define and set up frameworks for cloud adoption and consumption.
Contribute to technology strategy, engineering roadmaps, and proof of concept use cases.
Job Qualifications

Essential Experience

Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related area, or equivalent work experience.
3+ years of relevant level experience in infrastructure, analytics or solution design / architecture.
Demonstrated experience with Amazon Web Services.
Experience in automating and creating automations in a cloud environment.
Hands-on style - willingness and competence in producing necessary changes in our infrastructure and processes Technical leadership and solution design.
Collaborative and customer-oriented track record, able to work effectively across organizational and geographical boundaries.
Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions.
Demonstrable ability to learn new technologies quickly.

Desired Certifications
AWS or Azure Certified Solutions Architect
AWS or Azure Certified SysOps Administrator

Desired Experience

Experienced in utilizing “infrastructure as code” approach to provisioning highly desirable.
Automation, Configuration Management (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, Puppet), Dev-ops practices, CI/CD pipelines (e.g Jenkins).
Elementary networking skills, switching, routing, firewalls, load balancing.
Storage – NAS, SAN, JBOD, Object Storage.
Good understanding of Linux, preferably RHEL.
Development skills – Java, Scala, Python, PERL, Shell Script.
Big Data Technologies such as Hadoop, EMR, Spark, Impala, Kafka, etc.
Integration, Dataflow management, ETL.
Data Warehousing, SQL, Relational Databases.
NoSQL Databases.
Linux Containers / Docker.
Workflow scheduling and management.
DR and business continuity planning.

Compensation Data
Salary $95K-$150K. Target bonus eligible. Offer will be commensurate with experience.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.
As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life - including a generous paid time off policy.

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

title: DevOps Engineer (Remote 611-1)
description:
Title : DevOps Engineer
Location : Remote
Duration : 6 months

** Candidate should be able to work on W2 **

Job Description:
A DevOps Engineer at Client will be responsible for enabling the development and deployment of different services and applications, working to operationalize new applications and supporting agile teams by enabling Continuous Delivery (CD) and Continuous Integration best practices (CI).
This includes building out tools and automation features to help keep client’s core platform and applications running and available.
Additional responsibilities consist of keeping client’s platforms up, actively monitoring the stacks, ensuring automated builds and deployments are functioning successfully and working with Quality and Security teams to enable automated QA and Security testing capabilities.
The DevOps Engineer will juggle multiple tasks requiring multiple skills.
The DevOps Engineer will help script out solutions, build long-term solutions, and help keep production or staging or development environments as pristine and up as possible.
Must be experienced automating routine tasks.
A primary focus of the job involves keeping systems scaling and maintained.
Candidates must have some experience with infrastructure security to keep client’s data secure and protected.
Specific responsibilities include:
Design, architect, and implement next generation Cloud architecture and automation solutions
Implement, maintain, and improve Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery environments
Own and lead initiatives to define, design, and implement DevOps solutions which includes reference architectures, estimates, and costing
Provide technical leadership, project guidance, and technology implementation in various areas such as UI, COTS applications, SaaS applications, APIs, Micro-services etc
Be an enabler for a successful and smooth transition from development to delivery of technology applications
Perform profiling, troubleshooting of existing solutions
Create technical documentation
Client is looking for:
The success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:
5 plus years experience working with Cloud platforms (AWS preferred, Google Cloud and Azure experience also a plus)
5 plus years experience working with Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) environments
3 plus years experience working with Continuous Integration (CI) tools such as Gitlab (preferred) or Bamboo
3 plus years experience working to architect, design, develop automation solutions that help reduce delivery cycle time and support Continuous Delivery (CD)
2 plus years of experience administering, tuning and configuring Kubernetes. AWS EKS ( preferred )
1 plus years of experience in automation using terraform
Proficient in a development or scripting language such as Python, Bash
Experience working with containerized applications and deployment using Kubernetes, Docker
Have experience driving automation of processes, build tools, and maintaining uptime or availability of large deployments
To fulfill this role successfully, candidate should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:
Minimum Years of Experience:
Seven (7) years of professional experience in technology or a related field
Minimum Years of Experience:
Two ( 2 ) years managing and scaling production container environment in kubernetes
It would be helpful in this position for candidate to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree, or Associate’s Degree plus 6 plus years of Technology related experience
Years of Experience:
Seven (3) plus years working as a DevOps or SRE engineer

title: Solutions Architect (Channel Integrations) - AWS Data Exchan...
description:
7+ years design/implementation/consulting experience with distributed applications.
7+ of experience in infrastructure architecture, database architecture, applications, and networking.
5+ years of experience working with ISVs
5+ years of experience working with APIs
3+ years cloud and/or AWS experience
AWS Exchange is democratizing the way millions of customers find, subscribe to, and use third-party in the cloud. We have thousands of products from more than 180 providers, and we make it easier for developers, academics, enterprises, and scientific researchers to find the they need to cure diseases, manage their food supply chain, and recommend the best movies when all you want to do is relax. As a recently launched service based in NYC, this is your chance to work in a start-up like environment within AWS.

Customers tell us they want using in the cloud to be as easy as it is to shop online. But with existing solutions it can take hundreds of hours to get access to and start using third-party . AWS Exchange reduces that process to minutes so builders can jump straight to using to solve problems.

AWS Exchange is looking for a Senior Solutions Architect to be the technical owner for AWS Exchange engagements with our key ISVs and consulting partners. Many of our customers use Independent Software Vendor (ISV) solutions and consulting partners to help in their -licensing life cycle, including preparation, analysis, and visualization. In this role, you will work directly with work directly with AWS Exchange’s Channel Program leader on technical discussions and integrations (including relevant APIs) into partner platforms.

You will be responsible working directly with our ISV and consulting partners who wish to integrate with AWS Exchange, and collaborate with them to ensure our mutual customers have the best experience possible. You will serve as the primary technical point of contact on integration engagements and be responsible for understanding AWS APIs, technical workflows, integration points, and timelines as required. This includes helping our partners understand how connectors, APIs and other technical components interoperate to build exceptional user experiences.

You will work collaboratively with internal product managers, engineers, and business leaders to communicate customer feedback, uncover issues and help design relevant solutions. You will also lead the writing and reviewing of technical blogs that highlight ways to integrate with AWS Exchange that include customer/partner successes.

Responsibilities:
Directly supports our partner’s AWS Exchange technical needs
Actively managing the integration projects with a portfolio of ISV and consulting partners that integrate our APIs
Works with partners to set and meet milestones and deliverables to deliver high-quality integration projects
Develops reference architectures for integrations to help us achieve integrations at-scale
Engaging internal and external stakeholders to define integration requirements, test integrations, verify and document processes
Gathering requirements and help us build the tools and processes to increase the ease and efficiency with which partners integrate with us
Tracks, monitors, and drives improvements and support the launches of new technical features
Life/work balance
Our team is focused on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy and by prioritizing solutions and processes that enable us to scale faster than the business. There will be opportunities to work from home some days, as travel can be up to 50% to meet with customers, prospects, partners, account teams. Work hours can be flexible and typically self-defined. Preferred locations for this role are New York, Boston, San Francisco, Seattle, or London. However, virtual or other locations in similar time zones will be considered depending on candidate experience and relative location to key stakeholders.

Mentorship & Career Growth
We are dedicated to supporting new team members. Our team has a broad mix of experience levels and Amazon tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth. You will work on projects and tasks that will develop your skills and enable you to take on increasingly complex tasks.

Inclusive Team Culture
Our team is intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. We’re looking for a new teammate who is enthusiastic, empathetic, curious, motivated, reliable, and able to work effectively with a diverse team of peers; someone who will help us amplify the positive & inclusive team culture we’ve been building.

Masters or other advanced degree
BA/BS degree is desired; Information Technology, Computer Science or Technical background highly desired
Intermediate/advanced knowledge of the AWS services.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Pursuant to the Los Angeles Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

title: Principal Solutions Architect (Remote)
description:
Corporate Summary
As one of the largest investor-owned companies in the U.S. utility sector, PPL Corporation delivers on its promises to customers, investors, employees and the communities we serve. Our utilities - Western Power Distribution, Louisville Gas and Electric and Kentucky Utilities, and PPL Electric Utilities - provide an outstanding service experience for our customers, consistently ranking among the best in the United States and the United Kingdom. PPL has grown from a company with customers and facilities in one region of Pennsylvania to a diverse energy company with more than 10 million customers in the U.S. and the U.K. PPL provides energy for millions of customers while providing challenging and rewarding careers for thousands of employees around the U.S. and abroad.
Experience Level
Professional
Regular or Temporary
Regular
Full-time or Part-time
Full-Time
Position Summary
Fully remote opportunity

The Principal Solution Architect will be responsible for full end-to-end solution architecture and support one or more system architects by providing, communicating, and evolving the broader technology and architectural view of the enterprise. They are recognized as an expert in Enterprise, Functional and Integration architecture conforming to Enterprise architecture standards and goals. The ideal candidate will be hands-on and be strongly driven to keep abreast of the latest technology trends and proactively strive to apply them to new and existing systems. They will have demonstrated expertise in one or more of the following areas – Cloud (multi-provider), legacy modernization, DevOps, API/Microservices, Event driven architecture etc. We are looking for someone who is outcome focused, loves challenges, can work collaboratively, and exemplifies the virtues of our talent model: Humble, Hungry and Smart. The position reports to the Chief Architect and is an individual contributor role.
Primary Responsibilities
1. Provide architectural leadership and expertise in the creation of end-to-end technical solutions across the enterprise
2. Work with one or more System Architects to champion the adoption of patterns, platforms, and tools to support the usage and conformity of solution architecture.
3. Define subsystems and their interfaces, allocate responsibilities to subsystems, understand solution deployment, and communicate requirements for interactions with solution context.
4. Hands-on technologist, who has grown through the development ranks and has pivoted to Solution Architecture.
5. Hands-on experience producing detailed technical diagrams and authoring technical documentation with demonstrated experience in architecting cloud native solutions with platforms such as Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.
6. Participate in planning, definition, and high-level design of the solution and exploration of solution alternatives.
7. Ensure that emergent design choices are made with an understanding of the overall solution and minimize technology complexity and avoid unnecessary duplication of capabilities.
8. Work with portfolio stakeholders, notably the Chief Architect, to develop, analyze, split, and realize the implementation of solutions.
9. Plan and develop the Architectural Runway in support of new business Features and Capabilities.
10. Assess wider industry technology trends and best practices to identify best-in-class Technology and architecture directions and play an active role in identifying new technologies for improving systems.
11. Contribute towards the improvement of the Architecture process and adhere to Architectural technology standards.
12. Develop and maintain architectural assets including reference architectures, models, blueprints, roadmaps, frameworks, patterns and services.
13. Ensure common architecture decisions are implemented consistently across business and IT systems to support the business and IT strategies.
14. Significant expertise in architecting technical solutions that include Microservices, event-driven systems, container management (AKS, GKE, ECS, OpenShift, Rancher, etc.), messaging systems (RabbitMQ, MQ, Kafka, etc.), data management, continuous integration / continuous deployment (Jenkins, Ansible, Terraform etc.), API Management (Apigee, Kong etc.), Legacy Modernization, Application Rationalization, management of technical debt.
15. May be assigned an Electric Utilities emergency and storm role. This is a special assignment that comes into play during storms and other emergencies when the company needs to restore power or respond to other issues affecting customer service. This role may necessitate the need to work after-hours, outside of your normal schedule.
16. The company reserves the right to determine if this position will be assigned to work on-site, remotely, or a combination of both. Assigned work location may change. In the case of remote work, physical presence in the office/on-site may be required to engage in face-to-face interaction and coordination of work among direct reports and co-workers.
Candidate Qualifications
Candidates must meet the basic qualifications and pass all required tests or assessments to receive consideration.In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility form upon hire.
Basic Qualifications
1. Bachelor's degree and 8+ years of related work experience OR Masters and 5+ years of related work experience.
2. Minimum 5 years’ experience architecting solutions that include automation, mobile, data management, integration technologies and deployment on cloud infrastructures, preferably for large enterprises.
3. Excitement, curiosity, and passion for shaping the future through digital technology.
4. Strong knowledge of advanced technology architecture and emerging trends.
5. Strong hands-on development experience, ability to roll up sleeves and code as needed.
6. Familiar with the latest technologies, trends, standards, products, and applicability.
7. Ability to effectively adapt to rapid technological and business change while maintaining enthusiasm and displaying sound judgment.
8. A creative and analytical problem solver focused on translating complex business problems into architecturally sound technical solutions.
9. Excellent interpersonal relations skills
10. Experience with Agile methodologies and fast-paced environment required.
11. Driven, self-motivated, able to work under pressure using sound judgment & professionalism.
12. Demonstrates a craving for continuous improvement, through understanding of new technology innovation and its application.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Our company is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer dedicated to diversity and the strength it brings to the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identify, genetic information, disability status, or any other protected characteristic.

23-Mar-2022

title: DevOps Engineer III - AWS
description:
Overview & Responsibilities
Rackspace is seeking an AWS DevOps Engineer to join our team in San Antonio or Remote.

In this role you will be part of the team that architects, implements and deploys our AWS cloud-based offerings. We are looking for an engineer to work in both the commercial and government space. As such, clearance (application to be paid for by Rackspace) is required, as is proof of U.S. citizenship.

Customer Focus: Our DevOps Engineers get to build one-of-a-kind, cutting edge cloud solutions for some of our top enterprise customers. Our primary focus is to distill confidence in our customers by creating customized solutions and a top-notch customer onboarding experience.

Automation: Customer deployments should be solidly reliable and repeatable. Knowledge of tools like Github, Terraform, and CDK are critical to achieving this goal. If you enjoy writing programmatic solutions to reduce customer turnaround time and your own workload, this team is for you.

Responsibilities:
Work with a talented and highly engaged team of Engineers, Relationship Managers and Product Team
Automate deployments utilizing custom templates and modules for customer environments on AWS.
Architect AWS environment best practices and deployment methodologies
Create automation tools and processes to improve Team and Racker day to day functions
Educate customers on AWS and Rackspace best practices and architecture
Assist in educational briefings for teammates to advance in technical trainings for continued growth
Act as an escalation point for our AWS Support Engineers when required
Provide a continuous Fanatical Support experience for our customers

Qualifications:
2+ years experience as a DevOps engineer.
Working knowledge of Amazon Web Services Products & Services, Caching, Object and Block Storage, Scaling, Load Balancing, CDNs, Networking etc
Excellent working knowledge of Windows or Linux operating systems – experience of supporting and troubleshooting issues and performance
Intermediate understanding of central networking concepts: VLANs, layer2/3 routing, access lists & load balancing
Good understanding of design of native Cloud applications, Cloud application design patterns and practices
Working knowledge using CloudFormation and/or Terraform
Kubernetes exp. is a plus, as is exp. w/Relational and NoSQL Databases
Knowledge of databases (SQL Server and MySQL)
Working knowledge of Backup and Recovery methodology and implementations
Good knowledge of application development using Agile, and DevOps best practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with ability to communicate both technical issues to nontechnical and technical audiences
Effective with time management and expected deliverables
An ability to multi-task and work on multiple concurrent projects
Must be AWS Certified or be able to obtain certification within 90 days of starting role.

CLEARANCE REQUIREMENT:
Required ability to successfully meet CJIS requirements including background checks (including national fingerprint record checks and drug testing) and/or criminal history investigations.

About Rackspace Technology
We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.

More on Rackspace Technology
Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Position is available for remote work in the following states unless otherwise specified. Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Connecticut, Delaware, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming.

title: Application Integration Specialist ( Grant Funded )
description:
Application Integration Specialist ( Grant Funded ) - District Office
PRIMARY FUNCTION: Support the Client Relationship Management (CRM), Student Portal, AI chatbot integrations for a Title V grant. Responsible for developing and maintaining system integrations and components, including but not limited to application integrations, services, internal and external API, file transfers, and EDI and SQL queries.

The Application Integration Specialist is fully responsible for participating in requirements analysis and decomposition, design, development, internal testing, and the documentation of same for the application to application integrations. Primary responsibilities will also include troubleshooting the new CRM, Student Portal and Chatbot integrations and providing technical support to the application development team and/or stakeholders. The Application Integration Specialist is part of the Enterprise Application Development team and works in collaboration with project team for Title V Grant on all three initiatives.

Essential Job Functions:
Develop and maintain services used in application integrations.
Architect, design, build, and implement application integrations.
Design integration solutions and document the design in accordance with best practices.
Develop and maintain data integration components such as SQL queries, PL/SQL stored procedures, data extraction and cleansing, and integration with system front end components.
Write PL-SQL code to retrieve appropriate data as derived from requirements.
Work with developers to build and extract data to support data analysis.
Work with project team to understand and analyze business specifications.
Provide technical assistance to troubleshoot and resolve integration errors.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to demonstrate the College values
In depth knowledge of SQL, PL/SQL, Oracle 19c or greater.
Familiarity with database tools such as Toad or SQL Developer.
Integration Architecture (API), and best practices.
Knowledge of cloud technologies, AWS, Google Cloud, SaaS environments.
Knowledge in AI Technologies, machine learning technologies
Demonstrated strong analytical/problem solving skills and ability to follow procedures and resolve exceptions
Demonstrated ability to design and document software solutions
Strong familiarity with agile software development practices and tools
Excellent written/verbal communication and interpersonal skills with strong sense of customer service
Strong organizational skills and ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously, set priorities, and work in a team with diverse cultural backgrounds.
Solution oriented with a high sense of quality, attention to detail, accuracy, efficiency, and meeting tight deadlines.
Team player who is also able to work independently and handle conflicting priorities while maintaining consistent, quality performance standards.
Ability to manage multiple tasks within tight deadlines and prioritize effectively, while delivering high quality work.
Required Education:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field
Required Experience:
Three years of development experience required
Demonstrated experience in XML, JSON, web services, and experience with KSH, bash (shell programming), Python or related language
Experience with Linux
Experience in SFTP, shell programming data integrations
Demonstrated development experience with JAVA language
Demonstrated development experience with JavaScript, AngularJS, HTML5, and CSS
Demonstrated experience writing Web Services, RESTful, or SOAP, as well as experience writing fault-tolerant code
Experience working with ERP solutions
Experience in structured release & deployment best practices

Preferred Experience:
Experience with API Management Tools like Postman, Boomi, MuleSoft

Note:
This is a grant funded position with an expected duration of one year. An extension to the grant is possible but not guaranteed.
This position has opportunity for limited remote work arrangements with appropriate approvals and in accordance with the policies, procedures, and needs of the College.
Salary Grade: 27
Salary is based on the Board-approved salary schedule for the current fiscal year. See Salary Schedule

Posting Close Date: 6/29/2021

title: Enterprise Architect - Storage Domain (Remote - Home Based W...
description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.
Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary
As part of the Infrastructure & Cloud Architecture team, qualified candidates will be part of a highly collaborative team accountable for defining and driving our enterprise compute, network and storage strategies. You will own the definition of the desired target state and create the associated roadmaps on how to get there on several infrastructure and cloud related initiatives.
You will be working with the latest technologies through vendor relationships and proof of concepts, solving large complex problems, and defining new technology-enabled opportunities. This role will work closely with Engineering, Security, and Information Services; a broad understanding of these will be beneficial. Job Description
The Architect serves as a technical leader undertaking complex initiatives requiring specialized technical knowledge. The Architect will make and drive decisions on complex or ambiguous IT architecture issues, coordinating with users to determine requirements, and ensuring improvements are successfully implemented and monitored, finding ways to increase efficiency.

Partner across business and technology disciplines to present and deliver the needed architectures.
Consult on the application of reference architecture, strategic direction of enterprise technology, and serve as subject matter expert with contextual knowledge of the business model.
Develop and utilize reusable patterns, practices, and enterprise reference architectures that fit within the overall Allstate architectural blueprint.
Assist with drafting the business case including identification of potential business/customer benefits, and identify opportunities to enhance existing architecture.
Influence clients and partners to prioritize for enterprise benefit and risk reduction and assist in driving the adoption of technology solutions that leverage existing patterns, practices and reference architectures.
Work with strategic vendors and partners to review and influence product roadmaps, strategies, run proof of concepts, and identify gaps and solutions.
Participate in industry-related conferences and events.
Provide technical and professional leadership and coach more junior level Architects. Qualifications

Required:
10+ years technical experience in IT architecture/design
5+ years of experience in core infrastructure engineering in the enterprise storage domain (Software Defined Storage in the Public and Private Cloud)
4+ years’ experience in SDLC (requirements, design, build, test, deploy) or similar
4+ years’ experience managing Infrastructure components via API’s (Software Defined Infrastructure or Infrastructure as Code)
2+ years road mapping experience
Broad infrastructure knowledge including the design and delivery of IT services to the Infrastructure consumer
Containerization experience - preferably Docker
Orchestration experience - preferably Kubernetes
Deep experience in the following: Hybrid Cloud, platforms, security, networking

Nice To Have:
Microservice development experience
API development experience
Integration experience
Cloud certifications and/or cloud experience with any major Cloud platform (AWS/Azure preferred)
Application development experience Compensation Data
The minimum salary for this position is $96,500. The salary offered will be commensurate with experience.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.

As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

title: Senior Solutions Architect-Remote
description:
Senior Solutions Architect-Remote - (21000850)
Description

Do you want to be part of a collaborative Solution Architecture team?
Are you a solution architect who provides solution design for customers, designs products and services, provides architectural leadership & direction across the organization and looking for a challenging role to innovate, and define Guardian’s next-gen application platforms? Do you enjoy working with your leaders and colleagues in business and security teams to solve complex business challenges? Is a culture where “People Count,” “We Do the Right Thing,” and “We Hold Ourselves to Very High Standards” important to you? If so, Guardian is seeking a Sr. Solution Architect to define and build responsive application design and strategies that provides the agility to adapt to changing business and organization needs.

You will:
Influence – Work closely with Business and Applications architects to ensure documented prescriptive blueprints and security best practices are followed and enforced during app design and implementation.
Communicate – convey complex issues to diverse audiences, orally and in writing, in a manner that is easily understood and actionable. Ability to communicate equally well with technical and non-technical personnel.
Collaborate – Participate in planning and designing of the IT Solutions in alignment to business and organization objectives. Collaboratively work with Subject matter experts from different domains including security, Cloud, network, and other architecture domains to design the final solution.
Adapt – adjust to new, different, or changing circumstances while still ensuring that the overall objective is achieved.
Understand
Business Architecture – application of architecture principles and techniques to the design of business operations, including business capabilities and business processes, people, technology, and information that enable them.
Service Architecture – organization and design of the resources (human, technical and otherwise) that are required for the operation of an IT or business service.
Information Architecture – the definition, design, and delivery of an architecture that improves the attainability and usefulness of information in the enterprise, such that knowledge workers can locate, transform, analyze, and communicate information to support effective decision-making.
Integration Architecture – design methods and protocols for communication and interoperability between disparate information systems.
Application Architecture – Architect and design new cloud and distributed solutions as well refactor existing solutions
Model and Design – demonstrate ability to make choices and tradeoffs that drive optimal decisions through the depiction of concepts, relationships, constraints, rules, and operations in a given architecture or IT system.
Project Governance – ability to review, manage, and ensure the adoption of decisions at the project level that are consistent with enterprise architecture principles, strategies, and standards.
Architecture Documentation – Develops and upkeeps new standards and blueprints working in collaboration with other architecture teams
Qualifications

You are:
A self-starter who can work independently and has the ability to work cross-functionally in a matrixed environment and collaborate closely with business partners, application architects, engineers, & developers across the organization to ensure achievement of Business and IT goals and objectives.

You have:
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Math) discipline preferred; Master’s degree desirable.
Minimum of 7 years’ experience in design, development and implementation software architecture and technology solutions
Strong experience leading projects in Enterprise solutions design and implementation, architectural models and frameworks, utilizing SAFe/Agile methodologies.
Demonstrated experience in AWS, other cloud Platforms, Middleware technologies such as event streaming, event driven architecture, applying security design/principles, Java, J2EE frameworks, Workflow Systems, DevSecOps tools, Tomcat, SpringBoot
Strong knowledge of Enterprise Databases, Middleware, Micro-services, Web services, RESTful API’s, Application development platforms, High Availability designs and technologies
Extensive systems integration experience in a diverse multi-platform environment
Excellent written and verbal communications; effective interpersonal skills; strong formal presentation abilities
Knowledge and Experience in Insurance and Investment Technologies is a plus.
AWS Cloud Certification about be desirable

Location:
New York, New Jersey with work from home flexibility
Up to 20% travel within US
Our promise:
At Guardian, you’ll have the support and flexibility to achieve your professional and personal goals.
Through skill-building, leadership development and philanthropic opportunities, we provide opportunities to build communities and grow your career, surrounded by diverse colleagues with high ethical standards

We offer:
Meaningful and challenging work opportunities to accelerate technology and innovation in a secure and compliant way
Competitive compensation
Excellent medical, dental, supplemental health, life and vision coverage for you and your dependents with no wait period
Life and disability insurance
A great 401(k) with match
Tuition assistance, paid parental leave and backup family care
Dynamic, modern work environments that promote collaboration and creativity
Flexible time off, dress code, and work location policies to balance your work and life in the ways that suit you best
Social responsibility in all aspects of our work. We volunteer within our local communities, create educational alliances with colleges, drive a variety of initiatives in sustainability, and advocate for diversity and inclusion in all that we do.

Guardian has been helping people protect their futures and secure their lives for more than 160 years. Every day, we serve approximately 29 million people through a range of insurance and financial products. As one of the largest mutual insurance companies, we know what matters most: putting the needs of our customers first. Because everyone deserves a Guardian. Learn more about Guardian at guardianlife.com

Guardian is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, creed, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, marital status, disability, military or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.

title: Database Architect
description:
We are looking for the best and brightest to grow with us! As the eCommerce Data Architect, you will be responsible for improving the existing data models and recommending new ways to solve existing inefficiencies. You need to be able to work in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment where the work is meaningful, associates are valued, and you can grow your long-term career. Piping Rock is a data-driven commerce organization that is leveraging any available technologies to drive growth. As a Data Architect, you’ll be involved in the whole lifecycle of Piping Rock's eCommerce product portfolio.
In response to the COVID 19 pandemic, Piping Rock in its ongoing commitment to associates, has added new, comprehensive safety precautions in all of its facilities. Associates who are able to work from home are encouraged to do so. Associate safety is our top priority.
We are growing and in the right way! Piping Rock Health Products has been named as Newsday's Top Workplaces for 2020. Our associates are dedicated and fueled by our passion for health and wellness and shared commitment to our customers. Come be a part of this remarkable team who looks to continue to be a Top Workplace in Long Island. As a Data Architect, you’ll be involved in the whole lifecycle of Piping Rock's eCommerce product portfolio.

Key Position Responsibilities:
Design and Implement data architecture that improves application features and performance
Review and evaluate requirements from leadership and translate to technical design
Communicate the technical design and work closely with development team
Validate proper implementation
Develop and configure the storage and maintenance of the data
Will be focusing on problem solving and improving data consistency and performance
You must be able to create ways to monitor expected vs. actual real-world results of your work
Working in all phases of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) processes
DevOps for databases for example moving from design to end result
Working alongside application developers
Has experience with data modelling, performance, HA/DR, etc.
Requirements

Skills/Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Math, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, other Science fields
At least 8 years’ experience working in a similar role
Experience working in a fast paced, team oriented, collaborative environment
Strategic thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proactive and self-reliant, take ownership of tasks and resolve them on time and with quality
Experience at enterprise-level e-commerce
Demonstrated ability to acquire technical knowledge through research and self-teaching
Understand how message brokers, ETL, Rest Services, etc. fit in to the data landscape
Strong hands-on experience with Amazon AWS data technologies and related services is a big plus
Experience with data archiving and log streaming strategies is highly desired.
Understand database warehouse and decision support design and techniques
Advanced SQL query techniques and designing and developing data solutions for reporting
Experience defining and implementing data policy, procedures, and processes
Design and Implement data architecture that improves application features and performance
Data analysis used to gain insights into what to suggest to a customer
We are drug free workplace, regulated by the FDA, required to follow Federal Guidelines ; therefore in order to start as well as maintain employment, you must be able to successfully clear drug screening processes, which include testing for all illegal substances per Federal Guidelines .
Benefits
Piping Rock Health Products LLC is an equal opportunity employer
Piping Rock proudly offers comprehensive medical, dental, vision plans to all full-time associates. In addition, voluntary life insurance, flexible spending plans, and short-term disability plans may be optionally added. All full-time associates also receive group term life insurance and long-term disability coverage. Associates are eligible to participate in a 401(k) savings plan with a generous company match.
Based in Ronkonkoma, N.Y., Piping Rock Health Products, LLC is a vertically integrated manufacturer, distributor and on-line retailer of high-quality vitamins, nutritional supplements, essential oils and related health care products. Backed by three generations and over 40 years of experience in the natural products industry, Piping Rock is a true industry pioneer.

title: Cloud Application Architect (AWS)
description:
Do you like to work on a wide variety of projects that are game-changing for their users, including some that are at the forefront of cloud application development? If so, we’re looking for an AWS ninja application developer. We have a fun/cohesive/talented team of cloud engineers and developers who need a Lead Architect/Developer to guide our growing cloud-native solutions and SaaS practice areas. If you’re a savvy AWS cloud developer, we should talk.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide hands-on guidance and oversight in architecting, designing, and developing applications for the AWS cloud using cloud-native application architectures (microservices, containerization, serverless, API design patterns, IaC, purpose-specific databases, etc.).
Help us architect scalable, highly-available application solutions that leverage AWS services.
Assist in migration of complex on-premises applications to AWS, ensuring that customer applications are cloud-optimized.
Be a technical leader, providing deep software development knowledge with respect to cloud design patterns, architectures, and programming.
Provide day-to-day direction & guidance to the technical team as required. Advise on and implement AWS best practices.
Monitor and optimize project delivery processes and tools (Agile/Scrum, ticketing, sprint planning, CI/CD, etc.).
Ensure that all project work is reviewed and meets quality & accuracy requirements.
Analyze project successes vs. challenges to improve on processes to make each new project more successful than the last.
Manage and organize project documentation using best-of-breed tools (e.g., infinite-canvas whiteboards, etc.).
Collaborate with the team to develop a process improvement plan and help us continue to refine DevOps best practices.
Think different! Identify new ways to achieve our goals. You will be rewarded!
EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS
5+ years of AWS lead developer/architect experience.
Excellent technical architecture skills, enabling the creation of robust, scalable solutions.
Experience in designing AWS-centric solutions based on industry standards using best-tool-for-the-job cloud services.
Hands-on experience with designing & developing modern web applications.
Strong knowledge of microservices architectures and related design patterns.
Strong experience in analyzing and identifying data schema/structure requirements by evaluating client operations, applications, and programming.
Experience in designing and implementing effective data storage solutions and models to store and retrieve data using both SQL and NoSQL databases, along with other purpose-built data storage solutions.
Proactively provide guidance on engineering methodologies, standards, processes, tooling, and leading practices.
Outstanding interpersonal communication and organizational skills that are required to operate as a leading member of an international team.
Strong experience with Agile methodology and delivery.
Strong experience with serverless design, Docker/containerization, DevOps/orchestration (e.g., Terraform), etc.
Nice to have: AWS Certified Developer - Associate certification (or higher).
Nice to have: AWS Solutions Architect - Associate certification (or higher).
BEHAVIORAL REQUIREMENTS
You view clarity of communication as a competitive advantage.
You view strong software delivery processes as a competitive advantage.
Integrity is fundamentally important to you.
Authentically curious, you love learning and improving yourself.
A desire to do brilliant things!
You are naturally entrepreneurial.
You are streetwise.
Team player with great collaborative skills.
Ability to quickly adapt to change.
Enjoys a fast-paced, dynamic, challenging work environment.
A desire to help build the kind of company/team where developers love to work.

title: REMOTE Cloud Architect
description:
MKS2 Technologies, LLC, an award-winning high growth small business, creates innovative and customer-centric technology solutions in the areas of Cyber Security, Instructional Design, Software Engineering and IT Infrastructure to improve the security and well-being of our clients. Our commitment to excellence and our vision to “Continue to Serve” has resulted in steady growth and an expanding client base across government agencies in the health, defense, security and education sectors. Headquartered in Austin, TX we have employees nationwide and three years consecutively were named one of the fastest growing companies in the nation. Please take a moment to browse through our website and learn more about what it means to serve with MKS2 Technologies. This is a remote role.

MKS2 Technologies has an opening for a Cloud Cyber
Security Architect to join our talented, dynamic team.
The key responsibilities for this position include:
Responsibilities:
Must have experience is MS 365, Azure, and AWS cloud software
Must have excellent configuration experience working in a cloud environment
Must be able to identify and resolve issues within cloud(s)
Must have experience in threat mitigation
Must be well- versed in ATO (Authorization to Operate).
Working knowledge of FEDRAMP
Provide overall direction and guidance for cybersecurity policy, strategy, and compliance for an organization level enterprise cloud platform
Development and delivery of system security and information assurance documentation, consistent with federal standards to support system certification and accreditation
Be an advocate for a modern, DevSecOps-style, approach for conducting testing and conveying control information (consistent with the NIST 800-53 Risk Management Framework)
Devise policy recommendations to streamline and accelerate successful security outcomes
Provide guidance and oversight of subordinate cybersecurity teams at the platform and application levels
Interact with senior policy directors at the Department and Service level as needed
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or other Scientific/Technical discipline and 8 years of related work experience
Expert knowledge in Department of Defense information security policies, practices, and legal requirements including DoDI 8510.01, DISA STIGs, and FedRAMP
Must be knowledgeable in National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) 800-53 Rev4 or higher and capable of reviewing, analyzing, and assessing systems configurations/architectures to identify security, safety, and mission-critical functions/components

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
About the Architecture Organization:
The architecture teams solve sophisticated challenges with our data and technology expertise. We are organized as a collection of Products, Services and Platforms teams that work together to enable our users to accomplish their missions.
Embarked on an exciting dual-cloud journey, and the enablement of technologies to support rapid adoption and improved maturity in the cloud is essential to achieving our digital ambitions.
About the role
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a part of the strategic Compute portfolio within Digital Enterprise & Operations. It operates across four global regions, servicing the digital organizations’ application hosting demands which to date hosts upwards of six-thousand servers.
The AWS platform architect develops and evolves the architecture and solutions over which the cloud offerings are built. As the platform architect you will:
Define and detail the component technical solutions and services used to deliver the services including the development of designs and other technical artefacts.
Continuously assess the health of platform and identify recurring problems/bottlenecks and recommend improvements to eliminate recurrence. Collaborate with the AWS service owner, engineering, and partner teams to modernise the architecture and improve the technical solutions core to the platform offerings.
Act as the main technical point of contact for AWS cloud related engagements by application teams. Enable wider adoption of cloud offerings by advising teams on how best to develop against the platform. Where appropriate, champion their requirements and work on incorporating them into the architecture.
Collaborate with other architects, responsible for adjacent platforms i.e. Azure, Security & networking to rationalise the use of networking and security solutions to achieve operational simplification, and consistency of experience.
About you
Your experience and expertise will include:
Deep knowledge and practitioner experience in AWS solutions and technologies especially Networking, Identity & Security, Management & Governance, Compute, Containers and Serverless product groups.
Strong understanding of cloud-based application architecture using microservices, API's, containerization and serverless technologies using native cloud services.
Certified as a AWS Solution Architect and proven experience architecting scalable services and products on the AWS cloud for large multi-national organizations.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to relate sophisticated topics in simple and accessible language.
A proven grasp of architecture development and design thinking in an agile environment; TOGAF certification a plus.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $700.00 - $800.00 per day
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work Location:
Fully Remote
