title: Sr. Cloud Architect- **Remote**
description:
We invite you to be part of our team of trailblazers dedicated to helping people discover and enjoy the outside. Come join us. Because on the inside we’re all outsiders. And if it’s outside, we’re all in.
L.L.Bean is currently recruiting for a Senior Cloud Architect to join our Platform Services Team. This person will provide technical & strategic leadership as well as “get their hands dirty” building and advancing our Cloud Platform Services. The Platform is the foundation to support the modernization of L.L.Bean's front-end customer technology systems to omni-channel microservices using containers, Kubernetes, and related cloud technologies. This role will have a strong influence on the architectural direction for the cloud platform, CI/CD pipeline, security management, and a goal of “automate everything”. This role will focus on evaluating and integrating cutting edge technologies through partnerships with our vendors and use of relevant open source technologies.
*** Opportunity to work REMOTE***
Senior Cloud Architect
Evangelize microservice based architecture using containerized applications; previous experience strategizing and executing on-prem to cloud transformation for large-scale applications is valuable
Create systems and configurations for GCP/GKE
Mature CI/CD - develop pipelines that build, test, and deploy applications fast, often, & automated
Advance the Site Reliability Engineering practice – monitoring/alerting, auto-scaling, security, & self-healing system stability
Support a “security first” advocacy and encourage platform solutions that enable the microservice product teams to “shift left” with vulnerability identification and resolution
Stay current on industry trends; innovate through research, proof of concepts, and demos
Collaborate and pair with the Platform team to ensure knowledge and expertise is shared & developed
Shared responsibility for 24x7 research and resolution of production system problems through participation in an on-call rotation
Ensure compliance with applicable security and privacy standards and regulations
Participates in the recruitment of team members both employees and contractor
Training and mentoring peers and management

Health and Safety Requirement: Every employee is responsible for contributing to a safe and healthy workplace. Employees are expected to be active participants in health and safety by following all safety policies and procedures, reporting unsafe conditions or at-risk behaviors to leadership, and conducting work in a safe manner. Those in a leadership role are also expected to model safe behaviors, evaluate risk, and ensure that risks are reduced to acceptable levels.

Education Level: 4-Year Bachelors Degree
Years of Industry Experience: 10+ years

Skills and Qualifications:
Technical Skills
Cloud: Google (preferred), AWS, Azure
Orchestration: GKE (preferred), AKS, EKS
CI/CD: Jenkins
Monitoring: Prometheus/Grafana (preferred), Stackdriver
Database: Mongo
API: Cloud Endpoints, Apigee
Language/scripting: Python (preferred), Bash, Node.js
Infrastructure as Code: Terraform
EDW: BigQuery
Data analysis: Splunk
Security: PCI compliance, vulnerability management tools
Testing: Automation, System, Performance
Agile – Scrum, Kanban
Tools – Jira, Confluence
Transferable Skillset
Insatiable intellectual curiosity
Strong comprehension ability to understand vision, strategy, prioritization, requirements, and issues presented by Stakeholders, Product Owner, and Team
Deliver strategic design, articulate to technical and non-technical audiences, achieve buy-in, inspire team, prototype/POC, and execute
Self-directed; works well independently
Collaborative and team oriented
Strong attention to detail in task planning, execution, and documentation
Superior analytical skills, methodical troubleshooting process, and an emphasis on root cause analysis
“Can do” positive attitude and flexibility to be able to jump in and assist on any platform efforts
If you care about the outdoors, joining L.L.Bean is a great way to feel good about what you do. Our benefits package makes a good thing even better, with programs and perks designed to support your health and financial goals. Plus, maintaining a healthy work-life balance and re-charging outside are all part of the plan. Because, when it comes to the outside—we’re all in. Visit llbeancareers.com to learn more.
From coastal marsh to alpine forest, ecosystems depend on diversity to flourish. We believe the same is true in the workplace. That’s why L.L.Bean is an equal opportunity employer, committed to sustaining our strengths by welcoming all kinds of people.

title: Solution Architect (Remote Available)
description:
Solution Architect (Remote Available)
The Solution Architect (SA) is a trusted advisor and subject matter expert (SME) working within the sales organization and with customers throughout the pre-sales process. The SA position supports Avertium sales teams with a problem-solving mindset and deep understanding of the service portfolio, assisting customer’s in applying the products/services to their needs. The Solution Architect is responsible for customer-facing discussion, best practices, and presentation of services, working closely with Account Executives, services and leadership to optimize customer solutions and revenue.
Essential Responsibilities:
The Solution Architect’s essential responsibilities are listed below:
Researches customer needs and consults customers on the services and solutions that best fit their needs.
Aligns customer needs to the appropriate Avertium products and services in a phased approach (road map).
Communicate Avertium’s value to customers as a strategic information security/compliance partner.
Accountable for technical meeting preparation and working closely with internal resources to align the technical strategy for a given customer or prospect.
Performs product pricing configurations to ensure the right set of products/services and features for the customer are priced accurately.
Drives demonstrations of services, and shares success stories, whitepapers and collateral to position Avertium value.
Supports sales representative from identification to closure of the opportunity.
Facilitates post-sale planning and hand-off of the customer to delivery for seamless transition.
Participates in sales forecasting and planning.
Represents customer needs and participates in development of new products, modification of existing products and termination of ineffective products.
Timely manages assigned sales budgets.
Develops and maintains communications in a cooperative and professional manner with all levels of staff and customers using established guidelines.
Lead meetings and present information to C-suite executives and other key personnel.
Participate in contract negotiations with clients, either working independently to represent Avertium or within a team of other Avertium associates.
Participate in onsite sales meetings with clients and prospective clients as necessary.
Maintain technical competency for existing and emerging services and products.
Provide knowledge transfer to the sales staff related to current and future service offerings.
Work with senior management and other key stakeholders on business development activities.
Qualifications and Job Experience Requirements:
Minimum of 5-10 years of experience in IT security field or IT administration
Experience with SIEM technology is required
Knowledge of Unix/Linux server platforms is required
Thorough understanding of enterprise security concepts and technologies, including firewalls, MDR, EDR, AV, etc.
Familiarity with HIPAA, PCI, and privacy compliance standards preferred
Knowledge of MITRE ATT&CK framework or other attack frameworks preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Understanding of how a Security Operations Center functions
Scripting/Programming in Python is preferred. Additional languages are a plus.
Strong knowledge of networking systems and troubleshooting is preferred
Knowledge with NIST, FISMA, DIACAP
Knowledge of Windows 2008-19 server platforms
Knowledge of VMware and VM server platforms
Knowledge of cloud platforms, (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.) preferred
Ability to troubleshoot common network devices, network, vulnerabilities and network attack patterns
Ability to establish and maintain positive and effective work relationships with coworkers, clients, members, and vendors
Travel:
This position requires up to 50% travel. Frequently travel is outside the local area and overnight. Some of the travel may be international.
Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related technical field and at least 3 years of field sales experience or equivalent.
Avertium is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Remote AWS Cloud Infrastructure Architect
description:
Job Description:
Turing.com is looking for an AWS Cloud Infrastructure Architect on behalf of a US-based company handling a unique global technology fund exploring opportunities to invest in startups. The candidate will have the opportunity to rub shoulders with industry veterans and test their skills in a challenging environment. The candidate must be familiar with monitoring, alerting, and observability in the AWS environment. It will be a great opportunity for those looking for growth in their career and climb up the ranks. The candidate must be an excellent communicator and take initiative at the workplace.
Job Responsibilities:
Contribute solid hands-on resources to deliver a cloud adoption and transformation program
Build the architecture to allow for blue/green deployment on EKS
Build “kill switches” to disable specific components within the architecture, due to intermediate latency, failure, manual deployment
Build the multi-region application deployment, including automation to auto fail-over and controlled failover
Help to build the end-to-end monitoring and integrate it to their existing ecosystem
Influence the Internet Ingress Edge solution being built by CTC to meet customer needs
Determine needs around using Secure protocols and creating/maintaining/ updating certificates in either the AWS native tools, or integrating with on-prem certificate stores
Help with optimizing the architecture to reduce the end-to-end latency, by using the Global Accelerator, latency/proximity Route 53 based policies etc
Help with design to keep multi-region system of engagement data in sync between regions and on-prem, Kinesis/Kafka replication, GoldenGate Oracle replication etc
Build and integrate Chaos Testing into the SDLC to increase resiliency
Help with designing and running scalability and performance testing
Help with preparing the environment for external penetration testing (experience with GuardDuty a plus)
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
Hands-on with AWS Core Services (Network, Security, IaC)
Hands-on Cloud Migration Experience
Must be familiar with monitoring, alerting, observability in the AWS Environment
Must have prior experience with Cloud Infrastructure Architect, CloudTrail, CloudWatch and additional observability tools and monitoring skills
Must be AWS Associate SA Cert or higher (preferred, not required)
Must have an understanding of Large-Scale Enterprise AWS Deployments (250+ AWS Accounts)
Strong preference for past experience working with regulated industries (FSI’s, Healthcare, Government)
Global Financial Services experience a plus
Must be skilled at Networking, Data Storage Fundamentals, Security Foundations, AWS Service Selection and Cloud-specific patterns and technologies
Must have prior exposure to Front-end libraries/framework (React, Angular)
Must have experience with Agile engineering practices (continuous integration, TDD etc.)
Experience focused on site reliability for high-traffic applications
This job will be open for applications until 30-04-21. If you’ve missed this opportunity, check out more Turing jobs here: https://turing.com/MVWl3E
Here’s everything you need to know to become a Remote AWS Cloud Infrastructure Architect at Turing: https://turing.com/D7BkYV
All geared up to become a Turing remote developer? Take our exciting coding challenge now: https://turing.com/8rjL9V

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Position Summary: PRIMARY FUNCTION(S)
Our client has a rich history of working closely with stakeholders and crisis management professionals to identify capability gaps, research relevant solutions, iteratively implement and deploy products that make a positive impact to the international disaster response community. The group relies on capabilities that are modern, extensible, and ready to use. The success of the decision support and software products developed over the past 10 years have led to a growing need to maintain a strong understanding of system, architecture, and security solutions, as well as relevant governance processes.As the development team grows to support software efforts, there is also a need to standardize the Dev Ops of the group and provide a standard development environment. This will enable the group to be flexible and agile when responding to stakeholders with the resources available. A solutions architect can provide the correct technology stack and support needed to ensure seamless and efficient implementation of software across the group.
Responsibilities: Duties include, but not limited to:
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
Designs and defines system architecture and solutions for integrating multiple platforms, operating systems, cloud and applications. Determines systems specifications, input/output processes, and working parameters for hardware/software/cloud compatibility and maintenance of system security. Coordinate’s design of subsystems and integration of total system. Identifies, analyzes, and resolves program support deficiencies. Develops and documents the framework for integration and implementation for changes to technical standards and overall enterprise architecture. Assists in the development and management of an architecture governance process. Develops and recommends corrective actions and system solutions. Provides technical guidance for database administrators, software developers, and other stakeholders. Understands and determines requirements of infrastructure, network, and security in third party cloud offerings. Translates business requirements into functional and technical architecture. May guide decisions on which technologies to implement, operational planning and useful life of products.
LI-IM-1
Qualifications: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Must be a U.S. citizen with eligibility to obtain and maintain a secret clearance.
Bachelor's Degree with 5 years of relevant experience
5 years of experience with Network and Cloud Computing Security
5 years of experience with Cloud-based Solutions (e.g., AWS, AZURE, Google)
5 years with determining Systems Specifications.
5 years with Systems Architecture
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
5 years with Architecture Governance
5 years with translating Business Requirements into Technical Specifications
5 years of Hardware and Software Integration
5 years with Netcentric Software and Systems Architecture
5 years of Systems Analysis
WORKING LOCATIONS & ADDITIONAL INFO
Location: Lexington, MA
Travel: Not anticipated
Virtual/Work from Home: Full
Employment Status: Full-Time Employee with full benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, PTO, Retirement)
Other: All candidates must also successfully pass a Commercial Background Investigation (CBI). Investigation (CBI).
This job posting sets forth the authorities and responsibilities of this position, which may be changed from time to time as shall be determined.
Company Overview: Odyssey Systems Consulting Group, is an innovative small business committed to providing world-class technical, management, and training support services to government and public sector clients. We focus on people, processes, and performance to deliver superior results. Since our inception in 1997, our commitment to mission success and customer satisfaction has been recognized with exponential growth and exceptional past performance ratings. We accept challenging assignments and drive projects from the planning stages, through implementation, and into operations and support.
_
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities_
Job Type: Full-time

title: Solutions Architect (remote) Job
description:
Additional Locations:
Diversity - Innovation - Caring - Global Collaboration - Winning Spirit - Caring - High Performance
At Boston Scientific, we’ll give you the opportunity to harness all that’s within you by working in teams of diverse and high-performing employees, tackling some of the most important health industry challenges. With access to the latest tools, information and training, we’ll help you in advancing your skills and career. Here, you’ll be supported in progressing – whatever your ambitions.

About the role:
The WATCHMAN Device is a minimally invasive, one-time procedure designed to reduce the risk of strokes that originate in the Left Atrial Appendage. As a core member of the WATCHMAN digital solutions team, the Solutions Architect is responsible for the implementation and oversight of the technical architecture for all digital properties for WATCHMAN. Our digital tools serve multiple external user personas such as patients, referring physicians, administrators, implanters, and nurse coordinators. We also serve internal user personas such as sales associates, customer support representatives, marketing staff, and more. These personas and the digital tools they touch make up a complex ecosystem of data and technology. This role will be critical in defining and building the technical architecture to meet our business needs, while staying aligned with corporate-IT enterprise architecture vision and strategy.
In addition to the foundation architecture work, the Solutions Architect will work with other members of the digital solutions team in partnering with our business stakeholders to solve problems via prototyping and collaboration.
The Solutions Architect must bring the right mix of technical expertise, experience with agile development methodologies, and soft skills anchored in impeccable collaboration, clear communication, and positive culture. This individual should be highly motivated with excellent strategic thinking, analysis, and communication skills. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical and functional profile, someone who has experience across a large portfolio of applications assessing and recommending solutions based on business need.

Your responsibilities:
Work with multiple business stakeholders across the WATCHMAN franchise to understand their goals, visions, and strategies for their domains.
Partner with the WATCHMAN Business Data Architect to understand the flow of data and data access requirements for the organization.
Lead the solution analysis process, conduct research, and work with our stakeholders to architect an optimal solution by balancing business needs and user needs.
Partner and collaborate with our stakeholders, designers, and product owners through discovery and workshops to gain an understanding of the business area, current business workflows, and operational pain points to identify opportunities for improvement.
Produce solutions proposals including solution artifacts such as architecture diagrams, workflows, feature breakdown, technology analysis, and cost / timeline implications of our recommended solution.
Participate in the development of cost/benefit analyses; drives buy/rent/build analyses.
Present proposal to stakeholders and governance entities to gain alignment, feedback, and ultimately approval to move ahead with execution.
Responsible for implementing and maintaining enterprise architecture for WATCHMAN.
Manage development vendor partners and ensure the vendor understands the solution to be built from a technical point of view. Ensure vendor partner is building the product according to technical specifications outlined in the solution design.
Develops solutions to complex technical problems by challenging traditional technical assumptions.
Develop a point of view of our current technology stack, work with BSC corporate enterprise architects and align our divisional architecture to relevant reference architectures.
Define cloud strategy for WATCHMAN and responsible for the implementation roadmap.
Identifies innovative uses of Information Technology to provide a competitive advantage for BSC.
Drives strategic architecture changes throughout the organization.
Defines, promotes, and supports the principles and standards of the enterprise architecture.
Develop proof of concepts to demonstrate proposed technical solutions.
Demonstrate excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex solutions and value to all key stakeholders.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.
7+ years of experience in a Solution Architect / Enterprise Architect role.
Demonstrated experience with AWS cloud services and tools.
Demonstrated experience with software development and devops.
Excellent interpersonal communication skills including oral, written, and listening skills.
Self-motivated in learning new concepts and willing to share knowledge and skills with other team members.
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, self-directed, action-oriented environment.
Experience with Agile methodologies and rapid prototyping.

Preferred Qualifications
Proven leadership in partnering with external vendors and business partners on projects.
Strong team building skills, with ability to build quick and effective work rapport with distributed team members.
Ability to influence a diverse group of stakeholders.
Outspoken and passionate about delivering well designed solutions that exceed business objectives and drive business success.
Well organized and capable of managing multiple priorities.
Highly advanced analytical and reasoning skills.
Experience in regulated environment
Medical device, life sciences industry background preferred

Requisition ID: 483675
As a leader in medical science for more than 40 years, we are committed to solving the challenges that matter most – united by a deep caring for human life. Our mission to advance science for life is about transforming lives through innovative medical solutions that improve patient lives, create value for our customers, and support our employees and the communities in which we operate. Now more than ever, we have a responsibility to apply those values to everything we do – as a global business and as a global corporate citizen.
So, choosing a career with Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) isn’t just business, it’s personal. And if you’re a natural problem-solver with the imagination, determination, and spirit to make a meaningful difference to people worldwide, we encourage you to apply and look forward to connecting with you!
At Boston Scientific, we recognize that nurturing a diverse and inclusive workplace helps us be more innovative and it is important in our work of advancing science for life and improving patient health. That is why we stand for inclusion, equality, and opportunity for all. By embracing the richness of our unique backgrounds and perspectives, we create a better, more rewarding place for our employees to work and reflect the patients, customers, and communities we serve. Boston Scientific is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
Boston Scientific maintains a drug-free workplace. Pursuant to Va. Code § 2.2-4312 (2000), Boston Scientific is providing notification that the unlawful manufacture, sale, distribution, dispensation, possession, or use of a controlled substance or marijuana is prohibited in the workplace and that violations will result in disciplinary action up to and including termination.


Nearest Major Market: Minneapolis
Job Segment: Solution Architect, Architecture, Medical, Information Systems, Computer Science, Technology, Engineering, Healthcare

title: AWS Cloud Engineer (Rackspace Government Services) - US
description:
Job Family Summary
The Cloud Engineer II is a key element within the Rackspace support infrastructure and is expected to provide a high level of technical support to our customers via the phone, ticketing system, and automation. This role owns complex customer issues which may take several days or weeks to resolve and keeps our customers updated through every step of the process. Responsible for the support of internal and external customers on multiple platforms. Work with customers and other teams to troubleshoot customer environments to increase user satisfaction. Resolves customer issues, providing guidance and recommendations to increase efficiency and reduce customer incidents. Develops tooling and processes to drive and improve customer experience, creates playbooks, and providing mentoring on customer related issues to support teams. The Support Engineer is expected to take initiative and advise on potential pitfalls that a customer may encounter and suggest alternatives which may better serve the stability and security of the customer's solution. Keeps informed of emerging technologies. Responsible for adhering to company security policies and procedures and any other relevant policies and standards as directed.
Support internal and external customers on multiple platforms. Work with customers and other teams to troubleshoot customer environments to increase user satisfaction. First point of contact for handling customer issues, providing guidance and recommendations to increase efficiency and reduce customer incidents. Develop tooling and processes to drive and improve customer experience, create playbooks, and provide mentoring on customer related issues to front line Cloud Engineers.Responsible for adhering to company security policies and procedures and any other relevant policies and standards as directed.
Career Level Summary
Requires working knowledge and experience in own job discipline and broadens capabilities
Continues to build knowledge of the company, processes and customers
Performs a range of assignments related to job discipline
Uses learned and prescribed guidelines or processes in analyzing situations
Receives a moderate level of guidance and direction
Critical Competencies
Systems Thinking: Assists with a whole systems approach to analyzing issues by ensuring all components (structure, people, process and technology) are identified and accounted for
Idea Creation: Provides ideas and designs new solutions, methods and products to update what existed prior
Key Responsibilities
Technical point of escalation to the Cloud Support and Engineering teams; resolving customer issues, working in collaboration with partners across the business, as required
Lead functional business continuity/transformational projects and customer engagements (both technical and non-technical), delivering key objectives for the Cloud Function
Monitor and provide maintenance for all related infrastructure
Ensure the control, integrity, and accessibility of the cloud environment for the enterprise
Lead tasks relating to system architecture enhancements, problem management, process improvement, reporting, and customer infrastructure
Lead Workload/Workforce Management and Optimization related tasks
Mentor and assist Rackers across the Cloud Function
Quality check development of technical training for all Rackers supporting Rackspace Supported CLOUD Products
Provide technical expertise underpinning communications targeting a range of stakeholders - from individual contributors to leaders across the business
Collaborate with Account Managers and Business Development Consultants to build strong customer relationships
Collaborate and share knowledge with other Engineers and Administrators on the support floor
Person Specification Knowledge
Proficient knowledge of Cloud Platform Products such as AWS, Azure, GCP, or Openstack
Proficient skills in at least one of the following languages: Node.js, Python, PHP, Ruby, and Java
Proficient skills with git and git workflows
Proficient skills in leveraging CI and CD tools to automate testing and deployment
Proficient knowledge of Linux or Windows OS, including but not limited to: Server Failover Clustering, Active Directory, IIS
Intermediate knowledge of designing, building, implementing, analyzing, and troubleshooting distributed, highly available systems
Intermediate knowledge of at least one configuration management system such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt, or other such tools
Intermediate knowledge of Project Management methodologies
Intermediate understanding of services and protocols, configuration, management, and troubleshooting of hosting environments, including web servers, databases, caching, and database services
Intermediate knowledge in the application of current and emerging network software and hardware technology and protocols
VMWare Platform
Intermediate knowledge of the vSphere platform
Basic networking skills
Basic working knowledge of fibre channel SANS, NFS and vSAN
Basic knowledge of vROPS
Basic working knowledge of HP/DELL Server hardware platforms
Hyper-V Platform
Intermediate knowledge of the Hyper-V platform
Basic networking skills
Basic working knowledge of fibre channel SANS, NFS and vSAN
Basic knowledge of vROPS
Basic working knowledge of HP/DELL Server hardware platforms
Requires expanded conceptual knowledge in own job discipline and broadens capabilities
Understands key business drivers; uses this understanding to accomplish own work

Skills
Passionate about technology and has a desire to constantly expand technical knowledge
Detail-oriented in documenting information and able to own customer issues through resolution
Able to handle multiple tasks and prioritize work under pressure
Demonstrate sound problem-solving skills coupled with a desire to take on responsibility
Strong written and verbal communication skills, both highly technical and non-technical
Ability to communicate technical issues to nontechnical and technical audiences
Fluency in multiple languages is a plus

Education Required
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or a related technical field
At the Manager's discretion, 4 years of additional related experience may substitute for the degree requirement; if substitution allowed, regional equivalent to High School Diploma is required.

Certifications
Requires Cloud Professional Exam Certificates: 2 Azure Certifications, AWS Certified Solutions Architect, Relevant technical certifications around Red Hat, MySQL, VCP-DCV, vRealize Operations, vSAN badge
Requires 1 Microsoft Certification for Hyper-V Specialization
Prefer CCIA, CCEE, CCEA, CCA, MCSE/MCITP, MCSA, VCP-DCV, vRealize Operations, and/or vSAN badge certifications

Experience Required
2-4 years of technical engineering and administration experience with a minimum of 1 - 2 years commercial experience as either a LAMP stack software developer and/or systems administrator
Experience with high-availability, high-performance, open source web technologies
Experience with cloud platforms, open source databases and caching layers
Experience working in a containerized environment (Docker/LXC)

Preferred
Technical customer support experience in a cloud hosting/technology environment
Intermediate experience in VMware virtual systems preferred

Physical Demands
General office environment: no special physical demands required
May require long periods sitting and viewing a computer monitor
May require work on non-traditional shifts
Schedule flexibility to include working weekends and/or evenings and holidays as required by the business for 24/7 operations
A willingness to work weekends and/or holidays when required as the business dictates

Travel
Occasional domestic travel, less than 10%
About Rackspace Technology
We are the multicloud solutions experts. We combine our expertise with the world’s leading technologies — across applications, data and security — to deliver end-to-end solutions. We have a proven record of advising customers based on their business challenges, designing solutions that scale, building and managing those solutions, and optimizing returns into the future. Named a best place to work, year after year according to Fortune, Forbes and Glassdoor, we attract and develop world-class talent. Join us on our mission to embrace technology, empower customers and deliver the future.
More on Rackspace Technology
Though we’re all different, Rackers thrive through our connection to a central goal: to be a valued member of a winning team on an inspiring mission. We bring our whole selves to work every day. And we embrace the notion that unique perspectives fuel innovation and enable us to best serve our customers and communities around the globe. We welcome you to apply today and want you to know that we are committed to offering equal employment opportunity without regard to age, color, disability, gender reassignment or identity or expression, genetic information, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity status, military or veteran status, nationality, ethnic or national origin, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, or any legally protected characteristic. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
Position is available for remote work in the following states unless otherwise specified. Alabama, Arizona, Arkansas, California, Connecticut, Delaware, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Kentucky, Louisiana, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, Nevada, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New Mexico, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, South Carolina, South Dakota, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Vermont, Virginia, Washington, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming.

title: Part-time DevOps Instructor
description:
Our client is a top-ranked immersive school for system engineering, devops and cloud training based in Virginia. School offers comprehensive in-person and remote training opportunities across the U.S. and prepares students with the in-demand skills they need to launch fulfilling tech careers.
*
To help them share School’s success with the world and find the best bootcamp students, we’re looking for a Part-Time DevOps Instructor to help transform the lives of its students, and through them, their communities and economies.
*
*
ABOUT THE ROLE
As a DevOps Instructor, you'll lead instruction (delivered remotely) in our DevOps Engineer Program. You will scale your impact as a devops professional by training the next generation of DevOps engineers. You’ll lead lectures and support students through exercises designed to embed key devops concepts. You’ll facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community, guiding students through challenging labs and the development of stellar projects, getting them ready to step immediately into DevOps jobs after graduating. You’ll collaborate with our dedicated support and administrative staff to ensure an exceptional experience for each student in our program.
*
*
This is a part-time role that will report to our Academics Team. Classes will be delivered 100% online. The part-time hours are as follows:
A cohort runs for 28 weeks of instruction, with an average of 12-13 hours per week
3 weeknight sessions per week, from 6:30pm to 9:30pm (EST Mon/Wed/Fri)
1 weekend sessions per week, from 2:00 pm to 5:00pm (EST Saturday)
*
*
RESPONSIBILITIES
In this role, you will
Develop, maintain, and improve course curriculum
Teach and instruct classes.
Review course materials, evaluate content and documentation
Mentor, coach, support trainees
*
*
As a DevOps instructor, you will:
Lead instruction on devops topics, activity-based learning workshops, labs and large team competition activities
Work with students 1-on-1, in pairs and in groups to support their learning and growth in the program
Create a positive, professional and inclusive learning environment and culture for our students
Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community, guiding students through challenging labs and the development of stellar projects
*
*
QUALIFICATIONS
*
*
You are a great candidate if you have:
2+ years of DevOps work experience
2+ years of experience working on AWS
Experience teaching or mentoring: Working at a bootcamp, TA’ing in college, creating educational content via YouTube, mentoring junior developers, volunteering to teach, or prior experience as a teacher are all great experience
A passion for devops and for helping others
Exceptional and engaging presentation skills - particularly when it comes to complex technical information
A desire to work in a fast-moving, high-profile startup environment with a high degree of ownership and independence
A desire to help grow the careers of a diverse new generation of devops engineers
The ability and stability to consistently meet a 26-week commitment to our students
*
*
Have 1 or more Devops certifications, especially:
CKA
CKAD
Terraform
Docker
Ansible
*
*
Have 1 or more AWS certifications, especially:
AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate
AWS Certified Developer - Associate
AWS Certified SysOps Administrator - Associate
Have experience teaching in an immersive "bootcamp" type of environment or continuing education style classes
*
Job Types: Part-time, Contract
Pay: $70.00 - $100.00 per hour
Experience:
Python: 2 years (Preferred)
DevOps: 2 years (Preferred)
Kubernetes: 2 years (Preferred)
Jenkins: 2 years (Preferred)
Version Control: 2 years (Preferred)
Ansible: 2 years (Preferred)
Docker: 2 years (Preferred)
AWS: 2 years (Preferred)
Terraform: 2 years (Preferred)
Linux: 2 years (Preferred)
CICD: 2 years (Preferred)
Work Location:
Fully Remote

title: Splunk Architect (Remote-Home Based Worker)
description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.

You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.

Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them. Job Summary
**We are open to applicants in the following markets to work from our Allstate strategic local offices: Charlotte, NC; Dallas / Fort Worth, TX; & Phoenix, AZ. Strong qualified candidates will be given consideration as remote / home-based professionals.**

The Splunk Architect serves as the expert in Splunk systems architecture, undertaking complex projects requiring additional specialized technical knowledge. The Splunk Architect makes decisions on complex or ambiguous architecture issues, coordinating with users to determine requirements, and ensuring system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored, finding ways to increase efficiency. Key Responsibilities
Apply reference architectures and positions toward the design, deployment and support of highly complex systems that deliver business functionality
Consult on the application of reference architecture, strategic direction of enterprise technology, and serve as subject matter expert with contextual knowledge of the business model
Utilize or develop reusable patterns, practices, and enterprise reference architectures that fit within the overall Allstate architectural blueprint
Drive requirements analysis activities and develop the design of highly complex architectural solutions involving multiple logical and/or physical dimensions
Maintain awareness of current complex architectures and business drivers and guide their application to initiatives as appropriate
Identify opportunities to enhance existing architecture
Assist with drafting the business case including identification of potential business/customer benefits
Advocate effective architectural designs and optimize current architecture and processes
Influence clients and partners to prioritize for enterprise benefit and risk reduction and assist in driving the adoption of technology solutions that leverage existing patterns, practices and reference architectures
Recommend when tactical solutions should be replaced or incorporated into sunset and refresh strategies for assigned application(s), project(s) or discipline
Ensure that application sunset and refresh strategies are created and maintained
Lead the assessments and inspections of high complexity physical and/or logical architectural components
Verify conformance to architectural patterns, practices and enterprise/departmental reference architecture
Lead analysis of complex system issues
Make recommendations for major/significant changes to the architecture
Develop high complexity architectural solution concepts and support Pursuit team with feasibility and high-level project estimation Job Qualifications
Education and Experience
3+ Years of Splunk architecture experience in a multi-terabyte/day environment
Architecting Splunk in AWS
Upgrading Splunk in a multi-terabyte/day environment with Search Head Clusters, ITSI and ES
10+ years of platform engineering experience
2+ Years of AWS experience

Functional Skills
Splunk Enterprise Security
Splunk IT Service Intelligence
Splunk Core
AWS
Automated deployment of Splunk using software such as Terraform/Ansible/Puppet/Chef/etc..
Python/Bash or other scripting language a plus
Azure Experience a plus

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.

As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter , Facebook , Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video .

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

title: AWS Engineer (Remote)
description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. As a leader in a corporation with 83,000 employees and agency force members, you’ll have a hand in transforming not only Allstate but a dynamic industry. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.
You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.

We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection. We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them.
Where good people build rewarding careers
Think that working in the insurance field can’t be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You’ll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers’ lives. We’ll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you’ll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.

Job Description
Allstate is looking for Big Data & Analytics Cloud Platform Engineers within the ATSV Data & Intelligent Systems Group; at D&IS we are responsible and accountable for the engineering and operation of the Allstate big data and real time analytics platforms. In this role you will work with AWS using Agile/Infrastructure as Code (IaC) methodologies to plan, test, and deploy cloud infrastructure using a variety of tools to support the enterprise analytics environment.

Responsibilities
Work with Big Data and Analytical teams to engineer and develop capabilities in the cloud that align with transformative growth business strategies and requirements.
Develop scalable, resilient and pragmatic solutions which meet technical, security, and business needs for applications and workloads.
Assist other teams across Allstate’s Data Management (D&IS) and Data Science (D3) with cloud’s fit for purpose analysis and migration of their on-premise workloads from a conceptual and technology standpoint.
Test and deploy cloud-based services to support real-time analytics workloads.
Develop and support multi-step CI/CD Infrastructure as Code pipelines for cloud environment.
Automate repeatable tasks to create efficiencies in our workflows and enable freedom for innovation.
Champion good engineering practices and help teams to define and set up frameworks for cloud adoption and consumption.
Contribute to technology strategy, engineering roadmaps, and proof of concept use cases.
Job Qualifications

Essential Experience

Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related area, or equivalent work experience.
3+ years of relevant level experience in infrastructure, analytics or solution design / architecture.
Demonstrated experience with Amazon Web Services.
Experience in automating and creating automations in a cloud environment.
Hands-on style - willingness and competence in producing necessary changes in our infrastructure and processes Technical leadership and solution design.
Collaborative and customer-oriented track record, able to work effectively across organizational and geographical boundaries.
Ability to clearly communicate ideas and solutions.
Demonstrable ability to learn new technologies quickly.

Desired Certifications
AWS or Azure Certified Solutions Architect
AWS or Azure Certified SysOps Administrator

Desired Experience

Experienced in utilizing “infrastructure as code” approach to provisioning highly desirable.
Automation, Configuration Management (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, Puppet), Dev-ops practices, CI/CD pipelines (e.g Jenkins).
Elementary networking skills, switching, routing, firewalls, load balancing.
Storage – NAS, SAN, JBOD, Object Storage.
Good understanding of Linux, preferably RHEL.
Development skills – Java, Scala, Python, PERL, Shell Script.
Big Data Technologies such as Hadoop, EMR, Spark, Impala, Kafka, etc.
Integration, Dataflow management, ETL.
Data Warehousing, SQL, Relational Databases.
NoSQL Databases.
Linux Containers / Docker.
Workflow scheduling and management.
DR and business continuity planning.

Compensation Data
Salary $95K-$150K. Target bonus eligible. Offer will be commensurate with experience.
The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.
As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life - including a generous paid time off policy.

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.

title: Cloud Solution Architect
description:
About the Architecture Organization:
The architecture teams solve sophisticated challenges with our data and technology expertise. We are organized as a collection of Products, Services and Platforms teams that work together to enable our users to accomplish their missions.
Embarked on an exciting dual-cloud journey, and the enablement of technologies to support rapid adoption and improved maturity in the cloud is essential to achieving our digital ambitions.
About the role
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a part of the strategic Compute portfolio within Digital Enterprise & Operations. It operates across four global regions, servicing the digital organizations’ application hosting demands which to date hosts upwards of six-thousand servers.
The AWS platform architect develops and evolves the architecture and solutions over which the cloud offerings are built. As the platform architect you will:
Define and detail the component technical solutions and services used to deliver the services including the development of designs and other technical artefacts.
Continuously assess the health of platform and identify recurring problems/bottlenecks and recommend improvements to eliminate recurrence. Collaborate with the AWS service owner, engineering, and partner teams to modernise the architecture and improve the technical solutions core to the platform offerings.
Act as the main technical point of contact for AWS cloud related engagements by application teams. Enable wider adoption of cloud offerings by advising teams on how best to develop against the platform. Where appropriate, champion their requirements and work on incorporating them into the architecture.
Collaborate with other architects, responsible for adjacent platforms i.e. Azure, Security & networking to rationalise the use of networking and security solutions to achieve operational simplification, and consistency of experience.
About you
Your experience and expertise will include:
Deep knowledge and practitioner experience in AWS solutions and technologies especially Networking, Identity & Security, Management & Governance, Compute, Containers and Serverless product groups.
Strong understanding of cloud-based application architecture using microservices, API's, containerization and serverless technologies using native cloud services.
Certified as a AWS Solution Architect and proven experience architecting scalable services and products on the AWS cloud for large multi-national organizations.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to relate sophisticated topics in simple and accessible language.
A proven grasp of architecture development and design thinking in an agile environment; TOGAF certification a plus.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $700.00 - $800.00 per day
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work Location:
Fully Remote

title: Solutions Architect
description:
BE A NAME BEHIND THE FLAME
Ferrellgas is looking for a Solution Architect to join the team! The Solution Architect is part of high-performance cross-culture architect team this is focused on driving innovation and improving delivery effectiveness. You will strategically design, configure, implement, and maintain third-party software and enterprise systems integration across a hybrid environment. The Solution Architect works closely with the data, infrastructure, and development architects to deliver recommendations on behalf of this team, that are aligned with strategic business goals and the company’s overall strategic vision.
Benefits:
Medical, dental, and vision plans
401(k) retirement plan with company match
Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP)
Paid holidays, sick leave and vacation
Wellness program
Tuition reimbursement program
Essential Functions:
Strategy & Planning
Orchestrates integration projects and corresponding strategies between business units and development teams.
Plans, executes, and manages the integration of new and existing application solutions into the existing systems by applying proven delivery methodologies including Agile and Model-Driven techniques.
Assists IT management team in short- and long-term planning for technology purchases in the areas of: infrastructure, data, development, and integration.
Develops standards and processes to support and facilitate integration projects and initiatives, and to drive automation.
Manages appropriate vendors relationships.
Implementation
Ensures appropriate translation of methodology to implementation.
Builds integration-centric offerings and helps overcome technical challenges as we transition from traditional integration platforms to service oriented architectures.
Builds process-centric offerings and help overcome technical challenges by introducing a business process and value-based approach to solutioning. A process centric architect defines business processes and applies those to the development of custom integration technology solutions.
Designs message and event-driven architectures.
Builds relationships with software development and engineering teams to gain an understanding of application architectures and required functionality.
Defines solutions using Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) patterns, automating business process models and cloud-based services.
Develops, deploys and maintains efficient methodology for integration and build configurations.
Leads teams of cross-functional developers to implement multi-platform solutions.
Operational Management
Defines the SOA Governance processes.
Accountable to Internal Audit for all Sox Compliance items within the Integration Platforms.
Accountable to the Security Council for security compliance items within the Integration Platforms.
Ensures the collection and coherent interpretation of the various business processes affected by integration efforts.
Benchmarks our methodology and tools with industry standards and suggest efficiency, productivity, value creation, or cost efficiency improvements.
Measures department goals against adoption of standards.
Ensures buy in for new/changed processes with multiple stakeholders
Acts as a process consultancy expert in the above methodology areas of expertise
Represents the business organization in forums on process and methodology topics
Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, business administration, other related field, or equivalent work experience.
Experience with teams and projects in multiple technological and business environments required.
IPaaS (Dell Boomi)
Database (SQL Server/Oracle/Cloud)
API (SOAP, REST)
Salesforce
Message Queueing (IBM MQ, AWS SQS/SNS)
Microservice design patterns
CI/CD (Team City, Octopus Deploy, Azure DevOps)
DevSecOps
Telemetry / Observability
.NET (C#)
ETL (SSIS)
Containerization (Docker / Kubernetes)
Proven ability to drive improvements as required.
Candidates must have the ability to interact successfully with all levels of the IT organization and drive cross-functional issues to a successful resolution.
Typically, 12+ years overall experience in information systems development
10+ years’ programming.
7+ years’ designing new systems or enhancements.
Must be analytical problem-solver.
Good interpersonal skills and ability to manage conflicting demands and problems.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills required as presentation, negotiation, and facility skills.
Ability to play leading role in relationships with management level users/clients.
Project management skills; experience managing projects covering all the stages of system development.
Why work for Ferrellgas? We’re so much more than a company that consistently ranks among the nation’s largest propane retailers. We’re also a company that strives to provide the very best propane service in each of the hundreds of communities we serve across the United States.
Ferrellgas has been recognized by Forbes as one of the Best Employers in America. For more information about the company culture, visit our Life at Ferrellgas page. And, if you’re interested in being a part of a winning company, join the Ferrellgas team today!
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Education:
Bachelor's (Preferred)
Experience:
Software Development: 5 years (Preferred)
.NET: 3 years (Preferred)
Content development: 6 years (Preferred)
Work Location:
Fully Remote
Work Remotely:
Yes

title: Cloud Solutions Architect
description:
Primary City/State:
Phoenix, Arizona
Department Name:
IT Digital Bus Tech-Corp
Work Shift:
Day
Job Category:
Information Technology
Primary Location Starting Range:
$42.91/hr - $57.22/hr
In accordance with Colorado’s EPEWA Equal Pay Transparency Rules.
Health care is constantly changing, and at Banner Health, we are at the front of that change. We are leading health care to make the experience the best it can be. We want to change the lives of those in our care – and the people who choose to take on this challenge. If changing health care for the better sounds like something you want to be part of, we want to hear from you.
The IT Solution Architecture team is responsible for being a trusted partner with the business and IT in order to design solutions that fulfill business requirements across the enterprise. Our goal is not only to solve a problem, but determine the best way to solve that problem for Banner Health and for our patients. In addition to evaluating the technology and integration options, we also challenge the business processes that result in the utilization of that technology. Our goals are to improve automation, standardization, reliability, flexibility, security, and trust.
As an IT Solutions Architect focusing on Cloud Solutions , you will be accountable for shaping and delivering on the overall cloud strategy. You will take the business and IT requirements and translate those to a solution design. You will help build trusted solutions that can provide a great user experience that keeps Banner Health and our patients safe. Your experience with cloud providers, such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Amazon AWS, will help you quickly interpret requirements and determine cloud services that should be utilized to meet those needs. You will design the integrations between the on-prem systems and cloud services to provide a seamless user experience with consideration for the security and privacy of health care information. The typical schedule for this role is Monday-Friday 8AM-5PM (Arizona) with some flexibility. This position may be remote from Arizona or Colorado. An ideal candidate will have three or more years of experience creating cloud solution designs in AWS, GCP, or Azure, 3+ years of experience designing hybrid solutions that integrate cloud services with on-prem systems of record, and be a Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert. The typical schedule for this role is Monday-Friday 8AM-5PM (Arizona) with some flexibility. This position may be remote from Arizona or Colorado. An ideal candidate will have three or more years of experience creating cloud solution designs in AWS, GCP, or Azure, 3+ years of experience designing hybrid solutions that integrate cloud services with on-prem systems of record, and be a Microsoft Certified Azure Solutions Architect Expert.
Your pay and benefits (Total Rewards) are important components of your Journey at Banner Health. Banner Health offers a variety of benefit plans to help you and your family. We provide health and financial security options, so you can focus on being the best at what you do and enjoying your life.
Within Banner Health Corporate, you will have the opportunity to apply your unique experience and expertise in support of a nationally-recognized healthcare leader. We offer stimulating and rewarding careers in a wide array of disciplines. Whether your background is in Human Resources, Finance, Information Technology, Legal, Managed Care Programs or Public Relations, you'll find many options for contributing to our award-winning patient care.
POSITION SUMMARY
This position is responsible for developing the architectural artifacts, models, patterns, and transition activities ensuring strategic initiatives and goals are achievable, operationally efficient, technically sound, and accounted for.

CORE FUNCTIONS
1. Relentless focus on delivering outcomes and value to our business. In collaboration with a team of architects, partners with IT and our Business to develop architectures in support of strategic initiatives, goals, and industry trends.

2. Analyzes Business and IT environment to detect critical deficiencies and\or redundancies and recommend solutions for improvement. Architects must document current state architecture, integrate new solutions into existing systems and deploy experimental solutions that meet emerging business needs.

3. Recommends, reviews, documents, maintains and publishes functional technology standards for enterprise consumption. Creates solution patterns in focused technology domains. Ensures consistent adherence to standards for architectural artifact documentation and implementation. Develops and maintains domain specific capability documentation.

4. Serves as a credible expert advisor to peers and leadership on the appropriateness of current and future technologies based on the highest level of Total Cost of Ownership, Return on Investment, and strategic value to our business.

5. Develops and fosters relationships with business stakeholders and information technology management. Maintains in-depth knowledge of business strategies, initiatives and goals as well as industry trends, regulatory requirements, and cybersecurity threats. Advises functional leaders and executives making strategic investments in applications, databases, technologies, systems, technical services, or processes as a result of architectural development and cybersecurity risk assessments.

6. Visualize and plan for outcomes in the future and sustain work in achieving the outcomes. Defines roadmaps and transition architectures to bridge the gap from current to future state for business, information and technology capabilities.

7. Utilizes exceptional communication skills verbally, in writing, and presenting with all levels of employees and management, capable of successful formal and informal communication. Ability to speak and write clearly and understandably at all levels of the organization. This position requires impeccable communication skills that bridge gaps between technical groups and business leaders.

8. Supports and promotes architecture governance and ensures architectures are aligned to business priority, comply with reference architecture standards, policy and regulatory requirements. Ensures Key Performance Indicators are established and tracked in all levels of work effort. Clearly defines success and implements the measurements to understand when success is achieved.
9. The IT Architect scope is the entire Enterprise. The scope and complexity will vary depending on the Architecture Role (Enterprise, Cybersecurity, Solution, Data, Infrastructure). It includes the people, processes, information and technology of the enterprise, and their relationships to one another and to the external environment. Peer group is individual contributor and leading leaders.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Requires Bachelor’s degree or equivalent of six plus years of work experience in a related field.

Architecture certification is required in designated area.

Requires eight plus years of current and progressive experience in architecture at the enterprise-scale, including two plus years' experience with implementing and adapting Architecture Frameworks and architecture modeling and three plus years’ experience in a healthcare environment.

Requires proficient understanding of regulatory and compliance mandates, including but not limited to HIPAA, HITECH, PCI, Sarbanes-Oxley. In addition, requires technical project experience designing, developing, integrating, and implementing solutions to resolve complex technical and business issues. As is typical in this industry, variable shifts or on-call hours and responding to off hour paging may be required.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Additional related education and/or experience preferred.

title: Public Sector Sales, Amazon Connect
description:
7+ years of technology related sales experience.
BA/BS degree preferred or equivalent work experience required.
Direct sales or specialized sales experience working with Public Sector customers.
This position can be remote, but candidates must be based near an AWS office location (Arlington, Boston, Herndon, New York City, Washington D.C.)

Do you like helping customers implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve technical problems? Would you like to do this using the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have the consultative and leadership skills to help customers succeed with their cloud efforts? Do you have a background in Public Sector Contact Centers, and a passion for driving innovation into existing IT organizations?

Amazon Web Services is looking for Specialized Sellers to help establish Amazon Connect as the market leader for Contact Center as a Service (CCaaS). Amazon Connect was designed from the ground up to be omnichannel, it provides a seamless experience across voice, chat and other channels for your customers and agents leveraging AWS. Amazon Connect is an industry leading scalable, flexible, reliable omni-channel Contact Center as a Service platform leveraging the latest AWS Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) tools to deliver world-class customer experiences.

You will have enterprise sales experience in areas such as Contact Center, CCaaS, telecommunications, CRM/ERP applications, and/or the integration of these complex solutions. As an Amazon Connect Sales Specialist in this fast growing, exciting space you will have the opportunity to help drive the growth and shape the future of a service category that will have a significant impact on a customers’ business.

Your responsibilities will include building and managing a healthy sales pipeline focused on driving revenue, adoption, and market penetration. You will possess a proven track record and background that enables them to lead a sales effort that will include teaming with AWS Senior Public Sector Account Managers, Solutions Architects, Partners and engagements at the CxO level within AWS Public Sector accounts. The successful candidate will also possess a business background that enables them to drive an engagement and interact at the CxO/VP level, as well as a technical understanding that enables them to easily interact with developers and technical architects. You should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions, and work cross-organizationally to build consensus.

Enjoy working with Public Sector customers. The role of a Specialized Seller requires someone who simultaneously acts as a market maker, operator, and general manager for their own customer accounts. With a focus on customer outcomes, they must work to win new customers, grow existing customers, secure lighthouse customers, drive revenue for new services, and develop strategic partnerships.

Industry experience selling Contact Center, CCaaS, telecommunications, CRM/ERP applications, and/or the integration of these complex solutions
Proven track record in creating net new demand which builds a sustainable business.
Experience managing large Public Sector customer accounts across a geographical territory.
Communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with customer executives, IT management, and internal stakeholders.
This position can be remote, but candidates must be based near an AWS office location (Arlington, Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Cupertino, Dallas, East Palo Alto, Herndon, Houston, Irvine, Minneapolis, New York City, Portland, San Diego, San Francisco, Washington D.C., Sunnyvale, Santa Monica, Seattle, Tempe).

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

title: Senior Cloud Architect
description:
Senior Cloud Architect
Fort Wayne, IN, USA Virtual Req #825
Wednesday, June 2, 2021
The Sr. Cloud Architect is responsible for the design, implementation, and support of the Azure cloud infrastructure environment, globally.Areas of focus include virtual machines, storage accounts, application gateways, load balancers, network security groups, availability sets, App services, Azure databricks, sql services, sql managed instances, Azure migrate, software defined network, high availability capabilities, disaster recovery and best practices and standards.Additionally, serves in a mentoring role for all IT team members to keep them educated on cloud technologies.

Functions and Responsibilities
Collaborate with business leaders, application owners, infrastructure teams and other stakeholders, helping to ensure that infrastructure is designed, built, configured, maintained, secured and documented appropriately.
Stay abreast of the latest infrastructure technologies and market trends to determine how they may impact the business. Contribute to the long-term Azure infrastructure strategy. Identify ways to apply new technologies to reduce costs and improve capabilities.
Provide technical leadership to infrastructure teams, aiding them in delivering major projects.
Ensure exceptional system uptimes using high availability, fault tolerance, load balancing and disaster recovery technologies.
Identify inefficiencies in existing Azure infrastructure and recommend solutions for improvement. Reduce costs where possible through right-sizing, consolidation, simplification, scaling and automation.
Provide operational support and knowledge transfer to infrastructure teams. Serve as a subject matter expert, giving guidance and advice to team members.
Research and review competing solutions. Make impartial and detailed recommendations. Present cost justifications for new purchases.
Assist the business in making the transition from a traditional on-premises private cloud to Microsoft Azure. Drive the adoption of IaaS, PaaS, SaaS, and *aaS (All “as a Service”) technologies.
Participate in the hiring process by conducting technical interviews, evaluating candidates, and making recommendations for hiring.
Qualifications and Preferred Skills

Good judgment and analytical skills; strong organizational skills
Strong project management skills and experience managing remote locations
Minimum of 10 years of related experience supporting enterprise infrastructures, including platform/system administration, system design and support.
Five years’ experience supporting Windows Server environments
Proficient in PowerShell
High level of expertise with all Azure cloud technologies, including servers, storage and software defined networks
High level of expertise in planning, design, procurement, implementation, administration, and support of
Global cloud environment (as listed previous)
Microsoft server technologies, including Windows Server, System Center, Active Directory, DNS and supporting server technologies
Back up and Disaster Recovery (DR)
Ability to effectively
Solve infrastructure issues of all types in a timely manner based on priority
Predict and manage the performance and capacity of the cloud environment
Identify and apply rapidly changing technology to satisfy business needs for excellence
Conduct and prepare feasibility studies; develop project estimates for cost, time and resources; complete cost/benefit analysis
Communicate with a broad range of technical personnel, end users, management, and vendors, especially for the purposes of presentation, troubleshooting, and follow-up
Establish and maintain a high level of user trust and confidence
Document thoroughly and completely in a variety of formats
Education and Certification Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent work experience.
Cloud Architect certifications for Microsoft Azure and/or Amazon Web Services (AWS) Microsoft Certified System Engineer (MCSE), Microsoft Certified System Administrator (MCSA) or Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP)



SIRVA Worldwide Relocation and Moving is a global leader in moving and relocation services, offering solutions for mobility programs to companies of every size. title: Staff AWS Systems Architect
description:
Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world’s leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our 22,000 employees do the can’t be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.
Are you motivated to work in an environment that will challenge you, force you to continuously innovate, and work on solutions that make a difference for our customers? Do you want to be part of a transformation that leverages the AWS cloud to build and deliver new capabilities? If so, there is a future for you to support a portfolio of highly visible and strategic programs at Peraton that are developing solutions with Amazon Web Services (AWS)..
Peraton’s Civil & Health sector is seeking a Staff AWS Systems Architect to support work in Washington, DC. Telework/remote support is possible for this role.
Roles & Responsibilities: ·
Works as part of a team of cloud experts to develop solutions for AWS account administration, and to build and administer AWS environment
Collaborates with application teams, infrastructure engineers, software engineers, and system administrators to develop cloud solutions and hybrid solutions to bridge on premise systems with the cloud
Identifies cloud cost optimizations and efficiencies to be gained
Analyzes AWS service offerings with regards to efficiency and security posture, and makes recommendation to the customer
Performs technical planning, system integration, verification and validation, cost, risk, supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems
Performs advanced systems modeling, simulation, and analysis of new and existing AWS services
Acts as a subject-matter expert to multiple tasks and/or projects
Provides guidance and work leadership to less-experienced systems engineers
Serves as a liaison with clients, participating in meetings as needed
Maintains current knowledge of advancements in AWS and relevant technology as assigned
Participates in special projects as required

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree and 14 years of experience -OR- a Master’s Degree and 12 years of experience -OR- a PhD and 9 years of experience
Minimum of three years’ experience directly working with systems hosted on Cloud platforms
Infrastructure automation experience
AWS Associate Level Certification
Demonstrated experience defining system requirements for new or existing computer systems in AWS
Demonstrated experience designing and implementing end-to-end system solutions in AWS
Knowledge of planning, design, and implementation tasks necessary to support a large enterprise system.
US Citizenship in order to obtain and maintain a Top Secret security clearance

Preferred Qualifications:
Active Top Secret with SCI and Polygraph Clearance
Multiple AWS Associate level Certifications or AWS Professional level Certification
Experience with Linux and Windows operating systems
DevOps, SecOps, or DevSecOps experience
Experience leading technical planning and system integration workflows and methods.
STEM Degree

The yearly compensation range for this role is: Minimum $155,000 to Maximum $200,000. The successful candidate will be offered a yearly compensation that aligns with their individual skills and experience as it directly relates to the position requirements. In addition to the yearly salary, Peraton provides a variety of benefits to include: health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO).
