title: Mid-Level Software Engineer- Platform (Fully Remote Availabl...
description:
Due to the number of applications we receive, we do not sponsor work-related visas. Position can be fully remote.

Foundant is hiring for a Software Engineer opportunity with a focus on skills and experience in building out modern, distributed, modular systems in a cloud native environment. This position will be working on our Platform team to build out a microservices architecture to satisfy the needs of the business for our client-facing and internal systems.
The successful candidate will have at least 6 years of software engineering experience working on incrementally more difficult problems over that time, ranging from simple bug fixes to complex logic and design problems. We are looking for an exceptionally strong team player that understands the dynamics of building enterprise class software solutions in a decoupled but cohesive environment. The provided solutions must be resilient, self-healing, extensible, scalable and can stand the test of time as Foundant grows over the next 5-10 years.
You will be building solutions ranging from simple services to complex domain-driven contexts in a cloud native/DevOps environment using atomic, scalable and high quality microservices. A “nice-to-have” set of experiences would include having migrated legacy systems to a new architecture over time and the complexities that this endeavor entails.
As part of our engineering team, you will be responsible for enhancing and maintaining the functionality of Foundant’s products, ensuring coding standards and best practices are followed, and contributing to our efforts to improve internal processes. You will work with our product team to understand new functionality requirements and priorities and will also work with our architect and Director of Engineering to understand current and planned architectural and strategic product direction.
Experience Areas (the more of these you have, or can speak to, the better) :
Development experience in one or more of the following languages:
Golang
Python
.NET Core (C#)
SOLID Principles
Working knowledge of SQL and No-SQL persistence approaches
Working knowledge of microservices development and relevant technologies such as orchestration, service discovery, service gateways and proxying in a cloud native environment
Building distributed systems
Containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes
DevOps culture and its importance in building distributed systems
Microservice solutions
Building and enhancing service API’s
Using an Enterprise Service Bus to solve problems
Working in a Lean-Agile Engineering environment
Strong Test-Driven Development (TDD)
Behavior-Driven Development (BDD)
Strong iterative delivery experience in an agile environment
Analyzing, diagnosing, proposing and implementing solutions to user problems
Microservice application development experience
Cloud Native delivery with one or more public cloud provider (AWS, Azure, GCP)
CI/CD delivery
Infrastructure as Code (TerraForm/CloudFormation)
Working with a Product Organization to design solutions

Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Strong interpersonal skills
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing
Ability to facilitate resolution of issues across teams (inside and outside of Engineering)

title: Principal Cloud Architect - Telecommute
description:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
This is a key leadership role within the Payer Engineering leadership team. As an Architect at OptumInsight Payer, you will partner with both the lines of business and software delivery leadership to build and drive architecture blueprints and multi-year roadmaps that act as guides for achieving the long-term strategic plans of the enterprise. We are looking for a strong leader who is collaborative, a self-starter, can take ownership / accountability and drive results. In this role you will take on some of the toughest challenges facing our business and will act as a key consultant and guide in achieving our long-term strategy. Your ability to think and plan strategically while solving immediate business problems impacting our clients and will play a pivotal role in understanding and shaping our strategy and approach. This person needs to be comfortable dealing with complexity and ambiguity. This individual will be involved across many aspects of architectural solution, design, build, engineering and technical implementation of solutions and capabilities.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to telecommute* from anywhere within United States as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Create and manage architectural designs that describe the strategy, business outcomes, capabilities, services, processes, information, and data that together will realize our Payer vision, goals, and strategic objectives
Work with senior business and technology leaders to develop, recommend, and execute strategic and tactical business and technology architecture roadmaps
Lead and facilitate architecture assessments and reviews during business ideation, discovery, and program/project execution to ensure alignment with business goals and strategies. Identify gaps and opportunities and recommend business and technology solutions
Build end-to-end solution plans that define the ideal and future state systems solution, scope of solution initiatives, solution delivery sequencing through architecture transition states, and assumptions and risks
Analyze and evaluate current technology environment to detect critical deficiencies (architecture optimization, maintain PADU balance of ecosystem, modernization) and collaborating with Enterprise Architecture from other lines of business and development team architects to recommend solutions for improvement
Provide in-depth solution architecture support during program/platform/product solution analysis and design to ensure roadmap alignment
Champion assigned application architecture through any governance gates and collaborate with quality teams to drive continuous improvement for technology solutions
Reuse existing corporate and business unit product capabilities where they fit
Identify and use applicable architecture patterns, structures, and standards
Work ahead of the development teams to ensure development teams have a solid design in place and a good understanding of the technical solution when it is time to build it
Understand security threats and patterns comprehensively and ensures adherence to all regulatory initiatives. HIPAA, PHI, PII, locational data restrictions, contractual, etc.
Stay current on new industry wide threat vectors and ensures processes are updated to avoid or remediate
Actively mentor team members, through code reviews, brown bags, tech talks, design reviews
You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s in engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience
10+ years of experience in leading IT Product/Platform organizations with a proven track record of delivering on optimum architectural solution for Transformation, Platform Modernization, Azure/AWS Cloud Adoption and Digital Programs
5+ years of experience as a hands-on enterprise architect, solutions architect, or similar role in a large enterprise
Experience with software automation including test automation, deployment automation, database management automation, operations automation
Experience delivering software to a Public and/or Private cloud utilizing IaaS and/or PaaS cloud paradigms
High proficiency in developing visual representations of architectural solutions
Ability to estimate the financial impact of technical architecture alternatives
Proven record of software application delivery focusing on open source commodity solutions
Demonstrated ability to apply process, architecture and software engineering principles, methods and tools to business challenges
If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders
Preferred Qualifications:

title: AWS Big Data Developer / Architect (Remote)
description:
Black Knight is the premier provider of integrated technology, services, data and analytics that lenders and servicers look to first to help successfully manage the entire loan life cycle. Our deep understanding of regulatory and compliance issues complements the knowledge, technology and solutions we offer to help our clients achieve their business goals. Black Knight offers leading software systems; data and analytics offerings; and information solutions that facilitate and automate many of the business processes across the mortgage life cycle
JOB FAMILY DESCRIPTION
As an AWS Architect / Developer for Big Data applications at Black Knight, you will join a dedicated team who is responsible for creating and driving the technical strategy of a premier Black Knight public cloud based set of applications. You will partner with business, product, and self-managed agile teams to craft highly scalable, flexible, and resilient cloud (private and public) architectures that provide durable solutions to business problems. You will help guide the design and delivery (hands on) of complex integrations involving UI, backend API, AWS, and onPrem components. You will accelerate and influence the adoption of modern technologies to reduce cost of ownership and the speed and accuracy of delivery to solidify and extend Black Knight’s competitive advantage. You will collaborate with product, business, and agile team members to deliver value across all products.
GENERAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Determines specifications, plans, designs, and develops moderately complex software solutions, utilizing appropriate software engineering processes and the Agile SAFe framework – either individually or in concert with project team.
Architect and develop systems designed to run natively in and across public cloud providers and onPrem solutions.
Uses a variety of platforms to provide automated systems applications addressing business needs.
Develops microservice applications and custom integration solutions, generally for one business segment; solutions include enhancements and interfaces, functions, and features.
Provides solid knowledge and skill regarding the integration of applications across the business segment.
Works directly with AWS and Container services, technologies, and teams.
Provides design recommendations based on long-term IT organization strategy.
Recommends programming, development standards, procedures, and programming architectures for code reuse.
Understands and consistently applies the attributes and processes of current application development methodologies.
Ensures Black Knight technology vision and direction is observed in existing and proposed architectures.
Researches and acquires knowledge in emerging technologies and apply knowledge to proposed business solutions.
Uses Java object-oriented approaches in designing, coding, testing, and debugging.
Will assist in resolving support problems as necessary.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
EDUCATIONAL GUIDELINES
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience.
AWS Professional Certifications a plus (Cloud Practitioner, Associate Solution Architect, etc)
SAFe Agilist (SA), SAFe Practitioner (SP) or SAFe Scrum Master (SSM) certifications a plus
GENERAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Experience working with AWS Technologies, such as EC2, s3, RDS, Lambda, EMR, etc.
Experience with Java
Experience with Big Data Technologies such as Spark or Hadoop desired
Experience with Python a plus
Experience with source code management tools such as TFS, Git, Gradle or Maven
Familiarity with relational database technologies such as MS SQL, Oracle, Aurora, MySQL, or others
Proficiency with source code management including CI/CD pipelines
Proficiency in solutions design and requirements definition disciplines leveraging model driven design-based tools and techniques including conceptual solution component models, business process models, use cases, etc.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization (e.g., executive, management, individual contributors).
Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, team, and time management skills.
Ability to persuade and influence others on the best approach to take.
Ability to estimate work effort for project sub-plans or small projects and ensure the project is successfully completed.
Positive outlook, strong work ethic, and responsive to internal and external customers and contacts.
Ability and willingness to act in the role of teacher, mentor, and coach.
A thorough understanding of design patterns and their application.
Ability to define, communicate a shared architectural vision to ensure developed system is fit for its intended purpose.
Familiarity working in a Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) leveraging Agile principles.
Willingness to act as a servant architectural leader to an agile team.
DESIRED SKILLS (Not required)
Familiarity around data services such as Glue, Athena, and Redshift
Familiarity with REST API concepts and technologies and tools such as OpenAPI/Swagger
Experience with RHEL
Familiarity with strangler approaches to decompose monolith-based applications
Experience in delivering solutions utilizing microservices based architectures
Experience building applications designed to run natively within and across public cloud providers
Experience integrating public cloud applications and services with on premise systems
Familiarity with tools and concepts such as jUnit and Gherkin/Cucumber
Understanding of TDD (Test Driven Development) and BDD (Behavioral Driven Development)
Familiarity with contemporary cloud native architectures, taking advantage of autonomous services and other unique cloud capabilities, such as serverless compute
Understanding and experience with a container-based technology such as docker
Experience with Sagemaker
Familiarity with nonrelational database technologies such as DynamoDB, Mongo, or Redis
Knowledge of financial services or mortgage industry
Applications Architect IV
Expert professional role. Works independently on many information technology projects frequently as a project leader and subject matter expert. Works on large, complex architecture issues or projects that require increased skill in multiple IT functional areas. Requires extensive knowledge of architecture issues, techniques and implications across all existing computer platforms. May manage or serve as a project leader for information technology projects or the applications architecture components of projects. Must have extensive knowledge of applications architecture. May coach more junior staff. Typically requires twelve (12) or more years of experience in information technology with at least eight (8) years of experience working in applications architecture.
Black Knight is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, and protected veteran or military family status. Our employees’ diversity is our strength, and when we embrace our differences, it makes us better and brighter. Black Knight’s commitment to inclusion is at the core of who we are, and motivates us in how we do business each and every day.
Location:
Jacksonville, FL
Time Type:
Full time

title: AWS Architect
description:
AWS Architect

Job Location: Charlotte, NC

Join our team

Centric Consulting is not the typical consulting company. We live our core values and bring them with us in all we do for our clients and community. Our core purpose is simple: every day we strive to provide unmatched customer and employee experiences and foster a culture of respect, diversity, and transparency. It’s this culture, our people, and delivery that come together to make Centric a trusted advisor to local businesses.
Our Charlotte business unit strives to live out our Centric core values through a culture of respect, diversity and transparency. Our experienced Charlotte team members deliver unmatched business consulting and IT consulting solutions. We’re looking for an AWS Architect to join our growing team.
A successful candidate will have the following:
Proven experience assessing our client’s workload and technology landscape for Cloud suitability, development of business case and Cloud adoption roadmap.
Proven knowledge of AWS platform and tools.
Ability to quickly establish credibility and trustworthiness with key stakeholders in client organization.
AWS architecture & administration – understanding of how to deploy a variety of scalable tiers of an AWS environment (e.g., spinning up clusters).
Experience with Infrastructure as Code in combination with Continuous Integration / Continuous Deployment (e.g., Terraform).
Experience designing and implementing applications and supporting cloud architecture in AWS (e.g., EC2, S3, API Gateway).
Experience working with modern data platforms (e.g., RDS, Glue, Aurora).
Experience with cloud security and identity management (cloud applications).
Able to recommend best technology solution for the client.
Study existing technology landscape and understand current application workloads.
Understand and document technical requirements from clients.
Define Migration strategy to move application to cloud.
Design the overall Virtual Private Cloud VPC environment including server instance, storage instances, subnets, availability zones, etc.
Design the HA / DR strategies
Design the AWS network architecture including VPN connectivity between regions and subnets, this is nice to have.
AWS Solutions Architect (Professional or Associate) certification desired

What makes Centric different?
Special Culture– Our people make us different. We have highly talented, intelligent individuals across a broad variety of disciplines – who are eager to learn from you and share their own expertise. We embrace fresh perspectives and each Don’t take our word for it – check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to get glimpse inside what makes us unique.
Impact– We think of ourselves as big company with a small company feel – a local player with global reach that combines business, technology and industry expertise.
Unmatched Experiences– We are allowed to be ourselves here. We are encouraged to be human. It’s at the root of who we are as a firm and why we’re here.
Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging– We are dedicated to creating and maintaining a culture where all people feel like they belong and are respected and valued regardless of who they are, where they are from and what experiences they’ve had. We believe a Centric Together work environment is essential to what we do.
Innovation– We value passion, determination, perseverance and innovation. We are inspired because we believe in what we are doing and where we are going.
Passion for the greater good– We are steadfast in our devotion to the communities we serve and in actively promoting employee involvement in community improvement projects.
The Nitty Gritty– Along with the standard health and 401k benefits, we offer self-managed PTO (manage your own work-life balance), a company paid trip, profit sharing, parental leave and remote working options for our employees. In fact, we wrote the book on creating remote culture – literally.

Centric believes the best solutions come from diverse teams. We strive to have an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be successful regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity.

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Guidewire is seeking an experienced Cloud Architect to support the design, implementation, and on-going maintenance of our Cloud Solutions. Your job will be to help ensure that our services, applications, and websites are available, performant and highly automated. The successful candidate will have a good mix of deep technical knowledge and a demonstrated background managing Cloud Applications.

Responsibiities
Apply continuous attention to technical excellence and good design principles resulting in a scalable, reliable, performant, and maintainable platform
Work with stakeholders to drive scope, requirements, and the architecture of our AWS hosted service
Work closely with engineers, test engineers, product owners and management to understand requirements, define and implement best practices and standards
Define, implement and document operational processes and procedures, with periodic review for efficiency and improvement
Discuss and defend architecture decisions with team of other architects
Mentor other team members and help them self-service their deployments on new features
Participate as the highest escalation point in 24x7 on-call rotation
Required Skills
Hands-on experience with AWS (EC2, Lambda, S3, RDS, VPC, Route 53, CloudWatch, IAM, EKS, etc.)
Strong understanding of AWS security and monitoring; experience implementing best practices
Extensive experience using CI-CD tools(git, Docker, Jenkins)
Extensive experience with Kubernetes and surrounding technologies: Nginx Ingress, Istio, Calico, Helm
Experience with micro services or service-oriented architecture
Experience managing and maintaining Tomcat web applications
Extensive experience with scripting and debugging on both Linux and Windows environments
Knowledge of MySQL and non-SQL data stores
Highly proficient in Linux/Unix, Shell and Python
Excellent written, verbal, and collaboration skills
5 or more years of experience in Git, Jenkins
4 or more years of experience with Docker, Kubernetes
5 or more years of experience supporting industry standard core CI-CD infrastructure components: Nexus/Artifactory, Code Coverage tools, Security tools etc
5 or more years of experience with logging infrastructure such as ELK/EKC, SumoLogic, Splunk, LogStash.
5 or more years of experience with automation frameworks such as: Terraform, Ansible, Chef
5 or more years of experience implementing systems within a complex secure network in AWS Cloud and various communiocation methods
5 or more years of experience Automation/DevOps experience
7 or more years of experience with Python, Perl, Shell, UNIX/LINUX experience
3 or more years of experience with Monitoring and Alerting Tools: CloudWatch, Prometheus, Grafana, Zabbix, Pagerduty
Extensive experience with at least one programming language such as Python, Go or similar
Education
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent work experience
#LI-Remote

About Guidewire
Guidewire is the platform P&C insurers trust to engage, innovate, and grow efficiently.

Guidewire combines core, data, digital, analytics, and AI to deliver our platform as a cloud service. More than 400 insurers, including the largest and most complex in the world, run on Guidewire.

As a partner to our customers, we continually evolve to enable their success. We are proud of our unparalleled implementation track record with 1000+ successful projects, supported by the largest R&D team and partner ecosystem in the industry. Our Marketplace provides hundreds of add-ons that accelerate integration, localization, and innovation.

Guidewire Software, Inc. is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to an inclusive workplace, and believe that a diversity of perspectives, abilities, and cultures is a key to our success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, marital status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or disability. All offers are contingent upon passing a criminal history and other background checks where it's applicable to the position.

Disability Accommodations and Guidewire’s Appeals Process. Guidewire provides accommodations to the hiring process to create a fair opportunity for candidates with disabilities to contend for open positions. Accommodation requests should be directed to (650) 356-4940 or Accommodations@guidewire.com. If things do not go as hoped, we invite you to use our appeals process. Guidewire promises to independently review any denied accommodation and any decision not to offer you the position. The appeals process is the same in either case. Within five business days of receiving a notice of denial of an accommodation, or receiving a notice of your non-selection for a vacancy, call (650) 356-4940 or e-mail Accommodations@guidewire.com to make an appeal. Guidewire will assign a new decision-maker to review the request and/or hiring decision, who will then notify you in writing of a decision within 10 business days.

title: Lead Endpoint Security Engineer - Remote OK
description:
59981BR
Technology & Engineering
Operations & Technology
Responsibilities
This role is a part of the Cyber Infrastructure Security Architecture & Engineering team, responsible for security technology that supports the entire NBCUniversal enterprise. You'll own product strategy and service management for a key Cyber Security practice area.
Develop, plan, and implement a strategy for continually evolving host monitoring and protection in support of our overall NBCUniversal Cyber Security vision. Create a roadmap and drive our progress along it.
Partner with the technical operations teams to enhance, maintain and sustain our endpoint security platforms, including anti-malware, system hardening, and EDR. Deliver security services smoothly in a global, 24x7 enterprise.
Work with architects and engineers to build the tech for your roadmap and meaningfully move the needle for our security capabilities. Lead and influence design, development, and implementation across teams.
Understand and empathize with our Cyber Security stakeholders (such as NBC News, Sports, Universal Pictures, and Parks & Resorts). Ensure our services are real solutions that help our businesses deliver world-class content and experiences - securely.
Be a point of a contact for engagement and escalations and keep services focused toward SLAs and key milestones. Value accountability and manage expectations deftly.
Mentor engineers and other technologists to develop NBCUniversal’s security mindset. Help them understand the domain, ask hard questions, think strategically, and grow as security professionals.
Qualifications/Requirements
Deep technical understanding of multiple platforms, products, and concepts in the endpoint protection space such as: Exploit mitigation, anti-virus/malware, telemetry and monitoring tools, and management tooling across Windows, Linux and Mac.
Strong communication abilities, a desire to build consensus, and a comfort relaying technical and security principles and decisions to a wide range of audiences
Experience designing and operating security tools and services at enterprise-scale
Experience working and scaling services in cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Comfort engaging in deeply technical efforts while keeping a strategic view and staying focused on key goals
An understanding of security risk and a willingness to make risk-based decisions balancing the urgent and the important
A thirst for improvement and an inclination to thoughtfully challenge the status quo
Desire to try things and iterate on them, fail fast, and focus on features that matter

Experience working with vendor-integrated systems and appliances, broadcast systems, open-source host protection software (Santa, osquery, etc.), or commercial EDR platforms
Understanding threat intelligence, ATT&CK framework, Cyber Kill Chain, or the Pyramid of Pain, and how they fit into developing internal security strategy
Orchestrating security tools across complex environments to improve IR and investigations
Data-driven decision making, light data analytics, and metrics/data visualization
Comfort with scripting or software development
Exposure to security compliance requirements/frameworks such as ISO27001, PCI/DSS, NIST 800-53, etc.

Technology

From broadcast and cable networks, news and sports platforms, to film, world-renowned theme parks and a diverse suite of digital properties, we take pride in all that we do and all that we represent. It’s what makes us uniquely NBCU. Here you can create the extraordinary. Join us.

title: Big Data Solutions Architect
description:

Applicants must have strong written and oral communication in English.
—
Big Data Solutions Architect
Blue Orange Digital is looking for a Big Data Solutions Architect to join our talented multi-disciplinary team.
Blue Orange is looking for an experienced Big Data Solutions Architect with significant experience in enterprise Data Lake & Data Warehouse initiatives. We build modern data analytics platforms for our clients that incorporate advanced analytics and machine learning to solve business problems. Blue Orange Digital works across multiple industries, this role provides an exciting set of experiences across a wide range of domains. This person will work directly with our client's leadership to help define the architecture of the future enterprise data platform. They will work closely with stakeholders and team members to determine the needs of the platform and design solutions that can allow the company to use data more efficiently and build trust in it. The person who fills this role will get a chance to work with multiple subject areas from Supply Chain to Finance to IoT.
Responsibilities
Design a cutting edge architecture for a Modern Data Platform that includes batch and streaming use cases.
Analyze Client Needs and Requirements in order to design robust solutions
Design and thoroughly document Software and Data Architectures for the client needs
Work with stakeholders across the client's teams to understand their needs and make recommendations.
Communicate solutions effectively with clients and team members
Monitor progress and adjust architecture/decisions as needed
Establish best practices and bake them into solution designs
Consider security, performance, quality
Create POCs to kickstart the development for the team.
Evaluate new technologies
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
8+ years of enterprise IT experience across data engineering, software engineering, DevOps or architecture roles.
Excellent verbal and written English communication.
5+ years of experience of Cloud computing experience.
5+ years of experience implementing Data Lake & Data Warehouse platforms.
Experience with AWS Glue, AWS Redshift
In-depth working knowledge in Big Data & Analytics
Preferred Qualifications
AWS certification, at the associate level (Solutions Architect or Developer), or specialty (Big Data) a strong advantage.
Demonstrated leadership in the fields of big data, data warehousing or data science.
Understanding of Apache Hadoop and the Hadoop ecosystem. Experience with one or more relevant tools (Sqoop, Flume, Kafka, Oozie, Hue, Zookeeper, HCatalog, Solr, Avro).
Experience with streaming data systems and IoT applications.
Hands-on experience in designing enterprise data models.

title: Cloud Architect (Remote Position)
description:
SUMMARY OF POSITION
The Cloud Architect designs and develops cloud-native, cloud-first (CNCF) infrastructure and platform services on AWS in compliance with best practices. The Cloud Architect specifies and implements the AWS account structure, IaC mechanisms and templates, application, security, networking and monitoring services consumed by development and data analytics teams.
Working closely with the CTO and peers, the Cloud Architect drives the adoption of cloud infrastructure and services across Registry and other business units. The Architect develops new usage patterns and plays an active role in the everyday use of cloud services.
The Cloud Architect reviews infrastructure and application designs for compliance with architectural norms and AWS best practices. In addition, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to build a team of infrastructure, platform and DevOps Engineers.
This is a great opportunity for a Cloud Architect to implement a greenfield architecture that supports our data-centric, life sciences-focused business.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
The Cloud Architect will:
Translate project-specific needs into a cloud structure that will address those needs
Review existing data integration strategy and workflow processes, and develop a plan for continuous improvement based on cloud-native architecture
Design and document the cloud environment from a holistic point of view, considering AWS account design, IaC, data storage and retrieval, caching, containerization, networking, security, cost controls and application support and monitoring in line with the tenets of the Well-Architected Framework
Document and, as needed implement, reference architectures
Implement a design review process
Implement scalable, highly available, fault-tolerant and reliable infrastructure and automation in support of the development and analytics teams
Serve as technical consultant and mentor to software development and data analytics teams
Participate in the development and implementation of a new CI/CD pipeline and artifact repository with automated testing for steady-state production release at any time.
Work closely with the CTO to ensure we have an architecture that is flexible and scalable, enabling us to manage and access different types of life sciences data and workloads
Hire and grow a team of infrastructure Engineers and DevOps professionals
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other technical discipline.
Minimum of 8-10 years total experience, 4+ in cloud infrastructure
AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional
Proven experience designing, developing and documenting a cloud-first architecture that supports a critical business function
Proficiency in at least one high-level programming language, Python preferred
A working understanding of distributed systems concepts and common problems and how to use AWS services to address them
Excellent communication and organizational skills
Experience managing a small-to-medium sized team a plus
PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES
Professionally mature
Ability to make sound business and technical decisions
Good listener
Demonstrates technical leadership
Accountable
Technically astute and current with modern principles and cloud computing norms
Willing and able to work across groups to educate and work cooperatively
Intellectually curious
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Remote position with the option of working in our Waltham, MA office as appropriate

title: Sr Principal Integration Solutions Architect
description:
Overview:
We are looking for a Senior Pricipal Integration Solution Architect to play a critical role in Waters digital transformation. This role can be remote. You will be joining a fast-paced, agile team that possesses a true passion for unlocking Waters data, making it discoverable and accessible to achieve strategic business goals. You will help Waters develop deep and broad usage of integration technologies, drive the adoption of API based architecture and elevate the technology landscape to the next level in the Waters digital transformation journey.
You must have a hands-on integration architecture experience. You will be responsible for implementing integration strategy, vision, provide an end-to-end view of how integrations fit together and identify opportunities to standardize the technology landscape for improved efficiency. You have proven experience in implementing large scale API solutions, including scalability, security, and performance, preferably using MuleSoft.

You have a deep understanding of integration technologies, stay up to date on industry best practices, and a passion for improving customer experience. A self-starter, excellent communication, and dedication to innovation are critical to this role.
Responsibilities:
Develop and drive Waters integration strategy, vision, and recommend industry standards/best practices
Translate business requirements into well-architected solutions that best leverage the Waters technology platforms and products
Setup architecture principles & standards and ensure adherence
Lead integration design reviews for various programs and projects
Engage and guide a team of Architects and Developers on API based integration technology
Define and evangelize integration patterns, domain-driven design, reusability, and automated testing
Partner with architects and other IT stakeholders in enhancing and implementing integration strategy and standardize/modernize integration across the enterprise
Lead and plan complex systems integrations, performance tuning, and integration testing
Improve processes, ensure proper documentation, and increase efficiency
Conduct technical workshops with internal teams & partners and lead integration POCs, prototypes, and pilots
Provide technology insights to the IT leadership teams and actively collaborates with product owners, business process owners, and business users
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology is required.
Over ten years’ experience architecting integration solutions
Demonstrated experiences in architecting services based integrations with at least two of the following:
MuleSoft or other platforms (e.g., TIBCO, IBM, Dell Boomi, WebMethods, etc.)
API Management solutions (Mashery, Apigee, AWS API Gateway, etc.)
Hand on experience with Java, J2EE, XML, and JSON
Demonstrated experience in integration patterns, methods, and technologies such as APIs, REST, EDI, ETL, message queues, event-driven, and micro-services
Experience with large scale implementation of API based integrations with message queues
Demonstrated experience implementing architecture with high-availability, reliability, performance testing, and tuning
Experience with Cloud/On-premise architectures, Network, and Security
Strong experience in agile development, test-driven development, and DevOps processes
Experience in defining and evangelizing strategies, best practices, standards, reusable components, and governance
Excellent communication skills & ability to influence key technical & non-technical stakeholders
Experience in implementing any streaming platform such as Solace or Kafka and experience in IoT are an additional plus
Excellent analytical, conceptual thinking, strategic planning, and execution skills to drive organizational change
Ability to articulate complex ideas, comprehend written and verbal communications, and possess excellent presentation skills
Strong desire to learn and be curious
Enthusiasm and commitment to deliver projects on time with high quality
Company Description:
Waters Corporation (NYSE: WAT), the world's leading specialty measurement company, has pioneered chromatography, mass spectrometry and thermal analysis innovations serving the life, materials, and food sciences for more than 60 years. With more than 7,000 employees worldwide, Waters operates directly in 35 countries, including 15 manufacturing facilities, with products available in more than 100 countries. Our team focuses on creating business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations to enable significant advancement in healthcare delivery, environmental management, food safety, and water quality.

Working at Waters enables our employees to unlock the potential of their careers. Our global team is driven by purpose. We strive to be better, learn and improve every day in everything we do. We’re the problem solvers and innovators that aren’t afraid to take risks to transform the world of human health and well-being. We’re all in it together delivering benefit as one to provide the insights needed today in order to solve the challenges of tomorrow.

Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It is our responsibility to actively implement programs and practices to drive inclusive behavior and increase diversity across the organization. We are united by diversity and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or protected Veteran status.
Key Words: Architect, Integration Architect, Solutions Architect, Mulesoft, TIBCO, IBM, Dell Boomi, WebMethods, Mashery, Apigee, ETL, Middleware, MQ, Microservice, API, REST, Java

title: Enterprise Data Architect
description:
ROLE SYNOPSIS
Data-Platform Architecture is a collaborative discipline, and it plays a critical role in the integration of our businesses. Data-Platform Architects connect all the digital disciplines and the consumers and procurers of IT, in order to create an integrated, flexible, effective Data-Platform architecture.
Data platform architecture specializes on our data and analytics platforms that provide the capability to progress data through its value chain: information > knowledge > insight > experience.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Strategy: You will be accountable for the overall data and analytics platform architecture including architecture vision, principles, technology reference model and roadmaps.
Design Authority: You will establish design authority for data and analytics platforms, endorsing design decisions through your own design authority and other decision forums as significance / impact dictates, ensuring implementation compliance.
Capability: You will build the data platform architecture team capability and ensure appropriate architecture resourcing levels to meet activity demand.
Architecture: You rigorously develop data-platform and data-solution architectures, seeking practical solutions that optimize and re-use capabilities. You will be seen by commercial teams as the source of technology guidance on the full range of architecture topics.
You will be responsible for building technical designs of platforms, services or products and will care passionately about the integrity of the Digital capabilities you develop. You will define future platform strategies and services, to support business need. You will collaborate with commercial colleagues to compare the cost implications of alternative strategies, as well as manage the governance of architecture. You will manage the balance of competing financial, technical and business requirements to produce optimal platform and solution architectures.
Technology: You are an excellent technologist and have a passion for understanding and learning. You will contribute to digital transformation initiatives from an architectural perspective, facilitating the delivery of solutions. You will bring good hands-on skills in key technologies, and an ability to rapidly assess new technologies with a commercial mindset.
Safety and Compliance: The safety of our people and customers is our highest priority. You will advocate and help ensure our architectures, designs and processes enhance a culture of operational safety and improve our digital security.
Team: You will lead several delivery teams directly or by influence. You will play an integral role in building the team’s skillset while demonstrating your leadership values through delegation, motivation and trust. You will not just lead, but "do".
Relationships: You will build strong relationships across the business and Digital teams, advising and influencing leaders on technology. You will act as a technology mentor within Digital teams and inspire people to engage with technology as a driver of change. You will understand the long-term needs of the solutions you are developing, and enable delivery by building a rapport with team members both inside and outside of client.
FORMAL EDUCATION
A Bachelor's (or higher) degree, ideally in Computer Science, MIS/IT, Mathematics, hard science, or equivalent work experience.
DESIRABLE CRITERIA
Experience in defining data and analytics platform strategy and architectures. You work closely with senior stakeholders to explain your vision and influence their thinking.
Establishing design authority for large architecture domains. You endorse design decisions within the scope of your own design authority, ensuring implementation compliance.
Enthusiastic about developing people and architecture discipline capability. You build high performance architecture teams with a strong sense of purpose and community.
A confirmed background in architecture with real-world experience of architecting, designing, and delivering transformational projects. You love envisaging the art of the possible and making that a reality.
Deep-seated functional knowledge of key technology sets. You are comfortable rolling up your sleeves, getting involved, and diving into delivery challenges.
Experience in being part of a tight-knit delivery team. You accomplish exceptional project outcomes in a respectful and supportive culture.
A proven grasp of architecture development and design thinking in an agile environment. You adapt delivery techniques to drive outstanding project delivery.
The ability to relate complex topics in simple and accessible language.
Essential Skills
Data and Analytics Platform Architectures and Technologies
Requirements Definition and Management
Solution Architecture
Technical Specialism
Systems Integration
Innovation
Data Analysis
Desirable Skills
Operational and Big Data Processing Architectures
Microsoft / Azure and AWS Data Platform Technologies
Emerging Technology Monitoring
Systems Design
User Experience Analysis
Business Risk Management
Capacity Management
Network Design
Service Acceptance
Systems Development Management
IT Strategy and Planning
Business Modelling
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $750.00 - $850.00 per day
Work Location:
Fully Remote
COVID-19 Precaution(s):
Remote interview process
Virtual meetings

title: Technical Architect [WFH / 100% Remote]
description:
We are looking to hire an experienced IT Architect to join our team in support of one of our clients that is undergoing an exciting transformation of their business, facilitated by a complete transformation of their technology environment.

This situation offers a unique opportunity for the right person to help guide and deliver on a new technology vision for the company.
This position will be responsible for leading the design and execution of IT technical, application and integration architectures.
The primary objective of this role is to ensure that our many new solutions are designed and implemented to produce a flexible, secure and highly resilient technical environment that supports our business.
You’ll be a key technical leader on the IT team, interfacing with business and IT leaders, as well as working in the trenches with our partners to deliver solutions.
The scope of work will focus primarily on technical strategy, design and implementation of new platforms and projects.
Responsibilities will include:
Lead the technical architecture and implementation of our transformation projects.
Technical hands-on delivery and troubleshooting key integrations.
Develop architectural and technical standards to guide the development of solutions and the selection of partners and 3rd party products.
Consult with project teams and business leaders to ensure we are incorporating sound technical considerations in the scope, time and cost of new projects.
Audit our partner performance and cost effectiveness to ensure we are getting good value and that our environments are performing to business expectations.
Work with our IT Business Operations Manager to evolve our IT processes to optimize our performance within the limits of our small team and heterogeneous partner environment.
Assist the CIO and leadership team as needed
Why we think this job is great:
It’s a remote full-time, 100% remote position where you’ll work from home with tech provided by the company
You’ll have clear goals and the training resources you need to deliver. How you execute and deliver is up to you
Eligible for benefits like medical, dental, vision.
Requirements:
Minimum of 10 years as an IT professional.
Minimum of 5 years working in an architecture role. Minimum of 5 years in a business facing IT role.5+ years in IT consulting preferred.
Strong, current, and hands-on technical skills and experience including architecture, design, engineering, capacity planning, technical troubleshooting, networking, security.
Recent experience migrating applications and environments to public and private cloud solutions including: AWS, Azure, Rackspace, Google.
Depth of experience working in a heterogeneous technology environment that includes iSeries/AS400, SAP/Hybris, Salesforce, MS Dynamics, InforXA, Snowflake, Matillion, Qlik, AWS, Azure, Rackspace, Microsoft, SQL Server, and Apple.
Bachelor's degree required, masters in a technical field preferred.
About Us

Bold Business is a remote-first, global outsourced-solutions company with over $7B in service solutions over the past 25 years. Our international team helps the world’s leading companies transform their ideas into bold impacts. From Fortune 500 organizations looking to reduce operational costs by 40%-60% to fast-growth startups looking to scale, we work behind the scenes and empower companies to do more for less.

If you like to move fast and have a bias for action, you’ll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. We’re a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are.

title: Sr. Software Architect (Cloud Solutions) - Remote
description:
Job Description Summary
Job Description
Be part of something bigger!
BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most sophisticated global health issues.
By aligning and simplifying our work, our Integrated Diagnostic Solutions (IDS) business unit aims to drive growth and innovation around everything from integrated specimen management to diagnostic and Informatics solutions.
We are looking for a Cloud Architect to manage our cloud based Point of Care Informatics solutions. (AWS preferred). The ideal candidate will play a strategic role in designing and maintaining cloud systems required for our Point of Care Informatics products.
Responsibilities:
To serve as a primary technical associate of the R&D team in assisting in confirming customer success in creating applications and services on the AWS platform.
A solid understanding of cloud computing and technology systems, as well as experience designing and transferring applications to the cloud.
Understanding of software design/systems/architecture concepts and their application in a professional environment within a software team structure.
Understanding of different software development lifecycle methodologies, primarily Agile and SAFe
Create a well-informed cloud strategy and manage the adaption process. Regularly evaluate cloud applications, hardware, and software.
Develop and organize cloud systems working with OEM partner products.
Work closely with IT security to monitor the company's cloud privacy.
Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner.
Identify the top cloud architecture solutions to successfully meet the strategic needs of the BU.
Coach and mentor a small technical team of software engineers and testers.
Strong understanding of AWS core services
Hands-on experience working with AWS Lambda, SQS, S3, CloudWatch, Cognito, DynamoDB and API Gateway
A strong understanding of the SLA agreements on each AWS service and how they interact with each other
Experience with Docker and Kubernetes
Additional experience
Knowledge of Windows networking fundamentals
Performance optimization and profiling application
Demonstrated ability to comprehend and debug complex software systems
Experience working in a regulated (FDA) environment with medical instrumentation is a plus
Requirements:
BS (MS preferred)in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or relevant field.
8-10 years' experience designing, executing, and supporting IT cloud solutions.
Positive attitude and a strong commitment to delivering quality work.
Excellent knowledge of cloud computing technologies and current computing trends.
Effective communication skills (written and verbal) to properly articulate complicated cloud reports to management and other IT development partners.
Click on apply if this sounds like you!

title: Security Architect, US - Remote Opportunity
description:
What makes Gartner a GREAT fit for you? When you join Gartner, you’ll be part of a team with a no-limits mindset that helps the world become smarter and more connected. We’re the world’s leading research and advisory company that steers clients toward the right decisions with business and technology insights they can’t find anywhere else. Our associates enjoy a collaborative work environment with exceptional training and career development. If you like working with a curious, supportive, high-performing team, Gartner is the place for you.
Interested in learning more, view and register for any of our upcoming recruiting events here!
Position Summary
The security architect plays an integral role in defining and assessing security strategy, architecture and practices. This person will be required to effectively translate business objectives and risk management strategies into specific security processes enabled by security technologies and services.
Primary Responsibilities
Develop and maintain a security architecture process that enables the enterprise to develop and implement security solutions and capabilities that are clearly aligned with business, technology and threat drivers.
Develop and maintain security architecture artifacts (models, templates, standards and procedures) that can be used to leverage security capabilities in projects and operations.
Assess and manage vendor information security risk across the organization.
Participate in application and infrastructure projects to provide security planning advice.
Conduct threat modeling of services and applications that tie to the risk and data associated with the service or application.
Conduct security assessments of internal systems, applications and IT infrastructure as part of the overall risk management practice of the organization.
Review network segmentation to ensure least privilege for network access.
Ensuring software products meet regulatory and security compliance requirements.
SaaS providers
Cloud/infrastructure as a service (IaaS) providers
Assess the providers' SSAE 16 SOC 1 and SOC 2 audit reports (or alternative sources) for security-related deficiencies and required "user controls," and report any findings to the CISO and vendor management teams.
Conduct vulnerability assessments and other security reviews of systems, and prioritize remediation based on the risk profile of the asset and guidance from the CISO or other executive management.
Conduct code reviews of applications to determine security flaws or other issues that would impact the confidentiality, integrity or availability of the system.
Coordinate with DevOps teams to advocate secure coding practices and escalate concerns related to poor coding practices to the CISO or the individual responsible for the overall security direction.
Review security technologies, tools and services, and make recommendations to the broader security team for their use based on security, financial and operational metrics.
Take ownership of assignments & drive them to completion.
Work collaboratively across functional areas for innovation to turn new ideas into reality.

Job Requirements
Education
Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, information systems, cybersecurity or a related field.
Security and Technical Experience
The senior security architect should have 7-10 years of direct, documented and verifiable experience with the following:
Required Technical and Professional Expertise
Proven Communication, collaboration, and critical thinking skills
Experience working in security areas dealing with security controls, secure engineering, vulnerabilities, and audits, etc.
Documented experience and a strong working knowledge of the methodologies to conduct threat-modeling exercises on new applications and services
Working knowledge of cloud technologies with the ability to describe security concerns and what the impact might be for an organization.
Full-stack knowledge of IT infrastructure:
Applications
Databases
Operating systems (Windows, Unix and Linux)
Hypervisors
IP networks (WAN, LAN)
Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
10+ years of experience in the design and implementation of complex IT systems
5-7+ years of experience in Information Security and proven experience in security architecture assessment and/or third party/vendor risk management
Experience reviewing application code for security vulnerabilities
Experience with GRC tools and implementations
Direct, hands-on experience using vulnerability management tools
Strong familiarity with OWASP Top Ten, NIST, and CIS
Understanding and working experience with cloud/server/container security tools
Domain expertise in cloud network infrastructure technologies.

Required Certifications
The security architect will evidence his or her knowledge of security and risk management through ongoing continuing professional education. The ideal candidate will maintain one or more of the following certifications. CISSP,CCSP, AWS or Azure Security, CEH.
Job Requisition ID:45661

title: Systems Architect (Remote)
description:
Overview: Why Consider JAGGAER?
*
JAGGAER* is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.
*
What We’re Looking For: *
We are seeking an Architect who possesses architecture and design skills in building complex and scalable solutions. You should be passionate about new trends and technologies while realizing the challenges in modernizing existing applications.
Principal Responsibilities: Awesome Things You’ll Do:
Define product high-level design guidelines and select frameworks and libraries to be adopted.
Supervise and coordinate the assigned team and collaborate with Product Development manager to evaluate developers' performance.
Contribute in first person to the development of software, with particular attention to core and critical modules.
Maintain current knowledge of relevant technologies
Participate in functional discussions with Product Managers/Owners and provide designs and estimates required for the evolution of existing functionality and development of new functionality.
Collaborate with other technical teams to ensure successful cross product integrations and standards alignment
Position Requirements: What You Will Bring:
Bachelor’s degree or greater in a technical or scientific discipline.
Experience in organizing your own and team activities based on available experience and skills and given deadlines
Proven ability to analyze specific functional and business requirements and to estimate time/resource needs based on team skills and experience
Demonstrated experience delivering software within a SAAS multi-tenant environment with requirements for high availability/reliability.
More than 5 years of experience in independent design and development of server-side and web-based Java applications
Ideally proficient in full stack Java J2EE web application development including:
browser-based client development using modern JavaScript libraries (e.g. Dojo, React), CSS, DHTML, XHR and JSON messaging.
JavaScript packaging
Server-side development including Java servlets, JDBC, RESTful services, EAR and WAR configuration and deployment.
Knowledge of general MVC (model view control) methodologies and technologies. Preferred experience in using Spring frameworks.
Strong RDBMS experience related to efficiently querying and updating very large datasets.
Experience delivering ETL solutions from concept to production.
Prefer experience in:
Data warehouse concepts
Integrating Machine Learning, NLP, and Record Linkage concepts into ETL process flows.
tools, servers, and frameworks including Maven, SVN, Tomcat, Wildfly, Apache Server, Oracle, TensorFlow, AWS, SnowFlake. IntelliJ IDEA
What does success look like?
You are innovative: You independently investigate leveraging new technologies to improve our product frameworks
You are collaborative: You communicate directly and regularly with other engineering team members and product managers
You are driven: You take great pride and satisfaction in creating high quality, high performance application software.
About Our Benefits
JAGGAER offers you a flexible schedule & an exceptional work/life balance. We offer a generous benefits package including employee and family health, dental and vision coverage, reimbursement accounts for eligible medical expenses; company-paid life insurance, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability benefits; retirement plan with company match and plentiful paid time off benefits. Additional benefits include education and well-being reimbursements.
*
JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics.*
Job Type: Full-time

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
We’d love to hear from you if you like:
Start-up energy working with a brilliant and passionate team
Exponential growth (5 straight quarters of 50-100%+ quarter over quarter growth)
Flat structure and access to senior leadership for continuous mentorship
Meritocracy - we promote based on performance, not tenure
Rockstar teammates. You will be working with a strong team with prior work experience at Amazon, Microsoft, NVIDIA, Alibaba, etc.
About jerry.ai:
Jerry.ai is building a super app for your car that helps people optimize the cost and experience of owning a car (making ownership easy & affordable). There are 240M cars in the US alone. For most people, cars are one of the most expensive assets they own and families on average spend 20% of their income on car expenses, making this a massive market.
We have started with helping people optimize the cost of car insurance and our vision is to help people in every aspect of car ownership. Since our product launch, we have been growing really fast for the past 18 months and our users love the product (rating 4.5 in the app store). Jerry.ai is founded by serial entrepreneurs who previously built and scaled YourMechanic (“Uber for car repair,” the nation’s largest on-demand car repair company). We have raised over $50M+ in financing.
About the role:
We are looking for experienced software engineers who love tackling convoluted problems and coming up with clean, stable solutions that scale. The ideal candidate would be someone who has a genuine passion for designing and implementing elegant software solutions. They would also be intimately familiar (and up to date) with their development ecosystem for making sound decisions when it comes to choosing the right tool or library for the job. We expect our engineers to be able to contribute across the entire product stack, as well as collectively oversee the integrity of the codebase.
A few examples of the projects that we are working on:
Create a smart prediction engine for customer’s insurance coverage needs
Build predictive models on customer purchase behavior based on a large data set
Use telematics tracking to build customer driving risk profile
Responsibilities:
Developing front-end web and mobile applications with scalable back-end services and data processing pipelines.
Participate in the design and development of projects, either independently or in a team.
Participate in product decision making, providing feedback and suggestions for improvement.
Be self-sufficient and take responsibility of seeing projects through to successful conclusions.
Lead design and development of projects, either independently or in a team.
Provide mentorship to team members and participate in design decisions.
Be the gatekeeper of the codebase and ensure that it stays stable, readable, and free of technical debt.
Requirements:
1 + years of full-time software development experience.
B.S. degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
Strong software development fundamentals (data structures, algorithms, etc.).
Proficient with modern web application development with knowledge of JS ecosystems and open source web frameworks (e.g. NodeJS/React/GraphQL/PostgreSQL/Redshift/Redis/Kubernetes).
Knowledge of good practices, preferred design patterns, and writing idiomatic Javascript code.
Solid understanding of performance implications and scalability of code.
Keenness for writing good, meaningful tests and maintaining thorough test coverage.
Experience with large, complex codebases and know how to maintain them.
Good to have:
Experience with React Native.
Experience with GraphQL and Apollo.
Experiences working with Kubernetes clusters and Server-less applications on public clouds (e.g. AWS EC2).
3+ years of experience

title: Data Scientist- Remote
description:
Job Description – Data Scientist
As part of growing Data Science department at DMG, we are seeking a Data Scientist who is passionate about the data and thrives in a fast-paced environment to have a positive impact on the DMG business and the society. Data Science department develops tools, technologies, models to solve business problems and provide actionable insights by leveraging the large, complex datasets and domain expertise. Data Science department works in close coordination with other cross-functional business departments such as Data Engineering, Data Governance, and Product and Engineering.
Key Responsibilities
Proposes, designs, and develops (including coding) predictive and prescriptive solutions
Able to translate requirements into detailed functional specifications
Investigates, analyzes, preprocesses large structured and unstructured datasets; performs necessary checks for reasonableness, completeness and accuracy.
Develops, trains, validates, updates, and deploys the machine learning models to satisfy business and technical requirements
Automating an end-to-end process from procuring the raw data to converting into actionable insights (decisions, monitoring, etc.)
Contributes to the architecture and design for scalable and efficient model deployments, including automated data model pipelines
Communicates models, model results, and insights to internal stakeholders
Understands, follows, and support internal and external compliance requirements/standards
Creates and maintains productive relationships within the DMG technical community; keeps current with technology, methods, and best practices; participates in peer reviews and educating internal stakeholders
Job Qualifications
Bachelor’s in data science, engineering, mathematics, statistics/applied statistics, computer science or related quantitative field; advanced degree (Masters or PhD) is a plus
5+ years demonstrated experience designing, coding, developing, testing, and implementing predictive and prescriptive solutions at the product or enterprise level
Proficient with machine learning and deep learning techniques for both structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data, e.g., Regression, SVM, PCA, NLP, regression/decision trees, image processing/modeling
Proficient with data-science deployment using cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
Proficient in AI/ML models, libraries, packages, tools, and frameworks e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, Skikit-learn, Keras, Jupyter.
Proficient in mechanisms to extract and prepare data from diversified internal and external data sources (real-time or offline) using SQL, Python, Restful APIs
Proficient in containerization, virtual environments, integrated development environments, devOps techniques, data mining, streaming, and data analysis and visualization tools, e.g., Docker, Conda, Kaftka, Spark, Power BI
Works effectively in a team environment with high-level of accountability
Familiarity with data filtering, data cleansing, and outlier detection techniques
Experience in control and optimization techniques (mixed integer linear programming, convex optimization, constraints satisfaction problem, etc.) is a plus
Ability to handle and manage multiple concurrent assignments efficiently
Prior experience in facility management, HVAC, or services-based business is a bonus
Divisions Maintenance Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Sr. Java Developer
description:
WHO WE ARE
A leading B2B provider of identity verification technology. We are revolutionizing the way consumers transact by allowing businesses to quickly and seamlessly identify who they are doing business on any platform while protecting both parties. Join a global team that works with leaders in all industries to delivers best in class technology.
Our Trusted Identity Platform provides complete identity verification based on your level of risk so you can build your business with valid customers. Powered by AI for the highest speed and accuracy, omnichannel products enable seamless customer experiences to increase conversions in the digital economy. Scalable, secure and compliant (KYC, AML & GDPR), Acuant allows businesses to establish trusted identities from any location in seconds.
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
We are seeking a Software Engineer who is innovative, resourceful, and passionate about cloud products. Looking for game changers with a passion for software development and solving real world problems; not just someone who can code, but someone who is curious and is always game to try new things.
As a Software Engineer, not only are you an excellent programmer, you are also someone who sincerely enjoys the art of finding simple, efficient, and sustainable ways of solving problems.
At Acuant, we are building a unique digital identity platform to provide anti-fraud and regulatory compliance solutions to the financial services industry: traditional payments, emerging fintech, and marketplaces.
We are a highly distributed organization with offices in Los Angeles (US), New Hampshire (US), Spokane (US), Palo Alto (US), Tel Aviv (Israel) and Mexico City (Mexico), plus remote-work employees in other states and countries.
WHAT YOU BE RESPONSIBLE FOR
You will be responsible for empowering our clients to access and tune our Electronic DNA (eDNA) engines through the suite of APIs. Our eDNA engines are implementations of multiple machine learning models to identify the good and bad parties in a transaction. You will interact with one of the most powerful combinations of data platforms: Cassandra, Janus, Gremlin, and Solr.
Key qualifications:
5+ years of software industry experience working on complex SaaS based systems
Strong backend Java, and related technologies, building robust code
2 years or more developing, deploying and maintaining Web Services API
Experience with Micro-Services Architecture concepts and emerging patterns such as APIs, JAX-RS, REST/JSON

Ability to take abstract user requirements and build a product that addresses the underlying use case
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work within a small high achieving team, as well as independently
Self-driven, highly motivated, innovative
Desirable

Python or Perl

You will always be heard, decisions are collaborative
Competitive compensation
